Title: Department of Transportation - Human Trafficking Awareness, Training, and Response (See Someone, Save Someone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement a training program for transportation sector employees on the identification and reporting of suspected human trafficking victims; requiring transportation sector employers to certify by January 1, 2027, and each year thereafter that certain employees have completed the training program; requiring new employees to receive training within 90 days of hiring; removing civil and criminal liability for reporting of suspected trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop and implement training programs for transportation-sector employees on identifying and reporting human trafficking. It also mandates employers to certify employee training completion, establish reporting procedures, and implement prevention policies, including public service announcements at transit locations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Transportation-sector employees, transit agencies, and potential victims of human trafficking in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on training and policies related to human trafficking awareness, with no direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Clarifying the definition of "physical therapist assistant" as used in the Maryland Physical Therapy Act to mean an individual licensed by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners; increasing the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from 8 to 9; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices to licensees by electronic means, rather than first-class mail, unless the licensee requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the definition of 'physical therapist assistant', modifies the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, and changes the method of sending renewal notices to licensees from first-class mail to electronic means, with provisions for mailing by first-class if electronic delivery fails.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed physical therapists and physical therapist assistants in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes to licensing and renewal processes are unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Restrictions on Use - Solar Collector Systems - Alteration
Synopsis: Prohibiting a restriction on land use that increases the cost of installing a solar collector system by at least 5% over a certain cost or that reduces the efficiency of the system by at least 10% under a certain energy generation level; authorizing a community association to impose certain restrictions on the installation of solar collector systems in common areas or common elements; authorizing a community association to install a solar collector system in common areas or common elements under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits unreasonable restrictions on the installation of solar collector systems on private property, defines what constitutes unreasonable restrictions, and allows community associations to impose reasonable restrictions or prohibit installation in common areas. It also establishes rules for solar easements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or local community associations
stakeholders: Property owners, community associations, solar energy system installers, and residents in Maryland communities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying restrictions and providing guidelines for solar system installation, the bill may reduce legal and regulatory barriers, potentially lowering failure rates for small solar installation businesses.

Title: Public Safety - Food System Resiliency Council - Definitions and Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions related to the Food Resiliency Council; defining what constitutes "healthy food priority areas" as predominantly lower-income areas that have limited access to retail outlets that sell, affordable, healthy foods; defining "wasted food" as food not used for its intended purpose; requiring the Council to make recommendations to increase the availability of local foods, create market opportunities for Maryland food businesses, and expand access to small scale food production infrastructure; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council to address food insecurity, promote local food production, reduce food waste, and improve access to healthy foods, especially in underserved areas. It sets reporting requirements and strategic planning to enhance the state's food system resilience.
responsible_party: Maryland Food System Resiliency Council within the Office of Resilience in the Department of Emergency Management.
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those in food insecure and low-income areas, local food businesses, schools, and food organizations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to create additional market opportunities and expand local food infrastructure, which could help small food businesses succeed and reduce their failure rate.

Title: Health Insurance - Access to Nonparticipating Providers - Referrals, Additional Assistance, and Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing the June 30, 2025, termination date for certain provisions of law related to referrals to and reimbursement of specialists and nonphysician specialists who are not part of a carrier's provider panel; prohibiting certain carriers from imposing utilization review requirements other than would be required if the covered benefit was provided by a provider on the carrier's provider panel under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset date for laws requiring insurers to establish procedures for members to request referrals to specialists and nonphysician specialists outside of provider panels, especially for mental health and substance use disorder services. It also mandates insurers to assist members in finding and arranging coverage for such specialists, prohibits certain prior authorization requirements, and sets a timeline for establishing reimbursement rates for nonparticipating providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and health insurance carriers (insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, dental plan organizations)
stakeholders: Members of health insurance plans in Maryland, especially those seeking mental health and substance use disorder services, and healthcare providers including specialists and nonphysician specialists
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily affects insurance procedures and provider reimbursements.

Title: Cannabis - Sale and Distribution - Tetrahydrocannabinol Offenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the officers and employees of the Field Enforcement Division of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to issue a citation for a violation of §10-108 of the Criminal Law Article; prohibiting the sale or distribution of certain products that contain tetrahydrocannabinol or are advertised as containing tetrahydrocannabinol; authorizing the Executive Director of the Commission to seize, destroy, or confiscate a certain unlawful product; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding the sale, distribution, and regulation of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and related products, including enforcement provisions, licensing requirements, and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of the Executive Director of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission, specifically the Field Enforcement Division.
stakeholders: Cannabis businesses, consumers, and law enforcement agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill establishes clear licensing, testing, and packaging standards for THC products, which can help legitimate businesses operate within a regulated framework, potentially reducing failures due to legal issues.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Limited Worker Cooperative Associations - Authorization (Maryland Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the formation of limited worker cooperative associations; and establishing rules and procedures for the formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution of limited worker cooperative associations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the formation of limited worker cooperative associations in Maryland, establishing rules for their formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution, and creating a new legal framework for these entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, Maryland Insurance Commissioner, and other relevant state agencies involved in business registration, insurance regulation, and taxation.
stakeholders: Workers and members of cooperative associations, small business owners, and entrepreneurs interested in forming worker cooperatives in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear legal structure for worker cooperatives, which can help reduce business failure by offering a stable legal and operational framework.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems Pilot Program - Inspection and Extension
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law relating to the inspection of recorded images apply to recorded images produced by a noise abatement monitoring system; and extending by 2 years the reporting and termination dates of the noise abatement monitoring systems pilot programs in Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the pilot programs for noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, including systems that record images related to noise violations, and clarifies the inspection and access rules for recorded images from various monitoring systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local county agencies implementing noise monitoring systems.
stakeholders: Residents and motorists in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, especially those affected by noise violations and monitoring systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on noise monitoring systems and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations - Nursing - Loan Repayment, Education, and Sunset Extension (Building Opportunities for Nurses Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose of the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Nurses and Nursing Support Staff; requiring the Department to prioritize funding for nurses or nursing support staff who practice in an area with a shortage of nurses or nursing support staff or who practice in a specialty where a shortage has been identified; altering certain education requirements for licensure; repealing a certain requirement that the State Board of Nursing approve certain nursing assistant training program sites within a certain time period; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for nurses, including expanding eligibility, adjusting education and licensure requirements, and extending the program's sunset date to 2030. It also updates regulations for nursing assistant training and certification, and provides tax credits for healthcare preceptors in shortage areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Nurses, nursing support staff, nursing students, healthcare facilities, and residents in shortage areas of healthcare workforce in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions that support healthcare workforce development, which can indirectly reduce small business failure by improving healthcare staffing and services, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services - Study on Location of Individuals Prior to and Following Incarceration
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct an annual study examining and comparing certain data regarding an individual's residence prior to incarceration and on release from a State correctional facility; and requiring the Department by October 1, 2026, and each October 1 thereafter, to report the results of the study to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct a study on the residence locations of individuals before and after incarceration, including data on their residence prior to incarceration, at release, and transfer details, with reports due annually starting October 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland correctional facilities and the communities they return to after release.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Environment – Reservoir Augmentation Permit – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Department of the Environment; defining "reservoir augmentation" as the planned placement of reclaimed water into a surface water reservoir used as a source for a drinking water treatment facility; requiring a person to obtain a permit from the Department to perform reservoir augmentation; establishing an Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department to make recommendations on whether the program should be extended or made permanent and any statutory or regulatory changes necessary; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Reservoir Augmentation Program within the Maryland Department of the Environment, requiring permits for reservoir augmentation projects involving reclaimed water, and sets regulations, fees, and reporting requirements to support safe and sustainable water management.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Water utilities, environmental agencies, and residents relying on surface water reservoirs for drinking water
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program includes permit requirements, fees, and oversight that could impact small businesses involved in water treatment and infrastructure projects, but the bill aims to ensure safety and sustainability rather than directly reduce failure rates.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Compensation of Guardians of Property and Trustees
Synopsis: Clarifying the commissions that a guardian of the property may charge; authorizing a trustee of a trust to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances; and authorizing trustees who are financial institutions or members of the Maryland Bar to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances and calculated in accordance with a schedule of rates filed with an appropriate agency.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and updates the laws regarding the compensation that guardians of property and trustees of trusts can charge, including establishing reasonable rates and procedures for filing and reviewing those rates.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Guardians of property, trustees of trusts, and the beneficiaries of trusts and guardianships in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for trustees' compensation and filing procedures are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Consumer Protection - Right to Repair - Powered Wheelchairs
Synopsis: Requiring, in order to make repairs to powered wheelchairs, that a certain manufacturer make available certain documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools to a certain independent repair provider or owner of a powered wheelchair; providing that a violation of the Act constitutes an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires manufacturers of powered wheelchairs to provide independent repair providers and owners with access to documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools necessary for repairs, under fair and reasonable terms and costs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Consumer Protection or relevant state agency overseeing consumer rights and product repairs.
stakeholders: Owners of powered wheelchairs and independent repair providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to reduce small business failure by enabling independent repair providers to access necessary repair resources, thereby increasing competition and opportunities for small businesses in the repair industry.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Forensic Review Board - Established
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons who have been committed to the facility as not criminally responsible; authorizing a forensic review board to make recommendations relating to the release or rehabilitation of a committed person; requiring the board to give notice at least 10 days before a meeting concerning the committed person; requiring the board to give consideration to a written statement offered by the committed person to the board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons committed as not criminally responsible, to review their eligibility for release and make recommendations. It also creates a Community Forensic Aftercare Program to monitor these individuals on conditional release.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Persons committed as not criminally responsible and on conditional release, mental health professionals, courts, and legal representatives.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation - Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; renaming the Governor's Volunteer Council to be the Governor's Commission on Service and Volunteerism; altering certain requirements relating to qualifications for applicants and compensation for participants in the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Option Pathway; altering certain reporting requirements; and repealing the Executive Fellows Program.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Corps Program by establishing the Young Adult Service Year and Maryland Service Year Pathways, setting program requirements, funding, and reporting procedures, and renaming the Governor’s Volunteer Council to the Governor’s Commission on Service and Volunteerism.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18-25, Maryland residents, community organizations, employers, and local governments involved in service and volunteer programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on service pathways and funding for youth and community programs is likely to indirectly support small business success by fostering community development and workforce readiness, but it does not directly target small business failure.

Title: Department of Aging – Aging Services – Program Repeal and Consolidation
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Secretary of Aging to develop certain congregate housing and assisted living programs for seniors; repealing the Interagency Committee on Aging Services and transferring certain responsibilities of the Committee to the Department of Aging; requiring the Department, beginning in June 2025, in coordination with area stakeholders, to conduct program transition planning and to co-design the new, consolidated program required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain aging programs and committees, consolidates responsibilities into the Department of Aging, and establishes new programs for aging services, including single points of entry for seniors and a system to provide services to older adults to help them age in place.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults and seniors in Maryland, along with local agencies and organizations involved in aging services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline aging services and improve coordination, which could reduce the failure rate of small businesses involved in providing these services, but the impact is indirect and not explicitly quantified.

Title: Public Health - Repeal of Prohibition on Transfer of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (Carlton R. Smith Act)
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition on an individual from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus to another individual.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing prohibition that criminalized knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) to another individual, effectively removing legal penalties for such actions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals living with HIV and the general public
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fees for resident consolidated senior sport fishing licenses, angler's licenses, and trout stamps; and repealing the exemption from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp under certain circumstances for a holder of a resident consolidated senior sport fishing license.
bill_summary: The bill increases fees for certain fishing licenses and stamps in Maryland, repeals some exemptions, and establishes programs for discounted licenses for Purple Heart recipients.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland who fish, especially senior citizens and veterans, as well as fishing license vendors.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's fee adjustments and program implementations are unlikely to have a significant impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Election Law - Petitions for the Formation of a New Political Party - Process
Synopsis: Altering the time periods during which a petition for the formation of a new political party or additional signatures to a petition may not be filed; and prohibiting signatures submitted with a petition that was officially determined as not meeting certain legal requirements from being resubmitted with a subsequent petition.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process and timing for filing petitions to form a new political party in Maryland, including restrictions on resubmitting signatures if a petition fails to meet legal requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Individuals interested in forming new political parties and voters in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program - Acquisition of Land
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works, on recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to make grants under the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit corporations for the acquisition of land for the construction or use of a federally qualified health center.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works, based on recommendations from the Secretary of Health, to provide grants to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit organizations for acquiring land to build or operate federally qualified health centers.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works, in coordination with the Secretary of Health
stakeholders: Counties, municipal corporations, nonprofit organizations, and residents who will access federally qualified health centers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on health center land acquisition and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Public Health - Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council to include the Administrator of the Motor Vehicle Administration, or the Administrator's designee, and the Executive Director of the Office of Social Equity in the Maryland Cannabis Administration, or the Executive Director's designee.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership structure of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council in Maryland, adding new members appointed by the Governor with expertise in areas such as health, social equity, cannabis law, and testing.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration and the Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Cannabis industry professionals, public health officials, social equity communities, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on social equity and cannabis law expertise may support small cannabis businesses and related sectors, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Environment - Building Energy Performance Standards - Alterations and Analysis
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certain regulations adopted by the Department of the Environment relating to building energy performance standards to include certain exclusions, considerations, and a certain  annual reporting fee to cover certain costs; requiring the Department to certify a certain building energy performance standards program adopted by a county under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to conduct an analysis of the potential costs and benefits of certain building energy performance standards policy options; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations and standards for building energy performance in Maryland, including targets, exemptions, and alternative compliance pathways, and creates a program for fees and incentives to promote energy efficiency and greenhouse gas reduction in large buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Owners and operators of large commercial and multifamily buildings in Maryland, including those in sensitive or secure facilities, and energy auditors.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides training, certification, and financial incentives for energy auditors and building owners, which could help small businesses in the energy and building sectors to comply and succeed.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission – User Fee Assessment – Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for a certain provision of law related to the maximum amount of total user fees that may be assessed on hospitals and related institutions by the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause that limited the maximum amount of user fees that the Health Services Cost Review Commission could assess on hospitals and related institutions, allowing the fee limits to continue indefinitely.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospitals and related healthcare institutions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily concerns fee assessment limits for hospitals and related institutions, not small businesses directly.

Title: Procurement - State Department of Education - Local Food Purchasing Program
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of General Services and the Department of Agriculture, to establish a program to procure, when funding is available, local food for local school systems with preference to providers that are certified local farms or certified Chesapeake invasive species providers; altering the percentage price preference adopted by the Board of Public Works for locally grown food from 5% to 10%; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to establish a program to procure local food for schools from local farms and Chesapeake invasive species providers, with preferences and regulations to support local sourcing and reduce food miles.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of Agriculture and the Department of General Services.
stakeholders: Local school systems, local farmers, Chesapeake invasive species providers, and students in Maryland schools.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support local farmers and providers, potentially reducing small business failures by increasing procurement opportunities and streamlining processes.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing a tax collector to withhold from tax sale certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property; requiring that certain owner-occupied property and certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property be withheld from tax sale; requiring each county to establish a registry for interested parties or the Tax Sale Ombudsman to designate property to be withheld from tax sale; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to assist each county in creating and maintaining the registry; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's property tax sale laws to provide protections for owner-occupied residential properties and properties occupied by heirs of deceased owners, establish a registry for interested parties to designate properties to be withheld from tax sale, and create a Homeowner Protection Program to help vulnerable homeowners retain their homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local county or municipal governments.
stakeholders: Homeowners, heirs of deceased property owners, vulnerable homeowners, and local governments involved in tax sales.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets residential property owners and does not directly address small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Public Accountancy in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Board of Public Accountancy to July 1, 2030, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the Board by July 1, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public accountants, accounting firms, and consumers of accounting services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but maintaining the Board could support the stability and regulation of accounting practices for small businesses.

Title: Education - Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program in the State Department of Education to assist local school systems with Holocaust education in public schools; authorizing a local school system to apply to the Department for a grant from the Program to be used for teacher training or teaching materials; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $50,000 for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program within the Maryland State Department of Education to support local school systems in providing Holocaust education through teacher training and teaching materials, with an annual budget of $500,000.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students and educators in Maryland, particularly those involved in Holocaust education
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it focuses on education funding.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - State Leasing of Real Property
Synopsis: Increasing the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from less than 2,500 square feet to up to 5,000 square feet; altering the time frame during which the State is required to advertise the need for rental of building space from at least 30 days to 20 days before proposals for lease are due; requiring the advertisement to be in certain newspapers providing notice to at least the people of the affected locality; and requiring the notice to be posted on the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
bill_summary: The bill increases the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from 2,500 to 5,000 square feet, and modifies the advertising process for leasing needs by reducing the notice period from 30 to 20 days and requiring advertising on the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies and organizations involved in leasing or renting property for state use
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes to leasing procedures and advertising platforms may streamline the leasing process, potentially benefiting small businesses that participate in state leasing opportunities.

Title: Election Law – Special Elections
Synopsis: Altering requirements for scheduling special elections to fill vacancies in a county council or in the office of chief executive officer or county executive; requiring the State Administrator to conduct a special election in accordance with State law and regulations if the State Administrator determines a conflict exists between State law and regulations and a county charter or other county law relating to the conduct of a special election; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the procedures for scheduling and conducting special elections in Maryland, including allowing counties to fill vacancies through a single special general election without a primary, and clarifies election conduct in case of conflicts with county laws.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local boards of elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, county governments, and political parties involved in election processes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on election procedures.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Maryland Trust Decanting Act - Notification and Document Transmittal
Synopsis: Specifying the manner in which notice regarding an exercise of the decanting power or the sending of a document under the Maryland Trust Decanting Act is required to be provided.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Trust Decanting Act to specify acceptable methods for providing notice and transmitting documents related to decanting, including personal service, certified or first-class mail, courier, and alternative methods if agreed upon. It aims to improve communication procedures in trust decanting processes.
responsible_party: Authorized fiduciary or trust administrator responsible for providing notice and transmitting documents under the Maryland Trust Decanting Act.
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, trustors, fiduciaries, and legal professionals involved in estate and trust management in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on trust decanting procedures is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes Relating to Animals - Conviction and Sentencing
Synopsis: Establishing that certain crimes relating to animals do not include certain activities; establishing that each animal harmed in a violation of a prohibition against animal cruelty is a separate offense and shall be deemed an individual victim for purposes of the sentencing guidelines stacking rule; establishing that a conviction for a crime relating to animals may not merge with a conviction for any other crime based on the act establishing the violation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and enhances laws related to crimes involving animals in Maryland. It specifies that certain animal cruelty violations are separate offenses, each animal harmed is considered a separate victim, and convictions for animal crimes cannot merge with other crimes. It also allows sentences for animal crimes to be separate, consecutive, or concurrent with other sentences.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the judiciary responsible for sentencing and enforcement of criminal laws.
stakeholders: Animals, animal welfare organizations, law enforcement, and individuals involved in activities such as farming, research, hunting, and animal training.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on criminal law and animal cruelty, with no direct provisions affecting small business operations or failure rates.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors – License Restoration
Synopsis: Extending from 90 days to 4 years the time period during which an individual who has held a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor license may apply for license restoration after expiration.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which a licensed heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor in Maryland can apply for license restoration after expiration from 90 days to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractors in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing a longer period for license restoration, the bill potentially reduces the likelihood of small business failure among contractors who may have let their licenses lapse.

Title: Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Programs - Appeals and Membership of Standing Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Authorizing a local health department or community-based organization to appeal to the Secretary of Health or the Secretary's designee rather than to the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services, an adverse decision of the Maryland Department of Health and a local health officer regarding an application for authorization to operate an Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local health departments and community-based organizations to establish and operate opioid-associated disease prevention and outreach programs, with a process for appealing adverse decisions to the Secretary of Health or their designee. It also establishes a Standing Advisory Committee to provide technical assistance and make recommendations for these programs.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, specifically the Secretary of Health or their designee, is responsible for implementing the programs and overseeing appeals and advisory committees.
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use, including people who inject drugs, their families, healthcare providers, law enforcement, and community organizations involved in substance use prevention and treatment.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on establishing and supporting opioid prevention programs aims to improve community health and safety, which can contribute to a more stable environment for small businesses, though it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Class A (Off-Sale) and Class D (Off-Sale) Licenses - Population Ratio Quota
Synopsis: Establishing a population ratio quota for certain Class A (off-sale) and Class D (off-sale) licenses in Anne Arundel County; specifying a certain official map to be used to identify certain tax assessment districts for purposes of the population ratio quota; and prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from approving the transfer of certain alcoholic beverages licenses under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a population ratio quota for certain off-sale alcohol licenses in Anne Arundel County, limiting the number of licenses based on the population of specific assessment districts, and restricts license transfers outside these districts.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents of Anne Arundel County, local businesses involved in alcohol sales
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on license issuance and transfer could limit the growth of new alcohol businesses, potentially reducing failure rates for small businesses within the licensing framework.

Title: Insurance Pooling - Public Entity - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public entity" to include a Resilience Authority for purposes of insurance pooling.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'public entity' to include Resilience Authorities, allowing them to participate in insurance pooling for casualty, property, or health insurance, or to self-insure against related risks.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Insurance and local government authorities, specifically Resilience Authorities, are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Resilience Authorities, local governments, and public entities involved in insurance pooling and resilience infrastructure projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failures by providing more comprehensive insurance options and risk management through Resilience Authorities.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Defining "anchor date" to establish certain reference points for the calculation of a certain covered employee's average weekly wage and eligibility for increases in weekly benefits under the Family Medical Leave and Insurance Program; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program governing the participation of self-employed individuals in the Program; repealing certain requirements related to  contributions made by certain participating individuals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by defining key terms, establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program, adjusting contribution and benefit calculation procedures, and setting new implementation timelines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers with 15 or more employees, and healthcare providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline contributions and benefits, potentially reducing financial uncertainty for small businesses and self-employed individuals, thereby lowering the risk of business failure.

Title: Maryland Farms and Families Fund – Purpose and Use – Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to match purchases made with FMNP, SNAP, and WIC benefits at certain farmers markets and farm stands, support nonprofit farmers markets by providing logistical and marketing support to increase the use of federal nutrition programs at these markets, and to support nonprofit  organizations or other responsible persons to implement the Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to support programs that increase access to fresh fruits and vegetables for food-insecure residents and support local farmers through federal nutrition benefits at farmers markets.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Food-insecure Maryland residents, local farmers, farmers markets, nonprofit organizations involved in food assistance programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support farmers markets and local farmers, which could help sustain small agricultural businesses and markets, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Consumer Protection - Automatic Renewals
Synopsis: Requiring a person who makes an automatic renewal offer to consumers to allow a consumer to cancel the automatic renewal in a cost-effective, timely, and easy-to-use manner; requiring automatic renewal offers to be displayed in a certain manner and contain certain information; establishing that compliance with certain regulations or a certain license shall be considered to be compliance with the Act; establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires businesses that offer automatic renewal contracts to clearly disclose terms, provide notice before renewal, and allow consumers easy ways to cancel or opt out. It aims to protect consumers from unfair, deceptive, or abusive renewal practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or the relevant licensing authority overseeing business practices and consumer protection.
stakeholders: Consumers who subscribe to services with automatic renewal contracts in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are designed to promote fair practices, which could reduce disputes and cancellations, potentially lowering small business failure related to consumer complaints.

Title: Pesticide and Pest Control - Revisions to Pesticide Applicator's Law and Repeal of Obsolete Provisions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the commercial application of general use pesticides, the commercial application of restricted use pesticides, and the private application of restricted use pesticides; requiring a certified private applicator to ensure that certain individuals working under the certified applicator's supervision meet certain requirements; specifying the responsibility and liability of certified applicators for the application of certain pesticides; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's pesticide laws by establishing new requirements for the commercial and private application of pesticides, including certification and supervision rules, and repeals obsolete provisions related to certain pesticides and antifouling paints containing tributyltin.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Pesticide applicators, pest control businesses, agricultural producers, commercial boatyards, vessel owners, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on certification and supervision may streamline pest control practices and reduce legal liabilities, potentially lowering small business failure rates in the pest control and related industries.

Title: Electric Companies - Regional Transmission Organizations - Report (Utility Transparency and Accountability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an electric company, other than a municipal electric utility, by February 1 each year, to submit a report to the Public Service Commission regarding each recorded vote cast by the electric company and any of its State affiliates at a meeting of a regional transmission organization.
bill_summary: The bill requires electric companies in Maryland to submit an annual report to the Public Service Commission detailing each recorded vote they or their affiliates cast at regional transmission organization meetings.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric companies, regional transmission organizations, and consumers in Maryland who are affected by electric utility operations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but increased transparency in electric utility operations could indirectly benefit small businesses by promoting fairer practices.

Title: Maryland Correctional Training Commission – Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and one employee of the Division recommended by the exclusive representative for the employees of the Division of Parole and Probation and appointed by the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation and one employee of the Division of Parole and Probation, appointed by the Governor.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Employees of the Division of Parole and Probation, correctional officers, correctional administrators, and related criminal justice agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to correctional training commission membership.

Title: Residential Property - Assignment of Contracts of Sale - Disclosure Requirements and Rescission
Synopsis: Authorizing a seller or assignee of certain residential property to rescind a contract of sale without penalty at any time before closing if a certain seller does not provide a certain notice; establishing that an assignee is entitled to a refund of any deposit paid in connection with the assignment of a contract of sale of the residential property under certain circumstances; requiring that a contract of sale comply with the requirements of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes residential property sellers and assignees to rescind contracts of sale under certain circumstances, mandates disclosures for wholesale buyers and sellers regarding assignment interests, and provides refunds to buyers if contracts are rescinded before closing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant real estate regulatory agency
stakeholders: Homeowners, prospective homebuyers, real estate investors, and wholesale property buyers and sellers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on contract rescission and disclosure aim to reduce legal and financial risks for small real estate businesses, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Department of Housing and Community Development - Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program - Local Rehabilitation Program Administration
Synopsis: Expanding the entities eligible to administer local rehabilitation programs to include certain nonprofit sponsors.
bill_summary: The bill expands the entities eligible to administer local housing rehabilitation programs in Maryland to include certain nonprofit sponsors, allowing them to originate and manage rehabilitation loans under the Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, political subdivisions, and residents in need of housing rehabilitation in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing nonprofit sponsors to administer rehabilitation programs, the bill could help small nonprofit organizations and local entities succeed in housing projects, potentially reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation - Total Assessed Cost of Greenhouse Gas Emissions - Study and Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, in coordination with the Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce, to conduct a study to assess the total cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State and report certain findings to certain committees by December 1, 2026, on the total assessed cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State based on the findings of the study; authorizing the Comptroller to hire a consultant to conduct the study; and requiring the report to include certain information and calculations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program in Maryland to assess the total cost of greenhouse gas emissions and to secure payments from fossil fuel companies responsible for significant emissions. It creates a Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation Fund to finance infrastructure projects and other efforts to adapt to and mitigate climate change effects, especially benefiting vulnerable communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce, with the Maryland State Treasurer overseeing the fund.
stakeholders: Fossil fuel companies, vulnerable communities affected by climate change, state agencies, and residents of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly target small business failure rates but involves financial liabilities for large fossil fuel companies and investments in climate infrastructure, which may indirectly impact small businesses.

Title: Environment - Bay Restoration Fund - Septic System Upgrade Program
Synopsis: Updating the funding priorities for failing sewage systems and holding tanks; requiring as a second priority those located within the Maryland Chesapeake Bay 8-digit watershed that have a relative effectiveness for total nitrogen reduction of 9.24 or higher based on the Chesapeake Bay watershed model; requiring as a third priority funding for failing systems within the 500-year floodplain, and fourth to certain other failing systems; and expanding certain funding eligibility criteria for on-site and community sewage systems.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish evaluation, ranking, and funding levels for nitrogen removal technologies for on-site sewage systems, expands funding eligibility for upgrades and repairs, and prioritizes funding for environmentally critical areas to improve septic system performance and reduce nitrogen pollution.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, and local governments in Maryland, especially those with on-site sewage disposal systems and in environmentally sensitive areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program's focus on funding upgrades and repairs for sewage systems using nitrogen removal technology can help small businesses involved in installation, maintenance, and technology supply, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Notification of Constant Yield Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that the State Department of Assessments and Taxation notify each taxing authority of the constant yield tax rate for each taxable year by requiring that the notice be sent by the Department to a taxing authority only on the request of the taxing authority.
bill_summary: The bill alters the process for notifying taxing authorities about the constant yield tax rate by requiring the Department of Assessments and Taxation to send the notice only upon request, rather than automatically.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxing authorities such as county councils, Baltimore City Council, and municipal governing bodies
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes are administrative and do not directly impact small business failure rates, but may streamline tax assessment communications.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Assault Exam and Treatment Reimbursement
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, rather than the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, is responsible for payment to a physician, qualified health care provider, and hospital for providing certain services to a victim of an alleged rape or sexual offense or a victim of alleged child sexual abuse.
bill_summary: The bill shifts the responsibility for reimbursing providers of sexual assault and child sexual abuse treatment services from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board to the Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, ensuring providers are paid directly for their services to victims.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault and child sexual abuse, healthcare providers, hospitals
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns government reimbursement processes for healthcare providers.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Resignation of Trustee - Notice
Synopsis: Authorizing the trustee of a trust to resign under the Maryland Trust Act on 30 days' notice to qualified beneficiaries, the settlor, if living, all cotrustees, and any person that has a right to replace or appoint a successor to the resigning trustee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes trustees of trusts in Maryland to resign by providing at least 30 days' notice to specified parties or with court approval, and allows courts to impose necessary conditions for the protection of trust property.
responsible_party: Maryland courts (judiciary) and trustees of trusts
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, trustees, and parties involved in trust management in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts trust management and does not directly relate to small business failure rates.

Title: Child Care Centers - Certificated Staff Ratio Requirement - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a child care center that has 20 or more children have in attendance a certain ratio, set by the Department, of staff to children who hold a certificate in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill alters the staffing requirements for child care centers in Maryland, specifically changing the rules regarding the certification of staff responsible for supervising children, including those with first aid and CPR certifications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education (or the State Board responsible for licensing and regulating child care centers)
stakeholders: Child care centers, children attending these centers, and their parents or guardians
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By modifying staffing certification requirements, the bill aims to streamline operations and reduce compliance burdens, potentially lowering the failure rate of small child care businesses.

Title: Department of Aging - Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program
Synopsis: Renaming the Senior Call-Check Service and Notification Program to be the Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program; providing that the purpose of the program is to provide regular, direct communication from the Department of Aging or the Department's designee to an eligible participant to promote wellness and purposeful social engagement; authorizing the integration of services between the Program and Telecommunications Access of Maryland to promote awareness of the availability of accessible telecommunications equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing Senior Call–Check Service to the Senior Call–Check and Social Connections Program, and establishes this program to provide regular communication and social engagement for older adults at risk of social isolation, including integration with the Telecommunications Access of Maryland. It authorizes the Department of Aging to administer and collaborate on the program, including contracting with vendors and organizations.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland, especially those at risk of social isolation
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program's structure includes contracting with private vendors and nonprofit organizations, which could help support small businesses involved in providing social engagement services.

Title: County Boards of Education - Curriculum Guides and Courses of Study - Discrepancies
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to adopt curriculum guides and courses of study aligned with content standards established by the State Department of Education; establishing a process for correcting discrepancies identified by the State Superintendent of Schools in a county board's curriculum guides and courses of study, including the imposition of certain penalties; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain teachers, to develop content and curriculum standards and resources for each subject at each grade level; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive health education framework for public schools in Maryland, requiring county boards to develop curricula aligned with state standards, and creating processes for correcting discrepancies in curriculum guides, including penalties for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, teachers, and school administrators in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, focusing instead on health education and curriculum standards in schools.

Title: Motor Home and Recreational Vehicle Shows in Worcester County - Permit for Out-of-State Dealers
Synopsis: Establishing the reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational trailer vehicle show permit, to be issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration, authorizing the holder to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at vehicle shows in Worcester County; and requiring a permit holder, after the permit is approved, to file a bond with the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle show permit in Worcester County, Maryland, allowing out-of-state dealers licensed elsewhere to display vehicles at shows in Worcester County, provided their home state grants similar privileges to Maryland dealers.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Administration of Maryland
stakeholders: Out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle dealers, residents and visitors of Worcester County, Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates out-of-state dealers' participation in vehicle shows, which could help small businesses in the recreational vehicle industry by increasing their exposure and sales opportunities.

Title: Health - Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund - Use
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to December 31, 2027, the date through which the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund may be used for expenses associated with maternal and child health population health improvements.
bill_summary: The bill extends the use of the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund to December 31, 2027, allowing funds to be used for maternal and child health improvements through 2027.
responsible_party: The Department and the Commission that administer the Fund.
stakeholders: Maternal and child populations in Maryland, healthcare providers, and public health agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by funding health improvements, it may indirectly support community stability.

Title: Davis Martinez Public Employee Safety and Health Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Correctional Training Commission to adopt regulations for the training, issuance, and use of body-worn cameras by January 1, 2026; establishing the Public Employees' Safety and Health Unit in the Division of Labor and Industry to administer and enforce certain duties regarding the oversight of workplace safety and health of employees of certain public bodies; establishing and applying certain civil and criminal penalties to public bodies and persons in government; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's occupational safety and health laws to include public employees and public bodies, mandates the adoption of regulations for correctional body-worn cameras, and establishes standards for preventing workplace violence, with a focus on public sector workplaces.
responsible_party: Maryland Division of Labor and Industry, specifically the Public Employees’ Safety and Health Unit, and the Correctional Training Commission.
stakeholders: Public employees, correctional officers, employees of public bodies, and residents served by public agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets public sector workplaces and does not directly address small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Organized Retail Theft Act of 2025
Synopsis: Providing that multiple thefts committed by the same person in multiple counties under one scheme or continuing course of conduct may be joined and prosecuted in any county in which any one of the thefts occurred; prohibiting one or more persons from committing a series of thefts from retail merchants over a 90-day period with an aggregate value exceeding $1,500; requiring a court to make a finding as to whether a certain crime is organized retail theft under certain circumstances for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new offense called organized retail theft, defining it as a series of thefts of retail merchandise over a 90-day period with specific criminal intent. It sets penalties based on the total value of stolen property, allows multiple thefts to be prosecuted together, and requires courts to determine if a crime qualifies as organized retail theft for sentencing and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Retail merchants, consumers, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to reduce small business losses due to organized retail theft by increasing penalties and improving law enforcement's ability to prosecute such crimes effectively.

Title: Military Department – Chief of Staff and Aides – Appointment Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Adjutant General instead of the Governor to appoint certain staff in the Military Department; and establishing that certain staff in the Military Department serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General instead of the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Adjutant General of Maryland's Military Department to appoint the chief of staff and aides, replacing the Governor's authority, and specifies that these staff serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Department, Adjutant General's Office
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Military Department, including staff and personnel involved in military administration
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems -
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a civil citation issued as a result of a recorded image produced by a speed monitoring system; requiring the State Highway Administration to convene a workgroup to study best practices regarding speed monitoring systems in school zones; and requiring the workgroup to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems, establishes a workgroup to study best practices for speed monitoring in school zones, and requires a report on findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: School children, local governments, law enforcement agencies, and drivers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the study and potential adjustments to speed monitoring practices could influence local traffic enforcement and safety.

Title: Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program - Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fiscal years to include fiscal year 2027 through fiscal year 2029, during which the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $3,700,000 to the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding structure and fiscal years for the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program in Maryland, including the annual budget appropriations and distribution of grants to providers for children with developmental delays or disabilities.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children under 6 years old with developmental delays, physical disabilities, or social, emotional, or behavioral challenges, and their families, as well as child care providers specializing in therapeutic care.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's funding and grant distribution aim to support providers, potentially reducing small business failure rates among therapeutic child care providers.

Title: Drunk Driving - Commercial Driver's Licenses - Disqualification From Driving
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify any individual from driving a commercial motor vehicle for 1 year if the individual, while holding a commercial instructional permit or commercial driver's license, drives or attempts to drive any motor vehicle while the alcohol concentration of the person's blood or breath is 0.08 or greater.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify individuals from driving commercial motor vehicles for specified periods if they are convicted of certain alcohol-related offenses or commit other violations while driving. It also establishes lifetime disqualification for multiple violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts commercial drivers and the transportation industry, with indirect effects on small businesses involved in logistics and transportation services.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Towed, Removed, or Abandoned Vehicles - Electronic Notice to Owner
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who tows or removes a vehicle from a parking lot to provide electronic notice of the tow or removal to the vehicle owner through the Motor Vehicle Administration under certain circumstances; and authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to send an electronic notice to the last known registered owner of the vehicle through the Administration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes towing companies and police departments to send electronic notices to vehicle owners, secured parties, and insurers regarding towed, removed, or abandoned vehicles, replacing some traditional mailing notices with electronic communication.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and local police departments
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, towing companies, police departments, insurers, and secured parties in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for electronic notices and clear procedures aim to streamline the process, potentially reducing delays and costs for small towing businesses, thereby helping to decrease their failure rate.

Title: Uninsured Employers' Fund - Assessments and Special Monitor
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Uninsured Employers' Fund must collect or suspend a certain assessment; altering, from 1% to up to 1.5%, the additional percentage the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board may direct the Workers' Compensation Commission to assess on awards and settlements if the Board determines that the reserves of the Fund are inadequate to meet anticipated losses; and requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to designate a special monitor to assess the financial condition of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the assessment process for the Maryland Uninsured Employers' Fund, including changing the circumstances under which assessments are collected or suspended, adjusting the additional percentage the Fund can assess on awards and settlements, and establishing a special monitor to assess the Fund's financial condition.
responsible_party: The Workers’ Compensation Commission and the Uninsured Employers’ Fund
stakeholders: Employers, insurers, and employees involved in workers' compensation in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the financial stability of the Uninsured Employers' Fund, which could help reduce the risk of insolvency that might impact small businesses involved in workers' compensation claims.

Title: Public Schools - Restorative Practices Schools - Comprehensive Plan
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan by July 1, 2026, for the establishment of Restorative Practices Schools which integrate restorative practices into daily practices and activities of the whole school; requiring a county board of education to use the comprehensive plan if the county board chooses to establish a Restorative Practices School; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026, on the comprehensive plan for Restorative Practices Schools.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan for establishing Restorative Practices Schools, which focus on relationship-based, proactive discipline methods that emphasize accountability and repairing relationships. It also mandates the use of these practices in public schools and provides guidelines for implementation and evaluation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, teachers, school administrators, and families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on school discipline practices and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Election Law - Notice to Permanent Absentee Voters
Synopsis: Altering the time before an election when a certain notice is required to be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list; repealing a requirement that the notice be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list as of a certain date; and altering the action the State Board of Elections is required to take if the State Board is unable to contact a voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list using the method of communication chosen by the voter.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the notification process for voters on the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland. It changes the timing and method of communication from the State Board of Elections to these voters, including how contact attempts are made if the voter cannot be reached.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters on the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Consumer Protection – False Advertising – Digital Goods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person that is a seller from advertising or offering for sale a digital good using certain terminology unless, before executing the sale, a certain affirmative acknowledgment is received from the purchaser or a certain clear and conspicuous statement is provided by the seller; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits deceptive advertising of digital goods in Maryland, requiring sellers to obtain explicit acknowledgment from buyers that they are purchasing a license, not ownership, and to provide clear statements about license terms. It also bans advertising digital goods alongside time-limited rental options unless certain disclosures are made.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General's Office or the Maryland Department of Commerce (implied enforcement authority)
stakeholders: Digital goods consumers and sellers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's clear licensing and advertising requirements could reduce legal disputes and consumer complaints, potentially lowering small business failure related to legal issues and consumer trust.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Local Cybersecurity Preparedness and Response Plan and Assessment - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a duplicative provision of law requiring each county government, local school system, and local health department, in consultation with the local emergency manager, to create or update a cybersecurity preparedness and response plan and complete a cybersecurity preparedness assessment in a manner and frequency established by the Department of Information Technology.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a law that required local government entities in Maryland to create or update cybersecurity preparedness and response plans and complete assessments, as this requirement is considered duplicative.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Information Technology, in coordination with local government entities.
stakeholders: Local government entities such as county governments, local school systems, and local health departments in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Assistive Technology Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Assistive Technology Program in the Department of Disabilities; providing the purpose of the Program is to increase access to assistive technology services and devices for individuals with disabilities, support the State's efforts to provide assistive technology services and devices to persons with disabilities of all ages, including underrepresented populations, and ensure statewide access to assistive technology lending libraries; establishing the Assistive Technology Services Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Assistive Technology Program within the Department of Disabilities to provide assistive technology devices and services to individuals with disabilities.
