It also creates the Assistive Technology Services Fund to support the program's operations and activities.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland who need assistive technology devices and services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it creates a state program and fund that could potentially support small businesses involved in assistive technology services.

Title: Public Safety - Fuel Gas Piping Systems and Corrugated Stainless Steel Tubing - Prohibitions and Study
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale, offer for sale, transfer, or distribution of non-arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing; providing a civil penalty of up to $1,000 for a violation of the Act; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal, by September 1, 2026, to submit a final report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly with recommendations related to preventing the fire hazards associated with commonly used fuel gas piping systems.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale and use of non–arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing that does not meet specific safety standards for use in fuel gas piping systems, and requires a study to assess fire hazards related to fuel gas piping, including gas piping and stainless steel tubing, in residential and commercial buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Manufacturers, builders, property owners, and residents in Maryland who use or are affected by fuel gas piping systems in residential and commercial buildings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve safety standards for fuel gas piping systems, which could reduce fire hazards and related failures, potentially decreasing small business failures related to fire damages or safety violations.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Exceptional Hauling Permits for Farm Products
Synopsis: Creating an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products to the prohibition against driving a vehicle subject to an exceptional hauling permit on the interstate highway system; altering certain weight limits and tolerances under an exceptional hauling permit; altering the preventive maintenance documents that an individual operating under an exceptional hauling permit must possess; and altering certain record-keeping requirements and the application of certain administrative penalties under an exceptional hauling permit.
bill_summary: The bill creates an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products from the general prohibition against using exceptional hauling permits on the interstate highway system, and modifies weight limits, permit requirements, and record-keeping rules for such permits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Farmers, dairy producers, and transportation companies involved in hauling fluid milk products within Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could help small dairy farms and transportation businesses by easing permit restrictions and clarifying compliance requirements, potentially reducing operational failures.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Public Schools – School Schedule Options
Synopsis: Authorizing the Anne Arundel County Board of Education to operate all schools within the county using a scheduling model that eliminates early dismissal days to allow for less than 180 school days if the minimal hours of attendance are met; requiring the board, if it elects to use a scheduling model that results in a school in the county being open for less than 180 days to offer certain school employees an opportunity to make up the lost wages; and requiring the Board to make a report on the schools using an alternative scheduling model.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Anne Arundel County Board of Education to operate schools using a scheduling model that can eliminate early dismissal days, allowing for fewer than 180 school days if the minimum 1,080 hours of attendance are met. It requires reporting on the operation of these alternative schedules and provides wage recovery opportunities for affected employees.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, school employees, and the local education community in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on school scheduling flexibility and employee wage recovery, which does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electric Cooperatives - Nonescheat Capital Credits
Synopsis: Providing that certain unclaimed money held by an electric cooperative and due to a past member is not considered abandoned property; and authorizing an electric cooperative to use this money only to assist members of the cooperative or make donations to nonprofit, charitable organizations.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that unclaimed money held by electric cooperatives and due to past members, specifically nonescheat capital credits, is not considered abandoned property and can only be used for certain purposes such as assisting members or making donations to nonprofits.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and electric cooperatives
stakeholders: Past members of electric cooperatives and the electric cooperatives themselves
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily pertains to electric cooperatives and their handling of unclaimed capital credits.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust – Assistance to Members of the Maryland National Guard
Synopsis: Expanding the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing monetary and other assistance to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families; and authorizing the Maryland Veterans Trust to expend money from the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund to provide loans and grants to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing assistance, such as loans and grants, to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust, managed by the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their families, as well as veterans and their families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - Training and Financial Disclosure Requirements - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the format and content of training on the requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law provided by the State Ethics Commission to certain State employees and regulated lobbyists to be either through online training or live presentation on the conflict of interest, financial disclosure, relevant administrative, and other applicable requirements of the law; and altering the scope of disclosure for the employment of an individual or a member of the individual's immediate family reported in a financial disclosure statement.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Public Ethics Law by changing the format of ethics training courses for state employees and lobbyists, expanding disclosure requirements for employment and financial interests, and updating related provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: State employees, lobbyists, and public officials in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the transparency and ethics training may indirectly support a fairer business environment.

Title: State Government - Information Technology - Cybersecurity Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Cyber Preparedness Unit in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; altering the duties of the Office of Security Management in the Department of Information Technology; requiring the Office to submit a yearly report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on the State's cybersecurity expenditures and recommendations for changes to the budget; and altering the responsibilities of the Secretary of Information Technology with regard to information technology policies.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's cybersecurity policies and responsibilities of various state agencies, including the Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Information Technology, to improve cybersecurity preparedness, response, and strategy across state and local governments.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Information Technology, specifically the Office of Security Management and the Secretary of Information Technology.
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, local school systems, local health departments, and other entities involved in cybersecurity within Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill enhances cybersecurity support and resources for local governments, which can help prevent small business failures caused by cyber incidents, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Peace Orders and Criminal Harassment - Intentional Visual Surveillance
Synopsis: Expanding the relief that may be included in a final peace order; altering the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include certain visual surveillance of an area of another person's residence where the other has a reasonable expectation of privacy; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction for a first offense is subject to imprisonment of up to 90 days or a fine of $500 or both, and for a second or subsequent offense, imprisonment of up to 180 days or a fine of $1,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill expands the legal protections against visual surveillance of a person's residence where there is a reasonable expectation of privacy. It allows individuals to petition for peace orders if they are subjected to intentional visual surveillance, and it broadens the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include such surveillance. The bill also mandates that respondents remove or reposition surveillance devices upon a peace order and prohibits certain visual surveillance activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings, specifically the courts that issue peace orders.
stakeholders: Individuals residing in Maryland who have a reasonable expectation of privacy in their homes and are at risk of visual surveillance.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses personal privacy and harassment issues and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Charitable Organizations - Late Fees and Registration - Suspension and Cancellation Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State to suspend payment of certain late fees assessed to certain charitable organizations that fail to file an annual report under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Secretary of State to cancel a charitable organization's registration or reinstate a charitable organization's canceled registration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Secretary of State to suspend late fees for certain charitable organizations under specific circumstances, and to cancel or reinstate charitable organization registrations if they fail to submit required reports for three years. It also adjusts fee structures based on contributions and clarifies procedures for registration and compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Charitable organizations operating in Maryland and their beneficiaries
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could reduce financial penalties and administrative burdens on charitable organizations, potentially decreasing the likelihood of failure due to non-compliance or financial strain.

Title: Marriage - Confidential Communication
Synopsis: Clarifying that "spouse" includes a former spouse for purposes of disclosure of confidential communications occurring during marriage; and establishing that a spouse, who is the alleged victim, is competent to disclose a confidential communication between spouses occurring during their marriage in a criminal action in which one spouse is charged with a crime against the other spouse.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that a spouse, including a former spouse, can disclose confidential communications made during marriage in criminal cases where one spouse is charged with a crime against the other. It also states that a spouse who is the alleged victim can disclose such communications and cannot be compelled to testify about them.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Courts and Judicial Proceedings Department
stakeholders: Spouses, former spouses, and individuals involved in criminal cases involving spouses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Family Law - Adoption of an Adult
Synopsis: Limiting the requirement that a petitioner's spouse join in the petition for adoption to apply only when the prospective adoptee is a minor; authorizing a petitioner's spouse to join in the petition for adoption if the prospective adoptee is an adult; establishing that certain provisions of law requiring the issuance and service of a show-cause order on a prospective adoptee's parents do not apply if the prospective adoptee is an adult; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland family law to allow the adoption of adults without parental consent, and modifies procedures for adoption petitions involving adults, including the role of spouses and the process for serving notice to parents.
responsible_party: Maryland Family Law Courts and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Adults seeking adoption, their families, and legal professionals involved in adoption proceedings in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Human Services - Adult Protective Services
Synopsis: Specifying that certain provisions of law relating to confidentiality do not prohibit the disclosure of certain information relating to adult protective services or the disclosure of the identity of certain persons making certain reports under certain circumstances; expanding the definition of "health practitioner" to include certain emergency medical providers; and authorizing individuals who are required in specific instances to report information regarding alleged vulnerable adults to make a report by calling the statewide reporting hotline.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws related to adult protective services by clarifying confidentiality rules, expanding the definition of health practitioners to include certain emergency medical services providers, and establishing procedures for reporting suspected abuse or neglect of vulnerable adults, including the use of a statewide hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and local adult protective services agencies
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults at risk of abuse, neglect, or exploitation, and professionals involved in adult protective services and emergency medical response
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on adult protective services and confidentiality, with no direct impact indicated on small business failure rates.

Title: Residential Real Property - Local Limits on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enforcing a law or ordinance that limits the summoning of law enforcement or emergency services to a residential property by establishing a certain threshold or penalty.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits local jurisdictions in Maryland from enacting or enforcing laws that set thresholds or penalties for summoning law enforcement or emergency services to residential properties, including restrictions on penalties such as fines, eviction actions, or license revocations.
responsible_party: Local governments (counties and municipalities) and their governing bodies.
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, tenants, and operators of residential properties in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could reduce legal and financial risks for property owners and operators by preventing local laws that penalize frequent emergency calls, potentially reducing small business failures in property management.

Title: Human Services – Local Departments of Social Services – Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from once every 3 years to an interval of once every 4 years unless it is determined on a case-by-case basis that an audit occur at an interval of 3 years, with which the Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services conducts or contracts for financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services.
bill_summary: The bill alters the frequency of financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services conducted by the Office of the Inspector General in the Maryland Department of Human Services, changing the interval from at least once every 3 years to a range of 3 to 4 years, with the possibility of more frequent audits based on risk assessment.
responsible_party: Office of the Inspector General in the Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Local departments of social services and the populations they serve in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on audit frequency for social services departments is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Membership Alteration and Sunset Extensions
Synopsis: Continuing certain health occupations boards and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to a certain date the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the boards and Committee; and altering the membership of the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset dates for several health occupations boards and committees in Maryland, including the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners, the State Board of Pharmacy, the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists, and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee. It also makes amendments to the membership of the Massage Therapy Examiners Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and its respective health occupations boards and committees.
stakeholders: Health professionals, massage therapists, pharmacists, counselors, therapists, and consumers of health services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By extending the sunset dates, the bill provides stability and continuity for the licensing boards, which can help small health-related businesses operate without interruption due to regulatory uncertainty.

Title: Economic Development - West North Avenue Development Authority - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administration and membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; specifying the powers and duties of the Authority, subject to certain limitations; requiring the Authority to take certain actions regarding the finances of the Authority; exempting the Authority from certain taxation or assessments under certain circumstances; establishing the West North Avenue Development Authority Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; altering the termination date of the Authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City to promote economic development, redevelopment, and community revitalization along the West North Avenue corridor. It details the authority's powers, governance, funding, and exemptions from certain laws, aiming to improve neighborhoods and increase property tax revenues.
responsible_party: The West North Avenue Development Authority, managed by its Board of Directors, with oversight and support from Maryland state agencies such as the Department of Housing and Community Development, Department of Transportation, and Department of Commerce.
stakeholders: Residents, business owners, community organizations, and local government in the Baltimore City neighborhoods along the West North Avenue corridor.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides the authority with powers to acquire, develop, and support commercial and residential projects, which can help stabilize and grow local businesses, thereby potentially reducing small business failures in the area.

Title: Public Safety - Statewide DNA Database System, DNA Collection, and Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring a certain DNA sample to be collected in a certain manner from an individual who is required to register as a sex offender; requiring a DNA sample to be collected by a certain individual or at a certain location under certain circumstances; requiring a custodial agency or correctional facility to ensure a DNA sample is collected in a certain manner; prohibiting a DNA sample from being tested and placed in a certain statewide DNA database system until certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws regarding the collection, testing, and expungement of DNA samples from individuals convicted of certain crimes, charged with specific offenses, or required to register as sex offenders. It establishes procedures for DNA sample collection, testing, and destruction, and sets rules for when DNA records can be expunged from the statewide database.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, specifically the Crime Laboratory division.
stakeholders: Individuals required to provide DNA samples, including sex offenders, individuals charged with violent crimes or burglary, and convicted felons.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts law enforcement and criminal justice agencies, with minimal direct impact on small businesses.

Title: Criminal Law - Drug Paraphernalia - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a person using or possessing with intent to use, delivering or selling under certain circumstances, or manufacturing or possessing with intent to deliver or sell under certain circumstances drug paraphernalia to inject, ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce into the human body a controlled dangerous substance; removing intent to administer a controlled dangerous substance from a certain list of intents; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to alter penalties for possession, use, delivery, or sale of drug paraphernalia related to controlled dangerous substances, including removing certain prohibitions and clarifying circumstances that indicate intent to use paraphernalia for illegal drug activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in or affected by drug use and trafficking, including offenders and communities impacted by drug-related crimes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on criminal penalties related to drug paraphernalia and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Priority of Claims on an Estate - Unpaid Child Support
Synopsis: Prioritizing the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate of a decedent with insufficient assets to pay all claims in full.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland estate law to prioritize the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate when the estate's assets are insufficient to pay all claims in full.
responsible_party: The personal representative of the estate is responsible for implementing the program, following the amended order of claims payment.
stakeholders: Individuals owed unpaid child support, estate executors, and beneficiaries of estates in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Maryland Agricultural Commission and Young Farmers
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Agricultural Commission; establishing the Committee on Young Farmers for purposes of  communicating to the Maryland Agricultural Commission on issues relating to young and beginning farmers in the State; repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Young Farmers Advisory Board; and requiring the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to be governed and administered by a board of trustees composed in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Agricultural Commission's membership, establishes the Committee on Young Farmers to focus on issues affecting young and beginning farmers, and repeals the previous Young Farmers Advisory Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Young and beginning farmers in Maryland, agricultural industry stakeholders, and the Maryland agricultural community.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By creating dedicated committees and advisory groups focused on young farmers, the bill aims to support new farmers and reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Dental Services - Qualification for Maryland Dent-Care Program
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility criteria for Higher Education Loan Assistance Grants under the Maryland Dent-Care Program to include part-time employment.
bill_summary: The bill modifies eligibility criteria for the Maryland Dent–Care Program's Higher Education Loan Assistance Grants, including increasing grant amounts for dentists and dental hygienists, and requires a study on the use of online credentialing systems by dental insurance carriers.
responsible_party: The Office of Student Financial Assistance in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health.
stakeholders: Dentists, dental hygienists, and Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on increasing loan assistance and streamlining credentialing processes aims to support dental professionals, potentially reducing small business failure rates in dental practices.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance and Collection of Debts - Policies
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law related to a hospital's financial assistance and collection of debts policies; specifying the percentage by which a hospital is required to reduce a patient's out-of-pocket expenses under certain circumstances; adding to the notice requirements relating to a hospital's financial assistance policy; prohibiting a hospital from filing a civil action to collect a debt against a patient whose outstanding debt is at or below $500; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding hospital financial assistance, debt collection policies, and the statute of limitations on certain hospital-related contracts. It establishes requirements for hospitals to provide clear notices, develop financial assistance policies, and limits when hospitals can file civil actions or report adverse information related to patient debts, especially for those eligible for free or reduced-cost care.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and hospitals in Maryland
stakeholders: Patients receiving hospital services, especially those with low income or financial hardship, and hospitals providing care in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily impact hospitals and patients, with limited direct effect on small business failure rates.

Title: Data Center Impact Analysis and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Energy Administration, and the University of Maryland School of Business, in coordination with the Department of Legislative Services, to conduct an analysis of the likely environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the State; and requiring the Department of Legislative Services to coordinate preparation of the final report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by September 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies and the University of Maryland to analyze the environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the state, and to report their findings by September 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Energy Administration, University of Maryland School of Business, and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Data center industry, environmental agencies, local communities, and state government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the economic impact assessment may influence policies affecting small businesses involved in or affected by data center development.

Title: Maryland Department of Planning – Modernization
Synopsis: Requiring the State Administrator of Elections to electronically submit certain precinct boundary information to the Secretary of Planning; altering certain requirements related to the Department of Planning preparing population projections for the Washington and Baltimore metropolitan areas to authorize the use of population figures developed by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council, the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments and their member jurisdictions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the roles and procedures of the Maryland Department of Planning, including its responsibilities for population projections, information management, and coordination with other agencies. It also modifies reporting and planning requirements related to local and state projects, and streamlines certain access and funding provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, planning officials, and residents of Maryland affected by planning and development policies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by streamlining planning processes and clarifying agency roles, it may create a more predictable environment for business development.

Title: Residential Leases - Late Payment Penalties - Calculation
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition concerning the maximum penalty for the late payment of rent that a landlord may charge in a residential lease to prohibit a penalty in excess of 5% of the amount of the unpaid rent rather than of the amount due.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify that the maximum late payment penalty a landlord can charge for residential rent is limited to 5% of the unpaid rent, replacing a previous rule that based the penalty on a percentage of the total rent due. It also clarifies limits for weekly rent penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or local housing authorities (implied)
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts residential rental agreements and is unlikely to have a direct effect on small business failure rates.

Title: Family Law - Child Support - Multifamily Adjustment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "adjusted actual income" under the State child support guidelines by requiring the deduction, from actual income, of an allowance for support for each child in the parent's home for whom the parent owes a legal duty of support but who is not subject to a support order; requiring that the amount of a certain allowance be subtracted from a parent's actual income before the court determines the amount of a child support award; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's child support guidelines by redefining 'adjusted actual income' to account for a new allowance for support for children living in a parent's home, and modifies how courts determine child support obligations, including considerations for unjust or inappropriate application of guidelines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or the Judiciary (courts)
stakeholders: Parents, children, and families involved in child support cases in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts family law and child support calculations, with minimal direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Government - Forms - Reporting Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that certain departments or units of State government annually submit a report on the management of forms to the Department of General Services.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for certain state departments to annually report on their management of forms to the Department of General Services, and it takes effect on July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and relevant state departments
stakeholders: State government departments and units, and the Department of General Services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Environment - Water Bottle Filling Stations - Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a water bottle filling station or a combined water bottle filling station and drinking fountain to be installed in certain new construction or as part of certain renovations beginning October 1, 2025, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that starting October 1, 2025, new construction and renovations in Maryland include at least one water bottle filling station in certain buildings, replacing or supplementing existing drinking fountains, with some exceptions.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Labor is responsible for adopting regulations to implement the bill.
stakeholders: Building owners, tenants, and the general public who use the buildings where water bottle filling stations are installed.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may encourage small businesses involved in construction and renovation to adopt water bottle filling stations, potentially reducing failure rates by promoting sustainable practices and meeting new regulatory requirements.

Title: Municipalities - Annexation Resolutions - Submission to Department of Planning
Synopsis: Adding the Department of Planning to the list of entities to which a municipality must send a copy of an annexation resolution with the new municipal boundaries.
bill_summary: The bill requires municipalities in Maryland to send a copy of their annexation resolution with new boundaries to the Department of Planning, in addition to other entities, within 10 days of the resolution taking effect.
responsible_party: Municipal governments and the Department of Planning
stakeholders: Municipalities, residents within annexed areas, and planning agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but improved planning and clear boundary updates could indirectly support local economic stability.

Title: Procurement – Electronic Transactions – Clarification of Fees Due
Synopsis: Specifying that fees collected for electronic transactions for procurements are those due to the State and not any fees due to a third party.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that fees collected for electronic procurement transactions are owed to the State of Maryland, not third parties, and specifies the conditions under which such fees can be charged and deposited.
responsible_party: Chief Procurement Officer and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: State agencies, contractors, and vendors involved in electronic procurement transactions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's clarification on fee collection aims to streamline electronic procurement processes, potentially reducing administrative barriers for small businesses and encouraging their participation in state contracts.

Title: Local Comprehensive Planning and State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy - Planning Principles
Synopsis: Providing certain planning principles that are collectively intended to create sustainable communities and to protect the environment utilizing active public participation; altering the State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy to consist of planning principles for advancing sustainable growth in the State; and requiring the publisher of the Annotated Code of Maryland, along with the Department of Legislative Services, to correct cross-references and terminology in the Code that are rendered incorrect by the Act.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's comprehensive planning principles to emphasize sustainability, community involvement, efficient land use, transportation, housing, economic development, environmental protection, and resilience. It aligns local and state planning policies with these principles and mandates updates to legal references.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, community organizations, environmental groups, and businesses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes sustainable growth and efficient infrastructure, which can create a stable environment for small businesses, though it does not specify direct measures to reduce small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Transportation Authority – Tolls, Fees, and Other Charges – Temporary Adjustments
Synopsis: Increasing from 180 days to 300 days the maximum duration of an emergency status determination authorizing the temporary adjustment of tolls, fees, or other charges by the Maryland Transportation Authority.
bill_summary: The bill extends the maximum duration of emergency status determinations that allow the Maryland Transportation Authority to temporarily adjust tolls, fees, or other charges from 180 days to 300 days, and clarifies procedures for public notice, comment, and implementation of these temporary adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Drivers, commuters, and transportation users in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts toll adjustments and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations, Condominiums, and Homeowners Associations - Funding of Reserve Accounts and Preparation of Funding Plans
Synopsis: Requiring that certain funds for certain reserve accounts be deposited on or before the last day of each fiscal year; requiring the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, a residential condominium, or a homeowners association to prepare a certain funding plan subject to certain requirements; authorizing a reasonable deviation from certain reserve funding requirements following a certain financial hardship determination; requiring that certain updated reserve studies be prepared by a certain person; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations to conduct reserve studies, prepare funding plans, and deposit funds into reserve accounts annually to ensure proper funding for future repairs and replacements of common elements.
responsible_party: The governing bodies of cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations, with oversight and guidance from relevant state licensing and professional organizations.
stakeholders: Residents and owners of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on proper reserve funding and planning aims to improve financial stability of housing associations, which can indirectly support small business stability related to property management and maintenance.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Child Victims - Testimony in Child Abuse Cases
Synopsis: Altering a certain requirement under which a court is authorized to order that the testimony of a child victim be taken outside a courtroom and shown in the courtroom by closed circuit television in certain child abuse cases; requiring the testimony of a child victim taken by closed circuit television within the courthouse be in a setting that reasonably mitigates the likelihood the child victim will suffer emotional distress; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to clarify that a court can order a child's testimony in child abuse cases to be taken outside the courtroom and shown via closed circuit television if the child would suffer serious emotional distress testifying in the presence of the defendant or respondent.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary (Courts)
stakeholders: Child victims in abuse cases, their families, and legal parties involved in child abuse proceedings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Renaming the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to be the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program; repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the Program; authorizing rather than requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Program; and prohibiting the Exchange from implementing the Program if certain funds are not available.
bill_summary: The bill renames and extends the funding for the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program, allowing the Exchange to establish and implement the program if funds are available, and repeals the sunset clause. It also details the funding sources, management, and reporting requirements for the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults in Maryland aged 18 to 40 who are purchasing health insurance in the individual market
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to reduce the financial burden on young adults purchasing health insurance, which may indirectly support small businesses by stabilizing insurance markets and reducing nonpayment rates.

Title: State Government - Grants and Contracts - Reimbursement of Indirect Costs
Synopsis: Altering the rate at which nonprofit organizations receiving State-funded grants or contracts may be reimbursed for indirect costs to match the rate established under relevant federal guidelines; requiring the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council to study and make certain recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the entire grants life cycle; requiring the Council to submit a report on its full recommendations to the Department and the General Assembly by July 1, 2027; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the reimbursement rate for indirect costs for nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, establishing a minimum rate of at least 15% or the federal negotiated rate, and requires a study and report on indirect costs and grants management.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, and the State government agencies managing these grants.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve financial support for nonprofit organizations, which could help reduce their failure rate by ensuring better reimbursement for indirect costs.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Affidavit for Judicial Authorization
Synopsis: Altering and clarifying the requirement that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization to initiate forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) assert that the reasonable investigative leads have been pursued and failed to identify the perpetrator and instead requiring that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization assert that identity of the perpetrator is unknown.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the requirements for law enforcement to obtain judicial authorization for forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) in criminal investigations, specifying the criteria and affidavit process.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, criminal suspects, victims, and the general public involved in criminal investigations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to criminal investigation procedures.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings - Statement of Charges - Human Service Workers
Synopsis: Expanding certain provisions of law relating to a certain investigation and recommendation by a State's Attorney concerning the filing of a statement of charges against certain professionals to include certain human service workers.
bill_summary: The bill expands the process for filing statements of charges against certain professionals, including human service workers such as adult protective services workers, child welfare caseworkers, educators, law enforcement officers, and emergency services personnel, requiring a prior investigation and recommendation by the State's Attorney.
responsible_party: Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Human service workers, law enforcement officers, educators, emergency services personnel, and the populations they serve.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on procedural changes for filing charges against professionals, not on direct support or programs for small businesses, so it has minimal impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Establishing certain confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement agencies; prohibiting a peer support specialist from  disclosing the contents of any written or oral communication regarding a peer support interaction; and providing certain exceptions.
bill_summary: The bill establishes confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement officers in Maryland, ensuring that communications are protected unless certain exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Law enforcement agencies and the Fraternal Order of Police implementing peer support programs.
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Specially Designed Vintage Reproduction Registration Plates
Synopsis: Repealing the time limitation within which the Motor Vehicle Administration is required to make available specially designed vintage reproduction registration plates; and requiring the Administration to charge a fee of $100 for the initial issuance and $25 for the renewal of a specially designed vintage reproduction registration plate.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the time limitation for making vintage reproduction registration plates available, requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to develop and sell these plates, and sets fees for initial issuance and renewal.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Vehicle owners of qualifying vehicles interested in vintage reproduction plates
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily involves vehicle registration fees and availability of vintage plates.

Title: Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and analyze the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication in Maryland and make recommendations; requiring the orphans' courts, circuit courts, registers of wills, and Administrative Office of the Courts to comply with certain requests of the Task Force; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and make recommendations on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and improve the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication processes across the state, including probate, trusts, and guardianships.
responsible_party: The Department of Legislative Services in conjunction with the Maryland State Bar Association.
stakeholders: Families, fiduciaries, judges, and legal professionals involved in fiduciary matters such as probate, trusts, and guardianships in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but aims to improve legal processes related to fiduciary matters, which could indirectly benefit small businesses involved in estate and trust management.

Title: Election Law - Municipal Elections - Administration
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to enter into memoranda of understanding with municipal corporations that allow the State Administrator to work collaboratively with a municipal corporation to support the administration of the municipal corporation's elections; authorizing the State Administrator to lease a voting system or other equipment used to administer an election for use in a municipal election; repealing the authority of a local board to lease a voting system to certain entities within the county; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Administrator of Elections to collaborate with municipal corporations, including entering into memoranda of understanding and leasing voting systems for municipal elections. It also modifies procedures for municipal election ballot requests and includes provisions for the inclusion of municipal elections on state ballots.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Municipalities and residents participating in municipal elections in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by improving election administration, it may indirectly support a stable political environment.

Title: Domestic Partnership and Marriage - Required Information
Synopsis: Clarifying required information for registering a domestic partnership or obtaining a marriage license; and requiring a declaration of domestic partnership filed with the register of wills to include the Social Security number of each domestic partner who has a Social Security number.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the requirements for registering a domestic partnership and obtaining a marriage license in Maryland. It mandates including Social Security numbers in declarations of domestic partnership and marriage license applications, and specifies privacy protections for this information.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health and the Office of the Clerk of the Court (or equivalent local clerk's office) are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Individuals seeking to register domestic partnerships or obtain marriage licenses in Maryland, including couples and their families.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by clarifying legal procedures and privacy protections, it may reduce administrative burdens for related service providers.

Title: County Boards of Education - Antibias Training for Members - Requirement (County Board Member Antibias Training Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each member of a county board of education to complete certain antibias training at least once during the member's term.
bill_summary: The bill requires each member of a county board of education in Maryland to complete an antibias training at least once during their term. It also mandates the development of antibias training guidelines for school employees and requires biannual training for public school employees who interact frequently with students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and county boards of education
stakeholders: Members of county boards of education, public school employees, students, and communities served by the schools
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; its focus is on antibias training for education officials and staff.

Title: Adult Education - High School Diploma by Examination - Requirements and Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to allow an individual to choose to take all components of the General Educational Development Test in either English or Spanish; and requiring the Department to study the feasibility and cost of offering the examination in additional languages and to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals in Maryland to take all components of the General Educational Development (GED) test in the same language, either English or Spanish, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study offering the GED in additional languages and report on its feasibility.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Adult learners seeking a high school diploma through examination, including English language learners and individuals who have withdrawn from traditional schooling.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts educational pathways and does not directly target small business failure rates, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: State Lottery – Instant Ticket Lottery Machines – Veterans’ and Fraternal Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue certain fraternal organizations a license for not more than three instant ticket lottery machines; altering the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by veterans' organizations; providing for the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by fraternal organizations; altering certain requirements concerning the conduct of gaming through instant ticket lottery machines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue licenses to certain veterans' and fraternal organizations to operate instant ticket lottery machines, modifies the distribution of proceeds from these machines, and sets regulations on their operation and location.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, fraternal organizations, and the general public in Maryland who participate in or are affected by lottery gaming activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could potentially support small organizations by allowing them to operate lottery machines and generate revenue, which may help reduce their risk of failure.

Title: Public Information Act - Public Access Ombudsman - Delegation of Powers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate to a staff member of the Office of the Public Access Ombudsman any of the powers and duties granted to the Ombudsman that are appropriate to the staff member's training and expertise.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Public Access Ombudsman in Maryland to delegate certain powers and duties to staff members, enhancing the office's efficiency and autonomy.
responsible_party: Office of the Public Access Ombudsman, supported by the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Public access to government information and transparency advocates in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but improving transparency and access could indirectly benefit small businesses by fostering a more open government environment.

Title: Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup to develop strategies to prevent cybersecurity disruptions to the healthcare ecosystem, ensure the continuous delivery of essential healthcare ecosystem services, and enhance recovery efforts of the healthcare ecosystem following a cybersecurity incident; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report on or before January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup in Maryland to develop strategies for preventing cybersecurity disruptions, ensuring continuous healthcare services, and improving recovery efforts following cyber incidents within the healthcare sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management, Maryland Health Care Commission, Maryland Insurance Administration, and Maryland Department of Information Technology.
stakeholders: Healthcare entities in Maryland, including hospitals, medical facilities, health information exchanges, and insurance providers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve cybersecurity resilience in the healthcare sector, which could reduce the risk of operational disruptions and financial losses for small healthcare businesses.

Title: Workgroup on Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Universal Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services; requiring the Workgroup to compile updated participant data and expenditure per participant from the home visiting programs currently operating in the State, compare the data for home visiting programs to the data for evidence-based models, identify service gaps, and identify workforce needs; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide program in Maryland to provide universal nurse home visiting services to all families with newborns, aiming to support healthy child development, postpartum health, and family strengthening. It creates a workgroup to oversee and improve the program, and mandates insurance coverage and reimbursement for these services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Families with newborns in Maryland, healthcare providers, insurers, community organizations, and public health agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for insurance coverage and reimbursement, which could help reduce financial barriers for providers and support the sustainability of small businesses involved in home visiting services.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Laurel Race Course - Local Impact Aid
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to distribute from the State Lottery Fund $250,000 of supplemental local impact aid to Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel from the proceeds of the Racetrax lottery game to be used for certain programs and services in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course; specifying the purposes for and manner in which the supplemental local impact aid may be utilized; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from the Maryland State Lottery to support local impact aid for Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel, specifically related to the Laurel Race Course. It directs the use of these funds for community programs such as health, social services, and transportation, especially benefiting backstretch workers and residents near the race course.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller and local governments of Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel
stakeholders: Backstretch workers at Laurel Race Course, residents of Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and Laurel, and nonprofit organizations providing community services in these areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates but provides community support and services that could indirectly benefit local businesses.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems - Statements and Certificates of Violations
Synopsis: Authorizing certain technicians to swear to and affirm, based on inspection of recorded images, the occurrence of violations recorded by speed monitoring systems; requiring law enforcement officers and technicians to complete a reasonable training specific to the speed monitoring system before certifying any certificates of violation; and defining "reasonable training" as a sufficient level of education, instruction, and practical experience to ensure competency in the inspection of images generated by speed monitoring systems.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes technicians to swear to violations recorded by speed monitoring systems, requires law enforcement and technicians to complete specific training before certifying violations, and makes related amendments to Maryland transportation law.
responsible_party: Law enforcement agencies and technicians trained in speed monitoring systems, overseen by local jurisdictions' program administrators.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, law enforcement agencies, technicians, and local jurisdictions implementing speed monitoring systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily involves law enforcement and technical training rather than direct economic support or business operations.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service - Membership of Board of Directors - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to include the Secretary of Planning or a designee and, as nonvoting members, one member from the Senate of Maryland and one from the Maryland House of Delegates; and providing that certain provisions of law relating to terms of members of the Board do not apply to the Secretary of Planning, certain legislative members, and the Executive Director.
bill_summary: The bill amends the composition of the Maryland Environmental Service Board of Directors, replacing the State Treasurer with the Secretary of Planning or their designee, and clarifies the appointment process and terms for board members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and the Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: State government agencies, environmental management entities, and residents of Maryland, especially those in rural areas and private sector stakeholders involved in environmental services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by clarifying governance and potentially improving environmental management, it may indirectly support a stable environment for small businesses.

Title: Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Social Work Licensure Compact for the purpose of authorizing regulated social workers who hold multistate licenses to practice social work in member states in order to improve public access to competent social work services; establishing requirements for multistate licensure; establishing the Social Work Licensure Compact Commission; providing for withdrawal from the Compact; and providing that the Act is contingent on the enactment of substantially similar legislation in six other states.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Maryland's participation in the Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact, which allows regulated social workers with multistate licenses to practice across member states, aiming to improve public access, workforce mobility, and cooperation among states.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Social Work Licensure Compact Commission
stakeholders: Licensed social workers, clients receiving social work services, military families, and the general public in Maryland and other member states.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to streamline licensing processes and reduce burdens for social workers practicing in multiple states, which could help small social work practices operate more efficiently and avoid failure due to licensing issues.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District - Class B-D-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue additional B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in certain areas of the 43rd alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City if the license applicant meets certain criteria; and extending to July 1, 2026, an alcoholic beverages license issued for a certain area for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue new Class B–D–7 alcohol licenses in specific areas of the 43rd alcoholic beverages district, with certain criteria and conditions, and extends the renewal period for a license in the North Charles Street area.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, local businesses, and residents in the 43rd alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support small businesses by allowing new licenses in specific areas and extending license renewal periods, which could help reduce business failures.

Title: Real Property – Recordation and Land Records – Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the filing, maintenance, and transmittal of land records; and defining "land record" as any document recorded by a clerk of the circuit court relating to property.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the procedures and requirements for recording, maintaining, and transmitting land records and related instruments affecting real property in Maryland, including deeds, mortgages, land plats, and notices of federal liens.
responsible_party: Clerk of the Circuit Court and the Supervisor of Assessments in each Maryland county.
stakeholders: Property owners, buyers, sellers, mortgagees, land surveyors, and land record users in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines land record procedures, which can reduce delays and errors in property transactions, potentially lowering the risk of small business failure related to property issues.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 PG 306-25
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum civil penalties for violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County that involve exceeding the maximum speed limit by certain amounts.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County, especially for exceeding the speed limit by certain amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or the relevant local transportation authority in Prince George's County.
stakeholders: Motorists and residents in Prince George's County, especially those using Maryland Route 210.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on traffic enforcement penalties.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2026)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive budget bill for fiscal years 2025 and 2026, detailing appropriations, reductions, and supplemental allocations across various state agencies, programs, and funds, including adjustments contingent on legislation and specific conditions.
responsible_party: The Department of Budget and Management is responsible for implementing the programs, overseeing allocations, and ensuring compliance with the appropriations and amendments.
stakeholders: The stakeholders impacted include state agencies, higher education institutions, local governments, nonprofit organizations, and Maryland residents who benefit from the programs and services funded by the appropriations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes allocations and reductions that may impact small businesses, especially through grants, loans, and program support, but the direct impact on small business failure rates is not explicitly detailed.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2025, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,763,325,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the creation of multiple state debt loans through bonds to fund various public projects across Maryland, including infrastructure, educational, health, cultural, and community development initiatives, with specific provisions for project oversight, matching funds, and project timelines.
responsible_party: The Board of Public Works, Maryland Department of Planning, Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Department of Transportation, Maryland Higher Education Commission, Maryland Department of Commerce, Maryland Department of the Environment, Maryland Department of Juvenile Services, Maryland Hospital Association, and other state agencies and local governments.
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, local governments, educational institutions, health care providers, cultural organizations, community groups, and small businesses.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill allocates funds for community development, infrastructure, and business support programs, which can help improve economic stability and reduce small business failures.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing or altering certain administrative penalties; altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; establishing certain funds; authorizing, requiring, or altering the distribution of certain revenue; altering the rates and rate brackets under the State income tax on certain income of individuals; requiring certain groups of corporations to file a combined income tax return reflecting the aggregate income tax liability of all members of the group; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive budget reconciliation and financing act that allocates funds for various state programs, including transportation, education, health, environmental, and economic development initiatives, and makes adjustments to tax laws and other fiscal policies.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Budget and Management, the Maryland Department of Transportation, the Maryland Department of Health, and other relevant state agencies are responsible for implementing the programs and allocations specified in the bill.
stakeholders: The residents of Maryland, small businesses, local governments, educational institutions, healthcare providers, environmental organizations, and specific populations such as veterans, students, and individuals involved in the criminal justice system are impacted by the bill.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions that support small business development, such as grants, loans, and tax credits, which could help reduce small business failure rates, but the direct impact on failure reduction is not explicitly quantified.

Title: Prince George's County - Community Associations - Registration Fees for Administrative Hearing Process PG 408-25
Synopsis: Altering the registration fee requirement for the Community Association Registry; permitting the County Executive to establish the registration fee; prohibiting a person or entity who fails to register from filing a dispute; and requiring the Prince George's County Office of Community Relations to provide revenue from annual community association registration fees to fund the administrative hearing process for disputes between community associations and owners in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the registration fee requirements for community associations in Prince George's County, allowing the County Executive to set the fee, and directs that revenue from these fees fund the administrative hearing process for disputes between community associations and owners. It also mandates registration for various types of community associations and management entities, and establishes the Prince George's County Office of Community Relations as responsible for managing the registry and fees.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Office of Community Relations
stakeholders: Community associations, property owners, developers, and residents in Prince George's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on managing registration fees and dispute resolution processes aims to streamline community association management and reduce conflicts, which can contribute to the stability and success of small community-based businesses and associations.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - English Proficiency Requirements and Licensure by Endorsement for Nursing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration if an applicant holds a valid, unrestricted license, certification, or registration from another state that requires evidence of English proficiency; requiring each health occupations board that requires evidence of English proficiency to post a statement on their website that an applicant may not be required to provide additional evidence of proficiency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health occupations boards in Maryland from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency for licensure if an applicant already holds a valid license from another state that requires English proficiency. It also mandates that these boards prominently display on their websites a list of states with similar requirements and updates the acceptable proof of English proficiency for nursing licensure, endorsement, and pharmacy licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland State health occupations boards, including the State Board of Nursing and the Board of Pharmacy.
stakeholders: Applicants seeking licensure in health occupations such as nursing and pharmacy, including those licensed in other states, and the general public receiving healthcare services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces barriers for licensed health professionals moving to Maryland, which can facilitate their employment and reduce delays in licensing, potentially decreasing small business failure related to staffing shortages.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Sunset Repeal PG 403-25
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of certain provisions of law establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause that terminated certain provisions establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority, thereby extending its authority and functions.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development.
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and communities within the target area of Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood in Prince George's County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support neighborhood revitalization and economic development, which could help reduce small business failures in the targeted communities.

Title: Bicycles, Play Vehicles, and Unicycles - Authorizations and Requirements (Jay's Law)
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to ride a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area unless prohibited by local ordinance; and requiring a person riding a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area or in or through a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian or a person using an electric personal assistive mobility device.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes people to ride bicycles, play vehicles, or unicycles on sidewalks unless prohibited by local law, and requires riders on sidewalks or in crosswalks to yield to pedestrians and electric personal assistive mobility device users.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local transportation authorities
stakeholders: Cyclists, pedestrians, and users of electric personal assistive mobility devices in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Cybersecurity Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the selection of the membership and chair of the Maryland Cybersecurity Council; requiring beginning on October 1, 2025, and every 2 years thereafter, the Council to elect a chair and vice chair from among the members of the Council; requiring the Council, working with certain entities, to assess and address cybersecurity threats and associated risks from artificial intelligence and quantum computing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes alterations to the Maryland Cybersecurity Council, including changes to its membership, selection process, and chair. It requires the Council to work with various entities to assess and address cybersecurity threats and risks from artificial intelligence and quantum computing, and to develop strategies for cybersecurity resilience.
