responsible_party: Maryland Cybersecurity Council, working in collaboration with the Maryland State Government agencies and federal agencies.
stakeholders: Cybersecurity companies, higher education institutions, private sector businesses, government agencies, critical infrastructure sectors, and Maryland residents.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity and infrastructure resilience indirectly supports small businesses by enhancing overall cybersecurity defenses, but it does not specifically target small business failure reduction.

Title: Maryland Disability Service Animal Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program in the Department of Disabilities to select one or more nonprofit training entities to participate in the Program and provide additional funding mechanisms to assist eligible individuals in the Program; requiring the Department to select at least one nonprofit training entity to develop and implement a training protocol and to select qualified participants; and establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program Fund to pay a participating nonprofit training entity.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program within the Department of Disabilities to assist eligible individuals with disabilities in training and partnering with service animals. It creates a fund to support the program, mandates the Department to select nonprofit training entities, and sets regulations for implementation.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland who could benefit from service animals
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program supports nonprofit training entities that train service animals, which could help these organizations succeed and reduce their failure rate.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Drunk and Drugged Driving - Points Assessments
Synopsis: Imposing assessments of 12 points for certain subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations.
bill_summary: The bill increases the points assessed for subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations in Maryland, and establishes penalties for repeat offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA) and the Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Drivers in Maryland, especially those with prior violations of drunk and drugged driving laws
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Day Care Centers, Child Care Homes, and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain large family child care homes; increasing the maximum amount of a property tax credit that may be granted for certain child care homes and centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts personal property used in connection with large family child care homes from property valuation and taxes, and increases the maximum property tax credits available for day care centers and child care homes. It also allows local governments to grant property tax credits for certain day care facilities and improvements.
responsible_party: The local governments of Baltimore City, counties, and municipal corporations, specifically their legislative bodies responsible for granting property tax credits.
stakeholders: Large family child care homes, day care centers, child care homes, and the families and children who use these facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial relief through property tax exemptions and credits for child care providers, which can help reduce operational costs and support the stability of small child care businesses.

Title: Affordable Housing Payment In Lieu of Taxes Expansion Act
Synopsis: Authorizing an owner of real property used for rental housing and the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement for maintaining at least 25% of the rental housing units located at the real property as affordable dwelling units for at least 15 years; and authorizing the governing body of the county to require the owner of real property to maintain a higher percentage of rental housing units as affordable dwelling units than the minimum percentage specified in the Act.
bill_summary: The bill expands the use of payment in lieu of taxes (PILOT) agreements for rental housing properties, allowing property owners and county governments to negotiate agreements where owners maintain at least 25% of units as affordable for at least 15 years in exchange for property tax exemptions.
responsible_party: County governments and property owners of rental housing
stakeholders: Rental housing residents, property owners, and local governments in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by encouraging affordable rental housing development, which can stabilize communities and reduce financial burdens on tenants and owners.

Title: Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Oyster Shucking House Loan Program
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans in an amount up to $25,000 for certain seasonal full-time jobs; and reducing, from 5 years to 3 years, the number of years that a person must have been a licensed seafood dealer in order to be eligible to receive financing under the loan program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Oyster Shucking House Loan Program to allow loans up to $250,000 for seafood processing projects, with specific provisions for creating or retaining seasonal full-time jobs, and reduces the eligibility requirement for licensed seafood dealers from 5 years to 3 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Seafood dealers, oyster shucking businesses, and communities involved in oyster processing and restoration in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial support and incentives for seafood processing businesses, which can help reduce the risk of failure for small businesses in this sector.

Title: Anne Arundel County Board of Education - Student Member Scholarship - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term on the county board from $8,000 to $15,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term from $8,000 to $15,000.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education and students in higher education in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Hearing Aid Dispenser Members
Synopsis: Altering the appointment process for licensed hearing aid dispenser members of the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists by requiring the Board to notify all licensed hearing aid dispensers in the State of the vacancy and to solicit nominations to fill the vacancy.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the appointment process for the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, including changes to the composition and appointment procedures of the Board.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health or the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists.
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, and music therapists practicing in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily concerns appointment procedures for licensing boards.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Part-Time Deputy Chief Inspector - Compensation
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: The Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County, part-time inspectors, and the local government of Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to salaries of inspectors.

Title: State Designations – State Mineral – Chromite (State Mineral Act)
Synopsis: Designating chromite, which reflects the nature of Maryland's rich mining history and vast mineral resources, as the State mineral.
bill_summary: This bill designates chromite as the official state mineral of Maryland, recognizing its historical significance and presence in the state's mining history.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources or relevant state agency responsible for state symbols and mineral resources.
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those interested in the state's history, mining industry, and natural resources.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing failure rates among small businesses.

Title: Elections - Local Boards of Elections - Open Meeting Requirements (Local Boards of Elections Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each local board of elections to make available on its website each open meeting agenda, a summary of any finalized documents, certain written testimony, and other materials on which the  board will be voting; requiring each local board to provide live video streaming of each open meeting and to maintain a complete and unedited archived video recording of each open meeting for 5 years; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations to ensure that the streaming requirements are met in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes enhanced open meeting requirements for local boards of elections in Maryland, including public availability of meeting agendas, live video streaming of meetings, and maintaining archived recordings for at least 5 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, political parties, and organizations involved in elections in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it promotes transparency and accountability in election processes.

Title: Criminal Law - Controlled Dangerous Substances and Firearms
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is at least 21 years of age to manufacture a personal use amount of cannabis products or concentrated cannabis for personal use or adult sharing at a private residence if the manufacturing process does not involve the use of a volatile solvent; specifying that manufacturing, distributing, dispensing, or possessing certain large quantities of certain controlled dangerous substances is a felony; altering the penalties for being a volume dealer and drug kingpin with regard to cannabis; etc.
bill_summary: The bill legalizes the manufacturing of small amounts of cannabis for personal use and adult sharing at private residences, with restrictions on the use of volatile solvents. It also revises penalties for large-scale drug offenses, modifies sentences for certain drug-related convictions, and updates firearm and firearm parts regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and Maryland State Police
stakeholders: Adults in Maryland who use or share cannabis, small business owners involved in cannabis manufacturing, law enforcement agencies, and the general public
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for legal small-scale cannabis manufacturing and adult sharing are likely to reduce failures for small cannabis-related businesses by clarifying legal boundaries and reducing criminal penalties.

Title: State Library Agency - Family Literacy Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Family Literacy Pilot Program administered by the State Library Agency in consultation with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Correctional Education Council to enable certain incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing a recording; and requiring the State Library Agency to submit a certain report on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Family Literacy Pilot Program, which allows incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing recordings and providing children's books, to foster family literacy and strengthen parent-child relationships.
responsible_party: The State Library Agency in consultation with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Correctional Education Council.
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and their children, including biological, adopted, stepchildren, grandchildren, or legal wards.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or provide programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Education and Health - Emergency Use Epinephrine - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "auto-injectable epinephrine" to be "emergency use epinephrine" and to include certain drug delivery devices and products; and altering the name of the Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program to be the Emergency Use Epinephrine Program.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to expand the definition of 'auto-injectable epinephrine' to 'emergency use epinephrine', includes additional drug delivery devices, and establishes programs and policies for the administration of emergency use epinephrine in schools, child care, youth camps, and other institutions to treat anaphylaxis.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students, children, youth camp attendees, school personnel, child care providers, and individuals at risk of anaphylaxis in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill facilitates the availability and administration of emergency use epinephrine in various settings, which can reduce health emergencies and liabilities, potentially lowering small business failure related to health crises.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention Hotline
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund for certain expenditures that support the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline; and altering a certain restriction on the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to prohibit funds from being used for expenses solely related to the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, instead of preventing the use of funds for any costs associated with the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of the 9–1–1 Trust Fund to support the 9–8–8 suicide prevention hotline, including costs related to its operation that can be shared with 9–1–1 activities. It also clarifies that funds cannot be used solely for the 9–8–8 hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland 9–1–1 Trust Fund and related public safety agencies
stakeholders: Emergency response agencies, mental health and suicide prevention organizations, and the general public seeking mental health support
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by supporting emergency and mental health services, it may indirectly benefit related small businesses in the health and safety sector.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland 9-1-1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management - Regulatory Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland 9-1-1 Board to adopt regulations to implement and enforce certain responsibilities of the Board; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations to implement and enforce the responsibilities of the Department.
bill_summary: The bill grants regulatory authority to the Maryland 9–1–1 Board and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations for the implementation, enforcement, and oversight of 9–1–1 systems, including enhanced and Next Generation 9–1–1 services, standards, and personnel training.
responsible_party: The Maryland 9–1–1 Board and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency response personnel, and residents of Maryland who rely on 9–1–1 services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by establishing clear standards and regulations for emergency management and 9–1–1 systems, it may improve overall emergency response infrastructure.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Authority and Stakeholder Council Membership (Lowering Prescription Drug Costs for All Marylanders Now Act)
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Prescription Drug Affordability Stakeholder Council; requiring the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, to establish a process for setting upper payment limits for purchases and payor reimbursements of prescription drug products that the Board determines have led or will lead to affordability challenges; authorizing the Board to reconsider an upper payment limit for a drug that becomes a current shortage; and altering requirements related to the setting of upper payment limits.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prescription Drug Affordability Board's authority to set upper payment limits for prescription drugs in Maryland, especially for drugs that cause affordability challenges or are in shortage. It also creates a Stakeholder Council to advise the Board and outlines reporting requirements on drug prices, access, and the impact of payment limits.
responsible_party: The Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare providers, pharmacies, drug manufacturers, and the biotechnology industry in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on setting upper payment limits and monitoring drug shortages aims to stabilize drug prices and supply, which could reduce financial pressures on small pharmacies and drug manufacturers, thereby potentially lowering small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Auctioneers
Synopsis: Exempting certain auctioneers from certain provisions of the State Boat Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain auctioneers from specific provisions of the Maryland State Boat Act, clarifying that licensed auctioneers acting on behalf of sellers, secured parties, or owners do not qualify as 'dealers' under the law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boat auctioneers, boat sellers, and owners in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying the legal status of auctioneers and potentially reducing legal and operational uncertainties, the bill may help small boat auction businesses operate more smoothly and avoid failure.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Tabulation Audits - Risk-Limiting Audits
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections, in collaboration with the local boards of elections, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after each statewide election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after a special general election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct an automated software audit after a statewide election; authorizing a local board to conduct a risk-limiting audit of a local contest under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland State Board of Elections to conduct risk-limiting audits after each statewide election, including automated software audits and manual audits of voter-verifiable paper records, to ensure the accuracy of vote tabulation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, candidates, election officials, and political parties in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it focuses on election auditing procedures.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Public Accountancy to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to reinstate the license of an individual who is on emeritus status under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy to place licensed certified public accountants on emeritus status under certain conditions, allowing them to retire from active practice while maintaining a form of recognition and limited privileges.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants in Maryland, especially those nearing retirement or who are retired
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce small business failure by allowing experienced accountants to remain recognized and possibly provide limited services, which can support business stability.

Title: Medical Debt - Complaints for Money Judgment and Real Property Liens
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for a complaint for a money judgment; defining "medical debt" as a debt owed by a consumer to a provider of medical services, products, or devices, but does not include debt charged to a credit card except under certain circumstances; prohibiting the creation of a lien on owner-occupied residential property by contract or as a result of a breach of contract for the payment of medical debt; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for complaints seeking a money judgment related to medical debt, prohibits creating liens on owner-occupied residential property for medical debt, and provides procedures for removing such liens if they are created in violation of the law.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners with owner-occupied residential property, medical service providers, and debt collectors
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individual homeowners and medical providers, with no direct mention of small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Contracts - Limitation Periods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer contract from setting a shorter time to bring an action under or on the consumer contract than required by the law of the State; excluding certain entities from the application of this Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits consumer contracts from including provisions that set shorter time limits for legal actions than the law requires, making such provisions void and unenforceable. It aims to protect consumers from unfair contractual terms related to legal action limitations.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, as well as the Maryland General Assembly for enforcement and oversight.
stakeholders: Consumers entering into consumer contracts within Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily affects consumer contracts and consumer protection laws.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Medical Exemption for Enhanced Tinted Windows - Time Limitation
Synopsis: Repealing the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows for vehicle owners with certain permanent medical conditions.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the 2-year time limit on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows on vehicles for owners with permanent medical conditions, allowing such exemptions to be valid indefinitely.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police, Automotive Safety Enforcement Division
stakeholders: Vehicle owners with certain medical conditions requiring tinted windows, law enforcement, and vehicle manufacturers or installers of tinting materials.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects vehicle owners and law enforcement policies rather than small businesses.

Title: Criminal Law - Visual Surveillance With Prurient Intent - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "private place" as it relates to the prohibition on conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent of an individual without the consent of the individual to include a residence; and altering the prohibition against conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to modify the definition of 'private place' and clarifies the prohibition against conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent, especially regarding private areas of individuals, regardless of whether they are in public or private places.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies responsible for enforcement of criminal laws.
stakeholders: Individuals whose private areas or private places may be subject to visual surveillance, and the general public concerned with privacy rights.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses criminal conduct related to visual surveillance and privacy, and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Civil Actions - Tortious Injury to or Death of Pet - Compensatory Damages (Buddy's Law)
Synopsis: Increasing from $10,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount of compensatory damages that may be awarded to an owner of a pet from a person who tortiously causes an injury to or death of the pet while acting individually or through an animal under the person's ownership, direction, or control.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of compensatory damages that can be awarded to pet owners when their pet is injured or killed due to someone else's tortious actions from $10,000 to $25,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, specifically the courts that handle civil tort cases involving pets.
stakeholders: Pet owners in Maryland, pet owners' legal representatives, and individuals or entities involved in tort cases involving pets.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims and Witnesses - Out of Court Statement of Child to Forensic Interviewer
Synopsis: Expanding the evidentiary rule on the admissibility of out of court statements made by child victims or witnesses to make admissible an out of court statement made by a child to a forensic interviewer.
bill_summary: The bill expands the rules for admitting out-of-court statements made by child victims or witnesses in criminal and juvenile court proceedings, specifically allowing statements made to forensic interviewers under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system, specifically juvenile and criminal courts, and forensic interviewers.
stakeholders: Child victims and witnesses under the age of 13 involved in criminal or juvenile court cases in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Baby Food Labeling - Statement Regarding Toxic Heavy Metal Testing - Terminology
Synopsis: Altering the statement that must be included on a baby food product label if the baby food product has been tested for toxic heavy metals for the purpose of changing the term included on the label from "toxic heavy metal" to "toxic element".
bill_summary: The bill requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals and disclose the results to consumers via labels and online. It also updates labeling language from 'toxic heavy metal' to 'toxic element' and mandates public reporting of test results.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA)
stakeholders: Parents and caregivers of babies and children under 2 years old, baby food manufacturers, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily involves testing and labeling requirements rather than financial or operational burdens.

Title: Criminal Law - Interference With a Public Safety Answering Point - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from taking certain actions with the intent to interrupt or impair the functioning of a public safety answering point; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 5 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws against cybercrimes, specifically targeting acts that interfere with public safety answering points and other critical infrastructure, with increased penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies responsible for cybersecurity enforcement.
stakeholders: Cybercriminals, public safety agencies, critical infrastructure operators, and the general public relying on emergency response systems.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on cybersecurity laws and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in the Department of Natural Resources to curb the spread of the invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries; requiring the Department to expand the use of practices determined to be effective under the Program; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on its findings and recommendations based on the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in Maryland to control the spread of invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries. It allows certain fishing practices and programs to increase the harvest of blue catfish, including the use of trotlines and other methods, and sets regulations for these activities. The program will be evaluated and reported on by December 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources in coordination with the Invasive Catfish Advisory Committee
stakeholders: Fishermen, commercial fishing industry, environmental conservation groups, and residents of Maryland affected by invasive species in the Chesapeake Bay
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to increase the harvest of invasive blue catfish, which could benefit commercial fishermen by providing new opportunities and reducing competition from invasive species, potentially decreasing small business failure related to fishing restrictions.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Property Tax Credit – Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated
Synopsis: Altering the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc., to be Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, for purposes of a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation tax imposed on the entity; and authorizing the tax credit for any real property owned by the entity.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a property tax credit in Anne Arundel County for real property owned by Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, and alters the name of the organization for the purposes of the tax credit.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, and property owners in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a tax credit to support Habitat for Humanity, which may help reduce financial challenges faced by the organization, potentially lowering its risk of failure.

Title: Modernization of Military Laws Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to develop certain policies related to life transitions of veterans, service members, and military families; and altering the application of certain provisions of law related to veterans, the uniformed services, and the filing of certificates of candidacy, the powers of the Governor, State veterans' cemeteries, and housing and employment discrimination.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's military laws by establishing interpretation rules for the uniformed services, updating veteran-related legal provisions, creating policies for life transitions of veterans and service members, and improving veteran and military family services including cemeteries and benefits.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and their dependents in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may indirectly support veteran entrepreneurs and small businesses through improved veteran services and benefits.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Disability Reduced Fare Program - Renewal for Permanently Disabled Individuals
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the Disability Reduced Fare Program certification of an enrollee who is permanently disabled.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the certification of individuals who are permanently disabled for the Disability Reduced Fare Program, and mandates the adoption of regulations to implement this process.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Individuals who are permanently disabled and use the Disability Reduced Fare Program in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This program is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Outdoor Lighting - Guidance and Use of State Funds
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Green Building Council, on or before October 1, 2026, to update or develop guidance for the purchase of outdoor lighting fixtures in consideration of certain recommendations; prohibiting State funds from being used to install or replace certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting unless certain requirements are met; altering the requirements for the use of State funds for the installation or replacement of certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates guidelines for outdoor lighting in Maryland, including restrictions on the use of state funds for outdoor luminaires to promote energy conservation and reduce light pollution. It also requires the Maryland Green Building Council to develop or update guidance on outdoor lighting purchase, and mandates a review of highway lighting practices by the Department of Transportation.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Building Council and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State agencies, outdoor lighting manufacturers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on energy-efficient outdoor lighting and guidelines may encourage sustainable practices, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Development Impact Fees
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain limitations on the authority of the Anne Arundel County Council to grant exemptions from or credits against development impact fees.
bill_summary: The bill amends the scope of exemptions and credits for development impact fees in Anne Arundel County, allowing the County Council to grant exemptions or credits for certain types of development projects, including affordable housing and land conveyances that meet specific needs.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Council and the County government
stakeholders: Developers, property owners, and residents of Anne Arundel County, especially those involved in affordable housing and public infrastructure projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by easing development costs through impact fee exemptions and credits, encouraging development and expansion.

Title: Braille Flag Memorial Act of 2025
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag to be placed on the grounds of one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor members of the uniformed services, veterans, and other individuals in the State who are blind or visually impaired.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag at one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor blind and visually impaired veterans and members of the military.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired veterans and military members, visitors to Maryland veterans' cemeteries, and the broader community that honors veterans.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: University of Maryland, College Park Campus - TerpsEXCEED Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill, beginning in fiscal year 2027, an appropriation of $350,000 to the University of Maryland, College Park Campus TerpsEXCEED (EXperiencing College through Education and Employment Discovery) Program to provide educational and employment opportunities to students with intellectual disabilities.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Governor to allocate $350,000 annually starting in fiscal year 2027 to fund the University of Maryland, College Park's TerpsEXCEED Program, which provides educational and employment opportunities for students with intellectual disabilities.
responsible_party: The University of Maryland, College Park Campus and the Maryland State government (through the Governor's budget)
stakeholders: Students with intellectual disabilities, their families, and educational institutions involved in the TerpsEXCEED Program.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program's funding aims to support students with disabilities in gaining employment and education, which could contribute to reducing small business failure by increasing employment opportunities and fostering inclusive workplaces.

Title: Counties - Cancer Screening for Professional Firefighters - Required Coverage (James "Jimmy" Malone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring counties that offer self-insured employee health benefit plans to provide to firefighters employed by the county coverage for preventive cancer screenings in accordance with certain guidelines; authorizing a county to satisfy the requirement by providing a no-cost annual examination or applying for a grant to pay for certain cancer screening technologies; prohibiting counties from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement; and requiring the Maryland Health Commission to conduct a certain study.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for preventive cancer screenings for professional firefighters without copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles. It also mandates counties offering self-insured employee health plans to ensure coverage for firefighters and to possibly provide free annual examinations or apply for grants for cancer screening technologies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Professional firefighters employed by state, county, or municipal entities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are focused on firefighter health coverage and do not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Administration - 3-Hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program established by the Motor Vehicle Administration for certain applicants for driver's licenses; and requiring the Administration to adopt regulations establishing criteria for certifying a private entity to offer the 3-hour Roadway Safety Education Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to establish a 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program for certain new drivers and modifies the existing requirements for driver licensing, including the implementation of this safety program.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: New and prospective drivers in Maryland, especially those applying for a driver’s license without prior licensing experience.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program includes provisions for private providers to offer the education, which could support small businesses involved in driver education and safety training.

Title: Health Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health, the regulation of health occupations, and housing vouchers and assistance to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and legal definitions to support service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland, including behavioral health services, housing assistance, and licensing accommodations, with a focus on ensuring access and recognition of their service status.
responsible_party: The Department of Veterans and Military Families and related state agencies.
stakeholders: Active service members, veterans, their families, and individuals receiving behavioral health and housing services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions to expedite licensing for service members and veterans, which could help reduce barriers to employment and small business success for these populations.

Title: Local Government - Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau Designation
Synopsis: Altering references to the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to be Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the name of the organization receiving a portion of hotel tax revenue in Anne Arundel County from the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc., and establishes reporting and auditing requirements for the organization and the Arts Council of Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc. and the Arts Council of Anne Arundel County, Inc.
stakeholders: Tourists, local businesses, residents of Anne Arundel County and Annapolis, and the organizations involved in tourism and arts funding.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on transparency, reporting, and auditing of tourism and arts funding organizations may help improve financial management and stability, potentially reducing small business failures related to tourism and arts sectors.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Obscured, Modified, or Blocked Registration Plates and Registration Plate Covers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from obscuring or modifying any vehicle registration plate in a manner that may prevent identification and enforcing the prohibition as a secondary offense; prohibiting a person from advertising for or promoting the sale of an unlawful registration plate cover by falsely claiming that the registration plate cover is lawful in the State; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits obscuring, modifying, or blocking vehicle registration plates and bans the sale and promotion of unlawful registration plate covers that obscure or distort plates. It enforces these rules as secondary violations and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, law enforcement, and businesses selling registration plate covers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill restricts the sale and promotion of certain registration plate covers, which could impact small businesses involved in selling these products, but it primarily aims to improve road safety and enforcement.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 45th Alcoholic Beverages District - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 45th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City under certain circumstances; and altering a geographic boundary in the 45th district within which the holder of a Class A or Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license must operate in accordance with specified hours.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue a new Class C alcohol license in the 45th district, modifies geographic boundaries for certain alcohol licenses, and adjusts sale hours and conditions for various alcohol license classes within Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially in the 45th district and surrounding areas.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could help small alcohol businesses by allowing new licenses and flexible sale hours, potentially reducing business failure due to licensing restrictions.

Title: Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a recipient of an award under the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program may hold the award under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program to extend the duration a recipient can hold the award, allowing them to maintain eligibility for up to 3 years after initial enrollment or up to 6 years for part-time students, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Community College system and the Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland, especially those receiving or eligible for the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts community college students and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Transportation Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing transportation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services and veterans, broadening the application of transportation laws to include all uniformed services, and makes various amendments to Maryland law to recognize the status and benefits of service members and veterans.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families and the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration.
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions that support active service members and veterans, which may indirectly help small businesses by supporting military families and service members, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverages licenses that may be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota for issuing Class A alcoholic beverage licenses in St. Mary's County, specifically adjusting the number of licenses available in the 8th election district based on population statistics.
responsible_party: The Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary's County, especially those involved in the sale of alcoholic beverages in the 8th election district.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By adjusting license quotas based on population, the bill aims to better regulate the number of licenses, potentially reducing competition and barriers for small businesses in the alcohol retail sector.

Title: State Department of Education - Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Regulatory Analysis
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to conduct a thorough analysis of the State's regulatory framework for child care facilities with particular emphasis on regulations that limit a person's ability to register a child care facility, receive a license to operate a child care center, or operate a child care facility in a profitable manner while providing quality care; and requiring an interim and final report be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and September 1, 2026, respectively.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning the number of children allowed in family child care homes and centers, adjusts adult-to-child ratios, and requires the Department of Education to analyze and report on the state's child care regulatory framework to improve safety, quality, and operational efficiency.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in care, families, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline regulations and improve operational conditions for child care providers, which could reduce barriers to entry and operation, potentially decreasing small business failure rates in the child care sector.

Title: Hagerstown Community College Police Force - Jurisdiction
Synopsis: Authorizing a Hagerstown Community College police officer to exercise powers granted to a peace and police officer under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Hagerstown Community College police officers to exercise certain law enforcement powers outside the college property under specific circumstances within Washington County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Hagerstown Community College Police Force in coordination with the Maryland State Police and Washington County law enforcement agencies.
stakeholders: Hagerstown Community College students, staff, and faculty, as well as residents and visitors of Washington County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily pertains to law enforcement jurisdiction.

Title: St. Mary’s County – County Plans – Public Sewerage Systems and Water Supply Systems
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions relating to the adoption of or revision or amendment to a county plan to county plans in St. Mary's County; and repealing certain provisions relating to public sewerage systems and water supply systems in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process for adopting or amending county plans related to public sewerage and water supply systems in St. Mary’s County, removing certain requirements and clarifying review procedures.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Planning Commission and the Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary’s County who are affected by sewerage and water supply planning and infrastructure decisions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines approval processes for sewerage and water systems, potentially reducing delays and costs for small businesses involved in related projects.

Title: Washington County - Board of License Commissioners - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain numbers of members of the Board of License Commissioners for Washington County belong to certain political parties based on the aggregated number of votes in the preceding election of the Board of County Commissioners.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership requirements for the Washington County Board of License Commissioners, specifying that two members must belong to the political party with the highest number of votes in the previous election, and one member must belong to the second highest. It also clarifies appointment and removal procedures.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of License Commissioners and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Washington County, Maryland, especially those involved in the sale and distribution of alcoholic beverages.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on political composition of the licensing board may influence licensing decisions, but it does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Occupational Licensing and Certification - Criminal History - Predetermination Review Process
Synopsis: Providing that "department" does not include the Maryland Department of Health or the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services for purposes of certain provisions prohibiting a department from refusing to issue an occupational license or certificate based on a certain conviction under certain circumstances; establishing a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain departments of State government; authorizing a department to charge a criminal history review fee of up to $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain Maryland state departments, allowing individuals to request a review of their criminal history to determine if it disqualifies them from obtaining a license, with the aim of reducing barriers for nonviolent ex-offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Department of the Environment, Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals seeking occupational licenses or certificates in Maryland, especially nonviolent ex-offenders
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on reducing barriers for ex-offenders to obtain occupational licenses can help improve employment opportunities, potentially decreasing small business failure related to workforce challenges.

Title: St. Mary's County - Corrections
Synopsis: Adding programs, a day reporting program, an in-patient treatment program, and a pretrial release supervision program, that the St. Mary's County Sheriff is authorized to establish; repealing a requirement that the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee collect the earnings of a certain individual participating in a certain program; and authorizing the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee to direct an individual participating in a certain program to provide proof that the individual has made payments toward certain obligations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Sheriff to establish various correctional programs, including home detention, day reporting, work release, inpatient treatment, pretrial supervision, and prerelease programs. It also allows the Sheriff to direct participants to provide proof of payments toward certain obligations and removes the previous requirement that earnings of participants be collected.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee
stakeholders: Individuals participating in correctional programs in St. Mary's County, including inmates and pretrial detainees.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily pertains to correctional program administration.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Civil Penalty for Sales Violations
Synopsis: Increasing, from $1,000 to $2,500, the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County may impose for a violation of a law relating to licensing the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County can impose for violations related to the licensing and sale of alcoholic beverages, raising it from $1,000 to $2,500.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County
stakeholders: Businesses licensed to sell alcoholic beverages in St. Mary's County, employees of these businesses, and consumers in St. Mary's County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By increasing the civil penalty limit, the bill may help improve compliance and reduce violations, potentially supporting the stability of small businesses involved in alcohol sales.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Study on Building Code Requirements for Single-Staircase Buildings
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings in the State and other States and analyze best practices when drafting building code requirements; requiring the Department to make legislative and regulatory recommendations for the purpose of increasing the affordable housing supply by reducing barriers to multifamily housing development; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings and make recommendations to potentially allow the construction of such buildings up to six stories high to increase affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Housing developers, residents seeking affordable housing, local governments, fire safety agencies, and historic property owners.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to reduce barriers to multifamily housing development, which could help small housing developers and builders succeed by expanding permissible building types.

Title: St. Mary's County - Competitive Bidding - Threshold
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum contract value to $50,000 to require a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County for contracts for services or supplies.
bill_summary: The bill increases the contract value threshold for requiring a competitive bidding process in St. Mary’s County from $15,000 to $50,000 for contracts for services or supplies.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County government (county commissioners)
stakeholders: Businesses and vendors seeking contracts with St. Mary’s County government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By raising the threshold to $50,000, the bill may reduce the administrative burden on small businesses and increase their opportunities to compete for county contracts, potentially reducing small business failures.

Title: St. Mary's County - Metropolitan Commission - Discontinuance of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue all or part of water or sewer service provided to an improved private property determined to be unsafe, unfit, or unsuitable for human occupancy due to an accident, artificial disaster, or natural disaster; requiring the suspension of the ready-to-serve charge on certain private properties; and authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to utilize certain remedies for a violation related to certain public water and sewer use.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue water or sewer service to private properties under certain conditions, including nonpayment and unsafe conditions, and to suspend the ready-to-serve charge during service discontinuance. It also allows the Commission to use various enforcement remedies for violations of water and sewer regulations.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in St. Mary's County who receive water and sewer services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individual property owners and residents, not small businesses, so its direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Frederick County - County Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of Human Resources of Frederick County to request from the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services a State and national criminal history records check for a prospective or current county employee or county volunteer; requiring the Central Repository to forward certain information to certain persons; requiring that the information remain confidential and that it be used only for personnel-related purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County's Human Resources Director to request criminal history records checks for current or prospective employees and volunteers, and establishes confidentiality and contest procedures for the information obtained.
responsible_party: Frederick County's Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: County employees and volunteers of Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on criminal background checks for county employees and volunteers, not directly on small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Recreational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health and the regulation of health occupations to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces; altering the circumstances under which licenses for fishing in tidal waters do not lapse; etc.
bill_summary: The Recreational Equality for Service Members Act establishes rules for interpreting the terms related to military service, expands the application of natural resource laws to include all uniformed services, and provides free access to state parks and fishing licenses for active service members, veterans, and certain disabled individuals. It also authorizes grants for recreational activities benefiting veterans and service members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Active service members, veterans, disabled veterans, and their families in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on recreational access and benefits for service members and veterans, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Residential Child Care Programs - Transportation Companies - Regulation (Preventing Abduction in Youth Transport Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from using certain restraints unless there is a substantial likelihood of imminent serious physical harm to a child or others; prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from picking up children between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m.; authorizing an individual and the Attorney General to bring a certain civil action against certain transportation companies; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill regulates transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs, prohibiting certain restraints and pick-up times, and establishing legal actions for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Children in residential child care programs, transportation companies, and their families
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on restraints and pick-up times could impact transportation companies' operations, potentially reducing failures related to compliance issues.

Title: Procurement Reform Act of 2025
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of General Services to delegate certain powers and duties to the Chief Procurement Officer; altering the authority of the Department of General Services to engage in or control procurement of certain equipment and services; requiring the Department of Information Technology to establish a technical procurement team; altering the authority of the Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transportation Authority to engage in procurement for certain supplies and services; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's procurement laws by expanding and clarifying procedures for state contracts, promoting small, minority, women, veteran, and environmentally focused businesses, establishing new programs for internships and apprenticeships, and implementing good labor practices evaluation factors.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of General Services, the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs, and the Maryland Environmental Service.
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority-owned businesses, veteran-owned businesses, environmental organizations, state agencies, contractors, and workforce development programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill introduces multiple programs and preferences aimed at increasing small business participation and success in state procurement, which could significantly reduce small business failure rates.

Title: Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy and Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Department of Disabilities; establishing the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative within the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy to facilitate efforts that improve outcomes in the hiring, recruitment, retention, and advancement of people with disabilities in the State government workforce; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027, to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Maryland Department of Disabilities and creates the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities in state government.
responsible_party: The Department of Disabilities, specifically the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy.
stakeholders: People with disabilities seeking employment, state government agencies, and the broader community benefiting from increased employment inclusion.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on employment practices within state government and does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Excellence in Maryland Public Schools Act
Synopsis: Altering the source of funds for the Blueprint for Maryland's Future Fund to include the interest earnings of the Academic Excellence Fund; authorizing the Department to establish a national teacher recruitment campaign; establishing the Academic Excellence Program in the Department to address critical academic needs in public schools; requiring the Department to consult with a certain entity to evaluate  the Concentration of Poverty School Grant Program and establish requirements for community school implementation plans; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland to exceed certain tax limits for education funding, establishes various programs and grants to improve public education including community schools, teacher recruitment, leadership training, and funding for special education, and creates the Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact to facilitate teacher licensure across states.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and the Department of Community Schools
stakeholders: Students, families, teachers, school administrators, community organizations, and local school systems in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions for grants and funding mechanisms that support educational programs and community services, which may indirectly impact small business success by improving community stability and workforce development.

Title: Chesapeake Bay Legacy Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program; establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program Fund to support actions associated with the Program's purpose; altering the definition of "healthy soils" for purposes of the Maryland Healthy Soils Program; exempting certain holders of certain fishing licenses from the requirement to obtain a food establishment license from the Maryland Department of Health; establishing the Water Quality Monitoring Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Chesapeake Bay Legacy Act, creating programs and funds to promote environmentally engaged farming, water quality monitoring, fisheries management, and restoration projects in Maryland, with a focus on Chesapeake Bay watershed health and sustainability.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Department of Natural Resources, Department of the Environment, and related state agencies.
stakeholders: Farmers, fishers, environmental organizations, local communities, and residents in Maryland, especially those in the Chesapeake Bay watershed.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides incentives and support for sustainable farming and fishing practices, which can help small businesses in agriculture and fisheries to reduce failure rates by promoting environmentally sustainable and profitable practices.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions pertaining to limitations of liability for damage to real or tangible personal property; and clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions limiting the recovery of costs related to the use of replacement contractors under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and prohibits certain provisions in Maryland state contracts, including limitations on liability for property damage, restrictions on recovery of costs related to replacement contractors, and other unfair contractual terms.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or relevant state contracting authority
stakeholders: State agencies, contractors, and entities involved in state contracts in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on certain contractual provisions may reduce legal and financial uncertainties for small businesses contracting with the state, potentially lowering their risk of failure.

Title: State Procurement Preferences - Blind Industries and Services of Maryland - Packaging and Repackaging
Synopsis: Requiring a State or State aided or controlled entity to require a prime contractor to procure certain janitorial products packaged or repackaged by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies and entities to include a requirement in maintenance contracts that the prime contractor procure janitorial products from Blind Industries and Services of Maryland if those products are made, remanufactured, packaged, repackaged, or assembled by them and are available.
responsible_party: Maryland State or State aided or controlled entities
stakeholders: Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, janitorial product suppliers, Maryland state agencies, and contractors involved in maintenance services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill promotes business for Blind Industries and Services of Maryland by requiring procurement of their products, which could help reduce their business failure risk.

Title: Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup for the purpose of studying issues related to the establishment and maintenance of a State cemetery inventory system; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup to study issues related to creating and maintaining a statewide cemetery inventory system, including definitions, practices, costs, and funding.
responsible_party: The Maryland Historical Trust and the Maryland Office of Cemetery Oversight, with support from other state and local agencies and organizations.
stakeholders: Genealogical and historical organizations, local governments, descendant communities, religious and local cemeteries, and the general public interested in cemetery preservation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on cemetery inventory systems and preservation, not directly on small businesses, so it has minimal potential to impact small business failure rates.

Title: Frederick County - Barbershop and Beauty Salon Beer and Wine License - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from 5 to 6.5 ounces of wine by the glass that a holder of a barbershop or beauty salon beer and wine license in Frederick County may provide to a certain customer for on-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill amends the laws in Frederick County to increase the amount of wine that can be served to customers at barbershops and beauty salons with special licenses from 5 ounces to 6.5 ounces per serving.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Customers of barbershops and beauty salons in Frederick County, license holders, and local businesses
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses by allowing them to serve more alcohol per customer, potentially increasing revenue and customer satisfaction.

Title: Crimes Relating to Animals - Restrictions on Keeping Roosters
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning January 1, 2027, a certain person from keeping a rooster movement-constrained through use of a certain enclosure or tether, subject to certain exceptions; establishing that a violation of the Act is a civil offense; and providing the Act may be enforced by any State or local law enforcement officers or local animal control authority for the jurisdiction where the violation occurs.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits keeping more than 5 roosters per acre or more than 25 roosters on a property in Maryland starting January 1, 2027, unless authorized. It aims to address issues related to cockfighting and the spread of avian flu by regulating rooster confinement and ownership.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Rooster owners, animal control agencies, local governments, and communities concerned with animal welfare and public health
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions could impact small poultry farms and breeders by limiting rooster numbers, but it primarily targets illegal cockfighting activities.

Title: Health Occupations - State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners and the practice of chiropractic in the State related to Board membership, licensure of chiropractors, the discipline of chiropractors, and the denial of licenses to applicants; authorizing the Board to inspect chiropractor offices under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises laws governing the Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners, including changes to Board membership, licensure, discipline, inspection authority, and examination requirements for chiropractors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors practicing in Maryland and individuals seeking chiropractic care in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for inspections, licensure, and discipline aim to ensure professional standards, which can help maintain a stable environment for small chiropractic practices, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Veterans' Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert the license to a Class C (veterans' organization) license; reducing from $400 to $300 the annual license fee for a Class C (veterans' organization) license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to provide application and administrative fee discounts to certain licensees and applicants; and authorizing a Class C (veterans' organization) licensee to operate on Sunday without a Sunday license.
