bill_summary: The bill authorizes a holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert it to a Class C (veterans' organization) license, adjusts the license fee, allows fee discounts for qualifying organizations, and permits these veterans' organizations to operate on Sundays without a separate Sunday license.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations and their members in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial and operational benefits to veterans' organizations, which may help reduce their risk of failure by lowering licensing costs and simplifying licensing procedures.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Automated Enforcement Programs - Privacy Protections
Synopsis: Requiring a custodian of recorded images produced by certain automated enforcement systems to deny inspection of the images, subject to certain exceptions; prohibiting certain State and local agencies from using a recorded image or associated data from an automated enforcement system subject to certain exceptions; and establishing certain requirements and authorizations for the removal and destruction of recorded images and associated data produced by an automated enforcement system.
bill_summary: The bill enhances privacy protections for automated enforcement systems in Maryland by restricting access to recorded images and data, requiring warrants or court orders for use, establishing destruction protocols, and prohibiting biometric technology like facial recognition.
responsible_party: Maryland State and local law enforcement agencies, and the Maryland Judiciary for procedures related to citations and violations.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, drivers, and the general public in Maryland, especially those subject to automated traffic enforcement.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on privacy and enforcement procedures, not on small business support or economic development, so it has minimal direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration to study reorganizing the Maryland Transit Administration; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2025; and requiring the Department of Transportation, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services, to submit to the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House draft legislation to effectuate the recommendations of the Workgroup.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Area Rail Commuter (MARC) Rail Authority to oversee certain MARC rail services and projects, and creates a workgroup to study the reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration and the Department of Transportation, including options for local Baltimore City transit services and governance.
responsible_party: The Maryland Transit Administration and the Maryland Department of Transportation, specifically the MARC Rail Authority.
stakeholders: Transit riders, residents of Baltimore City and surrounding areas, small transit-related businesses, and government agencies involved in transportation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the management and oversight of transit projects, which could lead to more reliable services and better support for small transit-related businesses, but it does not specify a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Purple Line - Free Ridership and Promotional Materials and Services
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to develop and implement a program providing for the first month after transit service begins on the Purple Line, free ridership on Purple Line transit vehicles to individuals residing within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track; and requiring the Administration to include, beginning on October 1, 2025, for 3 months after service on the Purple Lines begins promotional materials and services at no cost to small businesses located within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to offer free ridership on the Purple Line for residents within a quarter-mile of the track for the first three months of service. It also mandates free advertising space on transit vehicles and stations for small businesses within the same radius for three months after service begins.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Residents living near the Purple Line, small businesses within a quarter-mile of the Purple Line track, and transit riders.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides free advertising space to small businesses for three months, which could help increase their visibility and sales, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Baltimore County - Vehicle Laws - Private Roadways in Residential Communities
Synopsis: Prohibiting, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of certain provisions of the Maryland Vehicle Law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; authorizing, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a police officer to enforce the vehicle law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; and prohibiting a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of the Act on any roadway located in certain areas of Calvert County.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes law enforcement to enforce Maryland Vehicle Law on private roadways within specific residential communities in Baltimore County, including a temporary enforcement period in the Queen Anne Village community from October 1, 2025, to June 30, 2028.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Police Department
stakeholders: Residents and vehicle operators within the specified residential communities in Baltimore County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Peace Orders and Protective Orders – Military Protection Orders
Synopsis: Authorizing a judge to consider whether a military protection order has been issued against a respondent when determining whether to grant a temporary peace order or a temporary protective order; and requiring a law enforcement officer to notify a certain law enforcement agency that an individual may have violated a military protection order under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes judges to consider military protection orders when issuing peace or protective orders and requires law enforcement to notify agencies if a military protection order may have been violated. It also defines the procedures and penalties related to violations of these orders.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals protected by peace or protective orders, military service members, law enforcement agencies, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on protective orders and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to provide for the care, preservation, maintenance, and restoration of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in the State; authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $250,000 to the fund; and requiring an annual report by September 30 to the General Assembly on the donations to the Fund and promotional efforts undertaken by money from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to support the care, preservation, and restoration of such cemeteries in Maryland. It creates a voluntary income tax checkoff for contributions to the fund, authorizes appropriations, and requires annual reporting on the fund's administration.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Labor, specifically the Secretary of Labor, is responsible for administering the fund.
stakeholders: Communities and individuals interested in the preservation and maintenance of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's primary focus is on cemetery preservation and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Human Services - Federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program - Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the Family Investment Administration in the Department of Human Services to be the central coordinating and directing agency of the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program using certain funds and resources; and repealing the requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the Program.
bill_summary: The bill designates the Family Investment Administration in the Maryland Department of Human Services as the central agency for coordinating the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program, replacing the previous requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the program.
responsible_party: Family Investment Administration in the Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families in Maryland who benefit from the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on food assistance programs and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Commerce - Nonprofit Organizations Navigator - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Department of Commerce to provide technical assistance and work with nonprofits and units of State government to resolve complexities and delays in State grant-making processes, collect and share certain information, and represent nonprofit organizations' interests and concerns as a member of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council; and requiring the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the implementation of the navigator.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Maryland Department of Commerce to assist nonprofits with accessing and applying for state grants, and to represent their interests on the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland that seek state and federal grants
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve grant access and reduce procedural delays for nonprofits, which can help prevent failures due to lack of funding or administrative hurdles.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Investigations and Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Authorizing a local department of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement officers in an investigation relating to an alleged vulnerable adult; and altering certain provisions relating to the disclosure of certain information concerning human services to include adult protective services.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local departments of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement in investigations related to vulnerable adults, and modifies disclosure rules for information concerning adult protective services to improve investigation processes.
responsible_party: Local departments of social services and law enforcement agencies in Maryland.
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults receiving protective services and the agencies involved in their care and investigation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may improve the efficiency of investigations related to vulnerable adults, indirectly supporting community stability.

Title: Digital Advertising Gross Revenues Tax - Assessments - Appeals and Corrections
Synopsis: Establishing a certain appeal process for persons who are subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax and receive a notice of assessment from the Comptroller; authorizing the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee to issue an order to correct an erroneous assessment of the digital advertising gross revenues tax, subject to certain conditions; and applying the Act to assessments of the digital advertising gross revenues tax made after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an appeal process for individuals and entities subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland, allowing them to contest assessments and request corrections or refunds.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses and individuals subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear process for correcting erroneous assessments, which can help prevent small businesses from facing unjust penalties or financial difficulties due to incorrect tax assessments.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Maternal Health Self-Measured Blood Pressure Monitoring
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for certain eligible Program recipients; and requiring reimbursement of health care provider and other staff time used for patient training, transmission of blood pressure data, interpretation of blood pressure readings and reporting, remote patient monitoring, and the delivery of co-interventions, including educational materials or classes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to start providing coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for eligible recipients starting January 1, 2026. It also mandates the development of an education campaign about blood pressure monitoring and requires annual reporting on program outcomes and savings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Eligible Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients, including pregnant women, postpartum women, and individuals with chronic kidney disease, diabetes, heart disease, or cardiometabolic disease.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program's focus on providing validated blood pressure monitors and training may help improve health outcomes, but its direct impact on small business failure rates is limited.

Title: Food Establishments - Portable Chemical Toilets
Synopsis: Authorizing food establishments that are businesses that conduct agritourism, Class 4 limited wineries, or Class 8 farm breweries to comply with the requirement to provide a convenient lavatory by providing a portable chemical toilet that is supplied with approved hand drying devices, kept in a sanitary condition, is properly ventilated, and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain food establishments, specifically those involved in agritourism, limited wineries, and farm breweries, to meet the requirement of providing a convenient lavatory by using a portable chemical toilet that meets specific standards and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Food establishments involved in agritourism, wineries, and farm breweries, and their customers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a flexible alternative for small food establishments to comply with sanitation requirements, potentially reducing operational costs and barriers to compliance.

Title: Baltimore County - Political Party Central Committee - Elections
Synopsis: Altering from four to three the number of members elected from each councilmanic district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Republican Party Central Committee; and altering the number of members elected from each legislative district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Democratic Party Central Committee.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the number of members elected from each district to the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees, reducing the Republican members from four to three per district and adjusting the Democratic members' numbers and districts.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Elections and the respective political party central committees in Baltimore County.
stakeholders: Members of the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Parties, voters in Baltimore County, and local political organizations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Venue Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County a venue beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption during an event where food is served; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to certain nonprofit or for-profit retail businesses that meet certain criteria; and authorizing the issuance of a license to an establishment that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written consent.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Dorchester County that allows license holders to sell or serve alcohol during events where food is served, with specific size and capacity requirements, and includes provisions for proximity to places of worship or schools.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Event venues, nonprofit and for-profit businesses hosting events, and the community members attending these events in Dorchester County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing option that could help event venues and related businesses increase revenue and stability, potentially reducing the risk of business failure.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Renewal Notices - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants by electronic means, rather than by first-class mail, unless the licensee, permit holder, or registrant requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants primarily by electronic means (email), with an option for recipients to request traditional first-class mail. It updates the procedures for renewal notices for various pharmacy-related licenses and registrations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacy licensees, permit holders, registrants, and pharmacy interns in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining renewal notice processes and reducing mailing costs, the bill has the potential to lower administrative burdens and costs for small pharmacy businesses, thereby helping to reduce their failure rates.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Fees
Synopsis: Altering licensing fees for certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to charge an application or transfer fee under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies licensing fees for alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County, including increasing some fees, and authorizes the Board of License Commissioners to charge application and transfer fees.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses holding or applying for alcoholic beverage licenses in Dorchester County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill introduces additional fees for licensing and transfers, which could increase costs for small businesses, potentially impacting their failure rate.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Arts Beer and Wine License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County an arts beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to a nonprofit or for-profit retail business that engages in the display and sale of original artwork in an arts and entertainment district; authorizing the issuance the license within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written permission; and providing an annual fee of $250.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an arts beer and wine license in Dorchester County, allowing certain businesses that display and sell original artwork to sell beer and wine for on-premises consumption, with specific regulations and exceptions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Businesses involved in art display and sales within Dorchester County, including art centers, galleries, and museums, as well as the local community and patrons of arts and entertainment districts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a new licensing opportunity for art-related businesses, potentially reducing barriers to alcohol sales and increasing revenue, which may help prevent small business failures.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Authorizing certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor under certain circumstances, in addition to tastings of beer and wine; and limiting the quantity of liquor allowed per individual for tastings to 0.5 ounces from each offering and 1.5 ounces from all offerings of liquor in 1 day.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor, in addition to beer and wine, with specific quantity limits per individual. It also establishes licensing fees and procedures for these tastings.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol vendors and consumers in Dorchester County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear licensing process and allows small businesses to conduct tastings, which can promote sales and customer engagement, potentially reducing business failure.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C Licenses - Events
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of certain Class C licenses in Anne Arundel County to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain individuals for on-premises consumption during events held at the licensed premises; and requiring an outside group to obtain a per diem license from the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County if the outside group holds an event hosted by the holder of a certain Class C license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an event permit in Anne Arundel County that allows holders of Class C (veterans' organization) licenses to sell alcohol during events, including to non-members and guests, with specific licensing and fee provisions.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, event attendees, local residents, and small businesses hosting events in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small veterans' organizations and event venues by simplifying alcohol licensing for events, potentially reducing barriers to hosting events and increasing revenue.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Expanded Function Dental Assistants - Education and Reinstatement
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to approve a certain course of study for expanded function dental assistant certification; requiring that a course of study for initial dental assistant certification include at least 35 hours of in-person and online instruction; requiring the Board to reinstate a certain certification only under certain circumstances; requiring the Board to adopt regulations requiring continuing education, including clinical hands-on training, for expanded function dental assistants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the qualifications and training options for expanded function dental assistants in Maryland, including approval of online courses, and sets regulations for their continuing education and reinstatement of expired certifications.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental assistants, dental practices, and patients in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing clearer regulations and approved training programs, the bill aims to support dental practices and dental assistants, potentially reducing failures related to staffing and compliance.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Multiple Licensing Plans
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue not more than three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to a person under certain circumstances; and prohibiting a person from having a direct or indirect interest in more than a certain number of Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary’s County to issue up to three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to an individual or entity, with restrictions on ownership interests to prevent excessive concentration of licenses among a single person or entity.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary’s County
stakeholders: Businesses and individuals involved in the sale of alcoholic beverages in St. Mary’s County, including restaurant owners and license applicants.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on license ownership and issuance aim to prevent market saturation and promote fair competition, which could help small businesses succeed.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act – Reports of Attorney General – Frequency
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from every month to every 6 months, of the reports required to be submitted by the Attorney General to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Attorney General to report to the Maryland General Assembly every 6 months on the status of efforts to recover economic damages from the closure of the Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: State of Maryland, local businesses, and residents affected by the Port closure and bridge collapse
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but improving recovery efforts could indirectly benefit small businesses impacted by the port and bridge issues.

Title: Business Regulation - Enforcement for Miscellaneous State Business Licenses - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to consult with certain stakeholders to study and make recommendations on the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses; and requiring the Comptroller to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to study and make recommendations on the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses, including the use of citations and contact procedures for license enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Business owners and operators holding miscellaneous State business licenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve enforcement procedures which could reduce violations and associated penalties, potentially decreasing small business failures related to licensing issues.

Title: Terminology and Obsolete References – Maryland State Firefighters Association and Related Terms
Synopsis: Replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association with references to the Maryland State Firefighters Association; and replacing related terminology.
bill_summary: The bill updates terminology related to the Maryland State Firefighters Association, replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association, and makes related amendments across various Maryland statutes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Firefighters Association and relevant state agencies involved in public safety, health, education, and transportation.
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical technicians, law enforcement officers, correctional officers, volunteer fire and rescue squad members, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it supports emergency services personnel and related organizations, which can indirectly benefit local economies.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Transfers Between Systems - Workgroup
Synopsis: Requiring the State Retirement and Pension System to convene a workgroup to study transfers of member service between State and local retirement and pension systems; and requiring the Agency to submit a report of the Workgroup's findings and recommendations, including the need for any legislative initiatives, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Retirement Agency to convene a workgroup of stakeholders to study and recommend improvements to the process of transferring member service credits between State and local retirement systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of State and local retirement and pension systems, including employees and representatives from various county and city retirement plans, labor unions, and legislative staff.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on pension system transfers.

Title: Property Tax - Low-Income Housing Tax Credit - Valuation of Property
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation, within 30 days of closing and the execution and delivery of a certain regulatory agreement, that a commercial property that is developed under a certain provision of federal law has been awarded a low-income tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how commercial real estate that is developed under federal low-income housing tax credit provisions is valued for property tax purposes. It requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation when such properties are awarded tax credits, and mandates that the valuation of these properties considers an upward adjustment of net operating income to account for affordability restrictions.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Developers and owners of low-income housing projects, local governments, and residents benefiting from affordable housing programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's adjustments to property valuation for low-income housing developments could potentially lower property taxes for these projects, thereby reducing financial burdens and the risk of failure for small developers involved in affordable housing.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Compensation
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to pay an election judge compensation for completing a certain course of instruction only after the election judge actually serves an election day or early voting day; and authorizing a public school student in the State to earn hours toward the service-learning graduation requirement or receive election judge compensation for service as an election judge.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to pay election judges for completing training and serving on election days, with specific minimum compensation amounts. It also allows public school students to earn service-learning hours and receive election judge pay for serving as election judges.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local election boards
stakeholders: Election judges, public school students, and voters in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Public Libraries - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Raymono A. Russell Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain libraries, beginning January 1, 2026, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent area accessible to employees and library users, to provide maintenance for the automated external defibrillator, and to comply with the Public Access Automated External Defibrillator Program; granting certain immunities to libraries and individuals under certain circumstances; requiring by December 1, 2026, a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the use of defibrillators in libraries; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain libraries in Maryland to install and maintain automated external defibrillators (AEDs), ensure trained individuals are present when open, and register the AEDs with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems. It also grants immunities to libraries and individuals acting in good faith during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Library users and staff in Maryland libraries, including state, regional, and county libraries
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, as it focuses on libraries and emergency medical preparedness.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax Credit - Supermarkets
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the personal property tax imposed on personal property of a supermarket that completes certain construction and is located in a certain food desert retail incentive area; requiring the governing body to designate what constitutes a food desert retail incentive area for purposes of the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to grant property tax credits to supermarkets that complete certain construction projects and are located in designated food desert retail incentive areas, aiming to encourage supermarket development in food deserts.
responsible_party: The governing body of Anne Arundel County or a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County.
stakeholders: Supermarkets, residents of food desert areas in Anne Arundel County, and local government.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program could potentially reduce small business failure by providing financial incentives to supermarkets, encouraging new or renovated supermarkets in underserved areas.

Title: State Personnel - BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department - Collective Bargaining and Arbitration Processes
Synopsis: Altering the collective bargaining process between the State and uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department by requiring the parties to reach a collective bargaining agreement on or before September 30 of the year in which the collective bargaining agreement will expire; and establishing a process of binding arbitration in the event of an impasse.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the collective bargaining process between the State of Maryland and the uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department, including establishing deadlines for negotiations, procedures for resolving impasses through binding arbitration, and requirements for including employment terms in the State budget.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Personnel and Pensions
stakeholders: Uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department and the Maryland State government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on public sector labor negotiations and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Educational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing education to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The Educational Equality for Service Members Act establishes rules for interpreting terms related to the uniformed services, expands education law provisions to include all uniformed services (not just the armed forces), and creates programs to support military-connected students, veterans, and their families, including expedited educator certification, school enrollment support, and scholarships.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, and students connected to the military in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on education and support programs for military personnel and veterans, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Economic Development - Small Business Guaranty Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to authorize the provision of a guaranty under the Small Business Guaranty Fund in an irrevocable letter of credit, an official treasurer's check, funds on deposit in an escrow or other depository account, or any other legal instrument promising a financial institution restitution or reimbursement for its loan losses, within the limits of the guaranty.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to provide guarantees for up to 80% of certain long-term loans made to small businesses, with specific conditions on loan amount, purpose, and terms. The guarantees can be supported by the full faith and credit of Maryland or through other legal financial instruments.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland seeking long-term loans for purposes such as working capital, equipment, real estate, or refinancing.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to reduce small business failures by making it easier for small businesses to access guaranteed loans, which can improve their financial stability and growth prospects.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Advanced Practice Nursing Licensure and Specialty Certification - Reciprocity Discussions (Maryland Border States Advanced Practice Nursing Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to pursue reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and specialty certification; and requiring the Board, by November 1, 2025, and each November 1 for the following 4 years, to submit a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the status of the discussions, agreements reached, challenges in the negotiations, and any legislative recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with nursing licensing boards in Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to establish reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and certification, aiming to improve access, portability, and telehealth services.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses, patients, and healthcare providers in Maryland and neighboring jurisdictions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is focused on licensing and certification reciprocity and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Earned Income Tax Credit - Notice of Eligibility - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the method by which the Comptroller must provide notice of the maximum income eligibility for the earned income tax credit for the calendar year to all employers in the State to include an electronic means of notification.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to provide a notice to all employers about the earned income tax credit, and mandates employers to inform eligible employees about their potential eligibility for federal and state earned income tax credits.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office and Employers in Maryland
stakeholders: Employees who may be eligible for the earned income tax credit in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on reducing small business failure rates, as it primarily involves notification requirements related to tax credits.

Title: Local Earned Income Tax Credit - Calculation - County Income Tax Rate
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county's applicable income tax rate is the tax rate used to calculate the local earned income tax credit that certain individuals may claim against the county income tax; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation of the local earned income tax credit in Maryland, specifically how the county income tax rate is used in the calculation, and allows counties to provide a refundable earned income tax credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Individuals and married couples filing income tax returns in Maryland, and counties implementing the earned income tax credit
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects individual taxpayers and counties, and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Law - Destroying Funerary Objects and Cemetery Elements - Statute of Limitations and Prohibition
Synopsis: Extending from 1 year to 3 years the statute of limitations for prosecutions relating to destroying funerary objects and other elements of a cemetery to begin at the time local authorities knew or reasonably should have known of the violation; and prohibiting a person from willfully destroying, damaging, defacing, or removing any part of the grounds of a cemetery.
bill_summary: The bill increases the statute of limitations for prosecuting crimes related to destroying funerary objects and cemetery elements from 1 year to 3 years after the local authorities knew or should have known of the violation. It also prohibits willful destruction, damage, defacement, or removal of cemetery grounds, including landscaping, and sets penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies responsible for cemetery oversight and criminal prosecution.
stakeholders: Cemetery owners, local authorities, descendants of deceased individuals, and the general public concerned with cemetery preservation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets criminal acts against cemeteries and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Comptroller - Recording and Monitoring Telephone Calls - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying which telephone calls the Comptroller of the State may record and monitor for training, quality control, and employee safety purposes; and providing that the Comptroller may monitor and record calls to the Comptroller's call centers only.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the circumstances under which the Maryland Comptroller's office can record and monitor telephone calls, specifically limiting recordings to calls made to the Comptroller's call centers for training, quality control, and safety, and establishing rules for notice, retention, and use of recordings.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Maryland taxpayers and employees of the Comptroller's Office
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by clarifying call monitoring practices, it may improve customer service and operational efficiency.

Title: State Lottery - Internet Sales of Subscription Plans - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to allow the establishment of a system or program that allows an individual to purchase a State lottery subscription plan through an electronic device that connects to the Internet, such as a personal computer or mobile device; and requiring the Agency to report by December 1, 2026, to certain committees of the General Assembly on State lottery subscription sales.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to establish a system allowing individuals to purchase lottery subscription plans online, including through internet-connected devices, and requires the agency to report on subscription sales and renewals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Individuals interested in purchasing Maryland lottery subscriptions, licensed lottery agents, and the Maryland state government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failure by expanding sales channels for lottery subscriptions, but the impact is indirect and limited to the lottery sales environment.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Sales Between Cannabis Businesses and Cannabis Nurseries - Exemption
Synopsis: Expanding the exemption from the sales and use tax for certain cannabis sales to include sales between certain licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries.
bill_summary: The bill expands the sales and use tax exemption to include sales of cannabis between licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue (or equivalent state tax agency)
stakeholders: Cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce financial burdens on cannabis nurseries and businesses by exempting certain sales from taxes, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Highways - Sidewalks and Bicycle Pathways - Construction and Reconstruction
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways to sidewalks and bicycle pathways that are, or are adjacent to highways that are, subject to a complete streets policy or another similar Vision Zero program; requiring a local government to request certain funding from the Department of Transportation; and authorizing certain State funding for the construction or reconstruction of sidewalks or bicycle pathways.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for constructing and reconstructing sidewalks and bicycle pathways, especially those adjacent to highways with complete streets policies or Vision Zero programs. It also details funding sharing arrangements between the state and local governments and mandates guidelines for implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Local governments, pedestrians, cyclists, and residents in urban areas of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on infrastructure improvements is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns transportation infrastructure and safety.

Title: Gaming - Slot Machines - Skills-Based Amusement Devices
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "slot machine" to provide that certain skills-based amusement devices excluded from the definition may award merchandise, tickets, tokens, or other objects that do not exceed a certain minimal value per play and may be accumulated and exchanged for noncash merchandise or prizes of value that is similar to the cumulated value of the objects exchanged, and does not exceed a minimal wholesale value of $599.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to clarify that certain skills-based amusement devices that award noncash prizes or merchandise of minimal value, which can be accumulated and exchanged for prizes not exceeding a certain value, are excluded from the definition of 'slot machine'.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Operators of skills-based amusement devices, players, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially support small businesses that operate skills-based amusement devices by clarifying legal definitions and allowing certain types of prizes, which may reduce legal risks and increase business opportunities.

Title: Income Tax - Income Tax Reconciliation Program - Established (Maryland Fair Taxation for Justice-Involved Individuals Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in the State to allow certain justice-involved individuals to establish installment payment plans and receive a waiver of any interest and penalties that accrue for unpaid income tax due for a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2024, but before January 1, 2030; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Program; requiring the Comptroller, in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, to develop an awareness campaign about the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in Maryland, allowing justice-involved individuals to set up payment plans and receive waivers of interest and penalties on unpaid income taxes for certain taxable years, especially while incarcerated.
responsible_party: The Maryland Comptroller's Office, in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
stakeholders: Justice-involved individuals who are incarcerated or recently released, and the Maryland state tax system.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is focused on individual taxpayers who are justice-involved, not small businesses, so its direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Higher Education - Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Expanding the eligibility for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include individuals who received a certain degree from an accredited veterinary school and provided veterinary services in the State for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary services at certain animal shelters for 3 years and to include individuals who provided veterinary technician services for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary technician services at certain animal shelters over a 3-year period.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Maryland Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include veterinary practitioners and veterinary technicians who have provided services for a certain period or volunteered at animal shelters, as well as other health professionals and educators.
responsible_party: The Office of Student Financial Assistance in the Maryland Department of Higher Education.
stakeholders: Veterinary practitioners, veterinary technicians, teachers, mental health professionals, nurses, and other health and education professionals in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on loan repayment assistance for veterinary practitioners and technicians, especially those volunteering at shelters, is likely to support the veterinary sector, potentially reducing small business failure in veterinary services.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Extension of Report Deadline and Task Force
Synopsis: Extending the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to be October 31, 2026; and extending the termination date for the Task Force to be June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to submit its report from December 31, 2025, to October 31, 2026. It also extends the task force's operational period until June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: The Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services
stakeholders: Returning citizens, formerly incarcerated individuals, and the community involved in reentry services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Temporary To-Go Event Permit and Class C Per Diem Municipal To-Go Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary to-go event permit in Wicomico County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Wicomico County to issue a temporary to-go event permit to a holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license; establishing a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in the county; authorizing the Board to issue a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license to a municipality in the county; requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary to-go event permit and a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in Wicomico County, allowing licensed establishments and municipalities to sell alcoholic beverages for carry-out during special events.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Wicomico County
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol establishments, municipalities, and event attendees in Wicomico County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides new licensing options and permits that could help small alcohol businesses increase sales and adapt to event needs, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Board - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select a designee to serve on the Juvenile Services Education Board; altering the terms of membership for the Board; and altering certain requirements for meetings of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the composition, appointment process, and meeting requirements of the Juvenile Services Education Board in Maryland, including allowing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select designees and altering terms and meeting frequency.
responsible_party: The Department of Human Services, specifically the Juvenile Services Education Board, and the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools.
stakeholders: Juvenile students in residential facilities, educators working with juveniles, and agencies involved in juvenile education and services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Clarifying that the State Board of Nursing may deny a license or grant a license, including a license subject to a reprimand, probation, or suspension, if an applicant for a license to practice direct-entry midwifery or a licensed direct-entry midwife violates a ground for discipline.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the disciplinary actions that the Maryland State Board of Nursing can take against applicants and licensed direct-entry midwives who violate certain grounds for discipline, including misconduct, incompetence, or violations of regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Licensed direct-entry midwives and applicants in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on disciplinary procedures for midwives does not directly impact small business failure rates, but it ensures professional standards and accountability within the midwifery profession.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Calcium Score Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage in accordance with the most recent guidelines issued by the American College of Cardiology that expand the scope of preventive care services for the benefit of consumers; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover calcium score testing for individuals with specific risk factors, starting from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and health insurance carriers, including managed care organizations.
stakeholders: Individuals with risk factors for heart disease, such as diabetes, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, or a family history of coronary artery disease.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are focused on health coverage and do not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: School Health and Wellness Personnel Assessment and Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to conduct an assessment of school health and wellness personnel each year; altering the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers; and requiring the Department and the State Department of Education to annually report to the General Assembly on the findings of the assessment beginning December 1, 2027, and publish the report on the website of each agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an annual assessment of school health and wellness personnel, including staffing ratios, vacancies, and recruitment strategies. It also modifies the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School–Based Health Centers to include a school nurse.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: School students, school health and wellness personnel, local school systems, local health departments, and stakeholders involved in school health services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates, but by improving school health services, it may indirectly support local health providers and organizations involved in school-based health centers.

Title: Criminal Law - Dismembering or Burying Human Remains With Intent to Conceal a Crime
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person, with the intent to conceal a crime, from knowingly and willfully dismembering, destroying, removing, burying, disposing of, or obliterating by any means any portion of human remains; prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting another in committing a violation of the Act; and establishing that a violation of the Act is a felony with a penalty of imprisonment not exceeding 5 years.
bill_summary: This bill makes it a felony to conceal a death by failing to notify authorities, dismembering or destroying human remains, or disposing of a dead body with the intent to conceal a crime, and prohibits aiding or abetting such acts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in criminal investigations, law enforcement, and the general public concerned with crime concealment
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets criminal acts related to concealment of death and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Rape Kit Testing - Tracking Program and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to March 31,2026, the date by which a certain report under a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program is required to be submitted; altering the purpose and use of the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund; expanding the duties of the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy relating to the Fund; and prohibiting the use of the Fund for a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund to provide funding for testing untested sexual assault evidence collection kits, and updates reporting requirements for the tracking of these kits. It also clarifies the purpose of the fund and the responsibilities of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy.
responsible_party: The Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories, sexual assault victims, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on funding for testing kits and related programs is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library - Funding and Budget Submission
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $450,000 to the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library; and requiring the Deaf Culture Digital Library to submit its annual operating budget to the State Library Agency on or before June 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill mandates funding and organizational development for the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library, including annual budget allocations, development of resources, partnerships, and community engagement to support deaf and hard of hearing individuals.
responsible_party: The State Library Agency of Maryland
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, library staff, and organizations serving the deaf community in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; its focus is on library services and deaf community resources.

Title: Child Support - Driver's License Suspension for Arrearages and Court Orders
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Child Support Administration may notify the Motor Vehicle Administration of an individual's child support arrearages for the purpose of suspending the individual's driver's license or privilege to drive; and requiring the court, after establishing a child support order, to send a copy of the guideline calculation and the order to the Child Support Administration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the circumstances under which the Maryland Child Support Administration can notify the Motor Vehicle Administration to suspend a person's driver's license due to child support arrearages. It also requires courts to send support calculation details to the Child Support Administration and clarifies procedures for license suspension and reinstatement.
responsible_party: Maryland Child Support Administration and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Parents with child support obligations and individuals with child support arrearages in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on child support enforcement and license suspension procedures, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing certain deluxe complex restaurant and resort complex beer and wine and beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Garrett County; requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Garrett County to hold a hearing for the issuance of certain festival licenses and altering certain notice requirements for the hearing; requiring certain festival license applicants to apply to the Board in a certain manner; clarifying the entities to which the Board may issue certain multiple day and multiple event licenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options and regulations for alcoholic beverages in Garrett County, including complex restaurant, resort, and festival licenses for beer, wine, and liquor, with specific provisions for large properties, festivals, and nonprofit organizations.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Garrett County
stakeholders: Businesses involved in alcohol sales, festival organizers, and consumers in Garrett County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clearer licensing options and support for large complex businesses and festivals, which could help reduce small business failures by streamlining licensing and expanding opportunities.

Title: Tax Relief and State Personnel Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing personnel and taxation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes various programs and legal definitions to support veterans, service members, and their families, including tax relief, property tax exemptions, and employment protections, and expands interpretation rules for uniformed services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families and local government agencies.
stakeholders: Veterans, active service members, reserve members, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides tax exemptions and relief programs that could help small businesses owned by veterans and service members, potentially reducing their failure rate.

Title: Local Government - Development Impact Fees, Surcharges, and Excise Taxes - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring county governments to make a certain report by July 1 each year to the Department of Planning on the amount, use, and location of the use of county development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes; and requiring county governments to make certain reports to the Department of Planning identifying certain local laws.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland county governments to annually report to the Department of Planning on the collection and use of development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes, including details on amounts collected, locations, and how funds are spent.
responsible_party: Department of Planning and county governments in Maryland
stakeholders: County governments, developers, and residents in Maryland affected by development impact fees and taxes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve transparency and accountability in the use of development fees, which could help small businesses by ensuring funds are used effectively for community development, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: General Provisions - Veterans Benefits - Honorable Discharge
Synopsis: Defining "honorable discharge" with respect to any State program of benefits, rights, or privileges applicable to a veteran to include certain discharges.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'honorable discharge' for veterans in Maryland to include discharges that are less than honorable due to reasons related to sexual orientation, gender identity, post-traumatic stress disorder, traumatic brain injury, or sexual trauma, provided certain conditions are met.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, especially those discharged under less than honorable conditions due to issues related to sexual orientation, gender identity, or trauma
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: County Boards of Education - Special Education Service Delivery Models - Publication Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to publish on its website a certain list of special education service delivery models provided for parentally-placed private school students; and defining "parentally-placed private school student" as a child with a disability enrolled by the parent or guardian of the child in a private elementary or secondary school or facility, including a religious school or facility.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland county boards of education to publish on their websites a list of all special education service delivery models and services provided to parentally-placed private school students, and to clearly state that placement decisions are made by an individualized education program team in consultation with parents, in accordance with federal law.
responsible_party: Maryland county boards of education
stakeholders: Parents and students involved in special education, private schools, and local education agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program - Eligible Institutions
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility under the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include certain students attending the Meritus School of Osteopathic Medicine.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include students attending certain institutions in Maryland, providing financial aid for students in fields like medicine, law, dentistry, pharmacy, nursing, social work, and veterinary medicine.
responsible_party: The Maryland Higher Education Commission (MHEC) is responsible for establishing and administering the scholarship program.
stakeholders: Graduate and professional students in Maryland attending eligible institutions in fields such as medicine, law, dentistry, pharmacy, nursing, social work, and veterinary medicine.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily supports students in professional fields and does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Licenses, Identification Cards, and Moped Operator's Permits - Notation of Nonapparent Disability (Eric's ID Law)
Synopsis: Requiring that an original and renewal application for a license, an identification card, or a moped operator's permit allow an applicant to choose to indicate on the document the applicant's nonapparent disability; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to ensure that a certain license, identification card, or moped operator's permit include a notation of a nonapparent disability; requiring the immediate implementation of training for law enforcement concerning interactions with persons with nonapparent disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to allow applicants for licenses, ID cards, or moped permits to indicate if they have a nonapparent disability, such as developmental or intellectual disabilities. It mandates that the Administration include a notation of this disability on the document if indicated, and establishes procedures for removal and public outreach.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with nonapparent disabilities applying for licenses, ID cards, or moped permits in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it could improve accessibility and reduce barriers for individuals with disabilities, potentially supporting their participation in the economy.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Licenses - Golf Simulator Facilities
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a holder of a Class B license; and clarifying that the Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license counts toward the maximum number of nine Class B alcoholic beverages licenses a holder may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a new type of alcoholic beverage license, called a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license, to holders of existing Class B licenses. It clarifies that this new license counts toward the total number of licenses a holder can have.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Golf simulator facility operators and alcohol license holders in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses operating golf simulator facilities by allowing them to obtain a specialized license, potentially increasing their operational capacity and revenue.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing certain incorrect references to the Comptroller of Maryland in certain provisions of law requiring the holder of a performing arts nonprofit organization license in Harford County to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; repealing the authority of the Comptroller to suspend the license of a license holder without a hearing under certain circumstances; and authorizing, rather than requiring, the Board to summon a license holder for a hearing and impose a fine under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations for performing arts nonprofit organization alcohol licenses in Harford County, including record-keeping requirements and procedures for license suspension and hearings.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners (or equivalent local authority)
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations in Harford County that hold alcohol licenses
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill clarifies and potentially streamlines the licensing and record-keeping process, which could reduce administrative burdens and improve compliance, thereby lowering the risk of license suspension or revocation for small nonprofits.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from every 4,000 to every 4,750 individuals in the county.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota for the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverage licenses that the Harford County Board of License Commissioners can issue, based on the county's population, and sets a limit on the number of licenses per class.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Harford County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily sets licensing limits rather than providing direct financial support or business development programs.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program Eligibility - Alterations
Synopsis: Including the Department of Housing and Community Development in the definition of "public housing agency" for the purposes of the Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program; authorizing a public housing agency to administer the Program in accordance with a local administrative plan; authorizing the Department to project-base up to 100% of its authorized voucher units; altering the manner in which the Department and each public housing agency shall prioritize vouchers and housing assistance payments for certain families; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program, including expanding the Department of Housing and Community Development's role, allowing project-based vouchers, and adjusting eligibility and prioritization criteria for assistance.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income households, families with children, foster children, military veterans, homeless individuals, disabled individuals, and elderly individuals in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for funding and program administration are aimed at supporting affordable housing, which can indirectly help small businesses by stabilizing communities, but it does not directly target small business failure.

Title: Natural Resources - Public Lands - Acquisition, Staffing, Operations, and Funding
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law regarding the acquisition of real property by the Department of Natural Resources; establishing a Land and Property Management Program in the Department to process certain  transactions; authorizing the Department and the Natural Resources Police to establish affiliated foundations; authorizing the Governor to transfer certain Program Open Space funds to the Department under certain circumstances; altering and repealing certain provisions of law regarding the use of Program Open Space local funding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to the management and funding of public lands in Maryland, including establishing a Land and Property Management Program, creating affiliated foundations to support land management and recreation, and modifying procedures for land acquisition, disposal, and funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public land users, conservation groups, local governments, and residents of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the establishment of foundations and land management programs may indirectly support local economic activities.

Title: Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission - Established
