Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of potential and actual federal changes to specified health care programs and to provide recommendations for State and local action to protect the access of residents of the State to affordable health coverage; and requiring the Commission to submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any legislative proposals, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of potential and actual federal changes to health care programs like the ACA, Medicaid, and Medicare, and to recommend actions to protect residents' access to affordable health coverage.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Insurance Administration, and the Department of Legislative Services jointly.
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those who are uninsured, low-income, or communities of color, as well as health care providers and insurers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to protect health coverage access, which can help stabilize the health insurance market and reduce financial strain on small businesses that provide health benefits to employees.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain advertising and public hearing requirements for proposed regulations implementing the State Boat Act; increasing certain funding thresholds for certain projects financed by the Waterway Improvement Fund; and altering the fees for manufacturer and dealer licenses, certificates of number, Maryland use stickers, and the issuance of certificates of title, transfer of title, or duplicate or corrected certificates of title.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's State Boat Act by redefining 'personal watercraft' and 'personal flotation device', repealing certain vessel classifications and advertising requirements, increasing funding thresholds for waterway projects, adjusting fees for vessel licensing and titling, and establishing new regulations for vessel safety and operation, including requirements for child safety devices and speed zone adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel owners, boaters, maritime businesses, and recreational water users in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on licensing, fees, and project funding are designed to streamline vessel-related regulations and support waterway projects, which could help small maritime businesses and boat operators by reducing regulatory burdens and increasing project funding opportunities.

Title: Natural Resources - Repeal of Somers Cove Marina Commission and Improvement Fund and Alteration of Operations
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law relating to the Somers Cove Marina Commission, the Somers Cove Marina Improvement Fund, and the operation of Somers Cove Marina; requiring the Secretary to develop a master plan for the operation and improvement of services at Somers Cove Marina by October 1, 2027; requiring all revenue received by the Department from activities associated with Somers Cove Marina be deposited in the Natural Resources Property Maintenance Fund; establishing the Somers Cove Marina Advisory Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Somers Cove Marina Commission and the associated Improvement Fund, transfers management responsibilities to the Department of Natural Resources, and establishes new advisory commissions and funds to oversee and support the marina's operations and maintenance.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Marina users, local businesses, tourism industry, boating community, and residents of Somerset County and Crisfield
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline management and improve operational oversight of the marina, which could help small businesses involved in marina services and related tourism activities.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Report on Oversight of Substance Use Disorder Treatment Programs and Recovery Residences
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports on or before December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026, to the Senate Finance Committee, the Senate Budget and Taxation Committee, the House Health and Government Operations Committee, and the House Appropriations Committee on the oversight of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports in 2025 and 2026 on the oversight and regulation of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences, including revisions to regulations and improvements to oversight procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals receiving substance use disorder treatment and residing in recovery residences in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve oversight and regulation, which could lead to better quality and safety in treatment programs and residences, potentially reducing failures and adverse events.

Title: Health Occupations - Authorization to Practice for Former Federal Employees and Dental Applicants Licensed or Certified in Another State
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to issue a license or certification to certain applicants licensed or certified by another state within 15 business days after receiving the completed application; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for a temporary or permanent authorization to practice a health occupation in the State for certain individuals who left employment with a federal agency after January 20, 2025; requiring the Department to submit the plan by October 1, 2025 to certain committees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill streamlines licensing for dental professionals licensed in other states, establishes certification procedures for dental radiation technologists, and requires the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for authorizing health occupation practice for individuals who left federal employment after January 20, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental professionals, dental hygienists, dental radiation technologists, and individuals who left federal employment after January 20, 2025
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill may reduce barriers for licensed dental professionals and health workers from other states, potentially decreasing small business failure related to licensing delays or barriers.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the allowable uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund to provide funds for the operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations, enforcement actions, and other activities conducted by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General that are related to the recovery of funds from opioid-related judgments or settlements; and requiring, beginning October 1, 2025, the Office of the Attorney General to report annually to the General Assembly on the status of activity of the Opioids Enforcement Unit.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the uses of the Maryland Opioid Restitution Fund to include funding for investigations, enforcement, and activities by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General related to recovering funds from opioid-related judgments and settlements.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General, Opioids Enforcement Unit
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by opioid use and overdose, including those receiving substance use disorder treatment and harm reduction services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it allocates funds for opioid-related enforcement and treatment programs which may indirectly impact community stability.

Title: Public Health - Use of Opioid Restitution Fund and Training Under the Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Altering the training that the Maryland Department of Health is authorized to provide under the Overdose Response Program to include emphasis on the restoration of breathing, avoiding withdrawal, and compassionate postoverdose support and care; clarifying that the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund is subject to certain restrictions; and altering the authorized uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund so as to include the addressing of racial disparities in access to prevention, harm reduction, treatment, and recovery support services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund and the training provided under the Overdose Response Program by the Maryland Department of Health, clarifies restrictions on the fund, and expands authorized uses to include addressing disparities and supporting community recovery organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose, substance use disorder treatment providers, community recovery organizations, and populations affected by disparities in access to prevention and treatment services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it supports public health initiatives that may indirectly benefit community stability and economic health.

Title: Wildlife - Protections and Highway Crossings
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Connectivity Coalition to foster collaboration among State and federal agencies, nongovernmental organizations, and other stakeholders for the purpose of protecting endangered wildlife from habitat fragmentation; requiring the State Highway Administration to have final decision-making authority regarding decisions related to placement, funding, or design of wildlife crossings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Connectivity Coalition to promote wildlife habitat connectivity and reduce vehicle-wildlife collisions through wildlife crossings. It creates the Wildlife Connectivity Fund to finance these projects, mandates the inclusion of wildlife crossing information in transportation plans, and requires the development of a website for donations and public education.
responsible_party: The Department of Natural Resources and the Maryland State Highway Administration.
stakeholders: Wildlife, motorists, local governments, and environmental organizations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on wildlife conservation and transportation infrastructure, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Department of Information Technology - Major Information Technology Development Projects - Oversight
Synopsis: Providing that a unit of State government may not purchase, lease, contract for, or rent an information technology service or product unless consistent with the master plan, as determined by the Secretary of Information Technology; providing that the Secretary is responsible for overseeing the implementation of major information technology projects in the State; establishing the Maryland Office of Digital Experience in the Department to provide oversight, leadership, and strategic modernization for major technology projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Office of Digital Experience to oversee, modernize, and improve major information technology projects within the Maryland state government. It creates new standards, reporting requirements, and oversight mechanisms for IT projects, including a public dashboard and collaboration with units of government to enhance digital services.
responsible_party: The Maryland Office of Digital Experience within the Department of Information Technology.
stakeholders: State government agencies, residents of Maryland, and vendors involved in state IT projects.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill encourages the participation of small and minority business vendors in state IT projects through regulations and project application processes, aiming to reduce barriers and improve success rates.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Reckless, Negligent, and Aggressive Driving (Sergeant Patrick Kepp Act)
Synopsis: Altering the penalties and points assessments related to the offenses of reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving; and adding certain motor vehicle offenses as elements that may contribute to charges for reckless or aggressive driving.
bill_summary: The bill updates penalties and points for reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving offenses in Maryland, including adding new offenses as elements that can contribute to charges of reckless or aggressive driving.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA) and law enforcement agencies responsible for enforcement and adjudication of motor vehicle laws.
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers and the general public in Maryland, especially those affected by reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving behaviors.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on traffic laws and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analysts - Licensure Applications
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a license to practice behavior analysis to qualified applicants within 30 days of receiving the completed application; requiring the State Board to issue a license within 50 days to an applicant who submitted an incomplete application but has presented additional information; and requiring the State Board to provide a certain e-mail notification regarding the status of an application for a license to practice behavior analysis.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue licenses for behavior analysts within specified timeframes, improve communication with applicants through email notifications about application status, and consider criminal history information appropriately.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Applicants for behavior analyst licensure in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts licensing procedures and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Transfers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to approve the transfer of a Class B or Class D license existing on a certain date that is located in an eligible transferor district to another election district under certain circumstances; and limiting the number of license transfers that the Board may approve from an eligible transferor district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to approve the transfer of certain Class B or D alcohol licenses between election districts under specific conditions, limits the number of such transfers, and establishes procedures for assessing the economic impact of transfers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners and the Maryland Department of Economic and Workforce Development
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local communities in Baltimore County, and residents affected by alcohol licensing changes
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to facilitate license transfers which could help small alcohol businesses adapt or relocate, potentially reducing business failure due to licensing restrictions.

Title: Washington County - Public Safety - Buildings Used for Agritourism
Synopsis: Adding Washington County to the list of counties that exempt agricultural buildings used for agritourism from certain building performance standards and where an existing agricultural building used for agritourism is not considered a change of occupancy that requires a building permit under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill adds Washington County to the list of Maryland counties where agricultural buildings used for agritourism are exempt from certain building standards and permits, under specific conditions, to promote agritourism activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety, specifically the Department responsible for building codes and regulations.
stakeholders: Farmers and agritourism operators in Washington County and other counties with similar exemptions, as well as visitors to agritourism sites.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces regulatory burdens on agritourism businesses by exempting certain buildings from strict building standards and permit requirements, which can lower costs and barriers to operation.

Title: Washington County - Property Tax Credit - Economic Development Projects
Synopsis: Altering eligibility requirements for a certain property tax credit for certain business entities that invest a certain amount in certain real property in Washington County and create a certain number of new and permanent full-time jobs in the county; and altering the amount and duration of the property tax credit.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the property tax credit program in Washington County to incentivize business investments and job creation by altering eligibility requirements, increasing the investment and employment thresholds, and extending the duration and percentage of tax credits for qualifying businesses.
responsible_party: Washington County governing body (local government)
stakeholders: Business entities investing in real property and creating jobs in Washington County, Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to support business growth and stability through tax incentives, which could help reduce small business failures by encouraging investment and employment.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Hearing Notice
Synopsis: Altering certain notice requirements before the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may hold public hearings on proposed regulatory changes or license applications; and providing that the Board may publish a decision on certain license applications either in certain newspapers or on its website.
bill_summary: The bill modifies notice and publication requirements for public hearings and license application decisions related to alcoholic beverages in Harford County, allowing notices to be published either in newspapers or on the Board's website.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses applying for or holding alcoholic beverage licenses in Harford County, and residents of Harford County interested in licensing hearings and decisions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining notice requirements and providing alternative methods for publishing notices and decisions, the bill aims to reduce delays and uncertainties for small businesses applying for licenses, potentially lowering their risk of failure.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Recreational Common Areas - Sensitive Information as Condition for Access
Synopsis: Prohibiting a cooperative housing corporation, condominium association, or homeowners association from requiring certain sensitive information of certain individuals as a condition for access to a recreational common area; and defining "sensitive information" as an individual's Social Security card or Social Security number, Individual Taxpayer Identification Number, birth certificate, racial or ethnic origin, national origin, citizenship or immigration status,  religious or philosophical beliefs, or medical records.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations from requiring residents or their guests to provide sensitive personal information as a condition for accessing recreational common areas.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities.
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations, including their guests and children.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: While the bill primarily affects housing associations and residents, it may indirectly impact small businesses involved in property management or legal compliance, but the direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the amount the Governor is authorized to include in the annual budget for the Program from $500,000 to at least $1,000,000; and authorizing the Secretary to use up to 20% of Program funds to support research centers, including the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing, in the collection, analysis, and processing of Program outcome data for the purposes of assessing, maximizing, and improving the effectiveness and clinical utility of the cancer screening funded by the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a funding program for innovative cancer screening technologies specifically for professional and volunteer firefighters, funded through a fee on oil transfers in Maryland. It allocates funds to support research and development of cancer screening methods and supports academic medical research centers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Professional and volunteer firefighters, medical research centers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's primary focus is on firefighter health and cancer screening, not on small business support or failure reduction.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Making certain virtual currency subject to the abandoned property laws in the State; establishing certain provisions to determine certain information about certain apparent owners of abandoned property; altering and establishing certain provisions pertaining to the presumption of abandonment for certain types of property; establishing certain procedures to establish the death of a certain insured or certain annuitant; altering from $100 to $50 the value at which the Comptroller is required to publish a certain notice; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's laws on unclaimed property, including virtual currency, insurance policies, and other personal property, establishing procedures for determining ownership, handling abandoned property, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Owners of abandoned property, including individuals, businesses, and insurance policyholders in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for handling abandoned property and virtual currency aim to streamline processes and reduce uncertainties, potentially lowering small business failures related to unclaimed assets.

Title: Hospitals - Medical Debt Collection - Sale of Patient Debt
Synopsis: Authorizing a hospital, under certain circumstances, to sell the medical debt of patients if the debt is sold to a governmental unit or an entity that is under contract with the unit or a nonprofit organization for the purpose of canceling the debt; requiring that a hospital's financial policy require the hospital to dismiss actions pending against a patient for the collection of debt that was sold and prohibit the hospital from engaging in specified collection activities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes hospitals in Maryland to sell certain medical debt to government or nonprofit entities for the purpose of canceling the debt, under specific conditions. It also establishes requirements for hospital debt collection policies, including restrictions on selling debt, reporting adverse information, and collection activities, especially for patients eligible for free or reduced-cost care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients with hospital debt, especially those eligible for free or reduced-cost care, and hospitals in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's restrictions on debt collection and sale practices aim to reduce financial burdens on hospitals, potentially decreasing the likelihood of hospital closures due to debt-related issues, thereby indirectly supporting small healthcare providers.

Title: Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Procedures for Failure to Pay Rent, Breach of Lease, and Tenant Holding Over
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide certain notice to a tenant when a court has issued a warrant of restitution for a failure of a tenant to pay rent, a breach of lease, or a tenant holding over under certain circumstances; establishing certain procedures and requirements for the execution of a warrant for repossession; establishing that the Act does not restrict the authority of the State or a local jurisdiction to enact or enforce certain legislation; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new procedures and requirements for landlords when repossessing residential property due to failure to pay rent, breach of lease, or tenant holdovers. It emphasizes providing tenants with notice and opportunities to reclaim personal belongings and limits the immediate disposal of tenant property.
responsible_party: Maryland District Courts and local law enforcement (sheriffs and constables) for executing repossession warrants, and landlords for providing notices and handling tenant property.
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction and landlords involved in repossession proceedings.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily addresses residential landlord-tenant relations and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; and prohibiting certain private institutions of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program to support food security initiatives at Maryland higher education institutions, including designating campuses as hunger–free, providing grants, and reporting on progress.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at Maryland higher education institutions, especially those facing food insecurity
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on food security for students and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Correctional Services - Death of Incarcerated Individual - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Correction to notify certain elected representatives whenever an incarcerated individual dies in a Division of Correction facility; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to adopt certain regulations compliant with the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Correction to notify certain officials when an incarcerated individual dies in custody, including the cause of death, and mandates the department to adopt regulations to implement this requirement.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional facility staff, and local government officials
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Medical Practice Act and Maryland Physician Assistants Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing obsolete and redundant language in, clarifying language in, and making language consistent across certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Physicians and the regulation of physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; altering certain licensure requirements; altering the grounds for discipline for physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; authorizing the Board to impose a civil penalty for a certain report made in bad faith; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates and clarifies laws governing the regulation, licensure, and disciplinary procedures for physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals in Maryland, including establishing new committees, reporting requirements, and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians, physician assistants, allied health professionals, and the public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for licensing, reporting, and disciplinary procedures aim to create clearer regulations and oversight, which can help reduce small business failures related to healthcare practices.

Title: Study on Detecting Deadly Weapons in Public Middle and High Schools
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how best to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how best to rapidly report the detection of weapons to a law enforcement agency; requiring the Center to request any available assessment technologies evaluated under the Act; and requiring the Center to issue an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on the findings of the study, in a manner that does not jeopardize school safety, by December 1, 2026, to
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to study and evaluate methods for detecting deadly weapons in public middle and high schools, including the use of technology, security measures, and rapid reporting to law enforcement. It aims to improve school safety measures and reporting systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Students, staff, and families of public middle and high schools in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations - Implicit Bias and Structural Racism Training
Synopsis: Requiring applicants for renewal of certain licenses and certain certificates issued by certain health occupation boards to attest that the applicant completed an implicit bias and structural racism training program, rather than an implicit bias training program, approved by the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program; authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations allowing applicants renewing licenses to receive continuing education credits for completing certain training; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care professionals in Maryland to complete implicit bias and structural racism training for license renewal, and authorizes the adoption of regulations to include continuing education credits for such training.
responsible_party: Maryland health occupations boards and the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program
stakeholders: Health care professionals and patients in Maryland, especially those from diverse cultural and racial backgrounds
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve cultural competency and reduce disparities, which can contribute to better patient outcomes and potentially lower failure rates for health care practices.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to provide a certain waiver from certain requirements for a restaurant within a certain bounded area in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; expanding the class of license to which a certain requirement for a memorandum of understanding applies to include any alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City; providing an exception to a certain prohibition against the Board allowing a certain license transfer under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to provide waivers and modify licensing requirements for certain alcoholic beverage licenses, including expanding license transfer and renewal provisions, and establishing specific conditions for licenses near schools and places of worship.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees, residents and businesses in Baltimore City, community associations, and local institutions such as schools and places of worship.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions to extend license expiration dates, ease transfer restrictions, and allow waivers are designed to reduce administrative barriers and uncertainties, potentially lowering small business failure rates.

Title: Common Ownership Communities and Zoning Authorities - Operation of Family Child Care Homes - Limitations
Synopsis: Prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from prohibiting or restricting the establishment or operation of certain family child care homes; prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from limiting the number of children for which certain family child care homes provide family child care below the number authorized by the State Department of Education; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits restrictions in certain housing documents and local laws that limit the operation or number of children in family child care homes within common ownership communities, condominiums, and homeowners associations, ensuring these homes are recognized as permitted residential activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local zoning authorities
stakeholders: Family child care providers, families using family child care homes, residents of condominiums and homeowners associations, and small business owners operating family child care homes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill reduces legal and regulatory barriers for family child care providers, which can help prevent business failure by clarifying their rights and reducing restrictions.

Title: Appellate Court of Maryland - Sessions at Educational Institutions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Appellate Court of Maryland, in conjunction with the administrations of secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State, to hold sessions at certain secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Appellate Court of Maryland to hold sessions at secondary and postsecondary educational institutions across the state, in addition to its usual location in Annapolis, to facilitate access and engagement with the judicial process.
responsible_party: The Appellate Court of Maryland, in conjunction with educational institutions and the Chief Judge of the Court.
stakeholders: Legal professionals, students, educational institutions, and residents of Maryland who may attend or be affected by court sessions held at educational institutions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Courts - State Reporter - Publication of Cases
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the State Reporter secure copyright for the State of published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court of Maryland and the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that the Maryland State Reporter secure copyright for published reports of opinions from the Maryland Supreme Court and Appellate Court, simplifying the publication process of case reports.
responsible_party: The Supreme Court of Maryland, which supervises the State Reporter.
stakeholders: Legal professionals, courts, and the public who rely on published case reports from Maryland's courts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to legal case publication procedures.

Title: Judiciary Department - Commission on Judicial Disabilities - Temporary Appointment
Synopsis: Allowing the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a former member to temporarily fill a certain vacancy on the Commission; allowing the Governor, upon certain request of the chair, to appoint a temporary substitute member or extend the term of an existing member of the Commission; and requiring that any temporary substitute is subject to the same qualifications applicable to the member the substitute is replacing and if the member is a judge or an attorney, must be a member in good standing of the Maryland bar.
bill_summary: The bill proposes a constitutional amendment to allow the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a temporary member or extend a member’s term, especially in cases of recusals or vacancies, to ensure the commission’s effective functioning.
responsible_party: The Maryland Judicial Conference and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Judges, judicial officials, and the public involved in the Maryland judicial system
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Property Tax - Payment Plans - Notice to Taxpayers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to include certain information concerning a certain State installment payment program for property taxes on the Ombudsman's website; requiring the Ombudsman to contract with a vendor to operate an installment payment program for payment of taxes in which any homeowner may enroll; requiring a collector of taxes to include certain information concerning a certain State or local installment payment program for property taxes in a separate insert included with each property tax bill; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department and local tax collectors to provide clear information about property tax installment payment programs to taxpayers. It mandates including notices and instructions on bills, websites, and notices related to property tax sales, and establishes a program for homeowners to pay delinquent taxes in installments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local tax collectors
stakeholders: Homeowners and property taxpayers in Maryland, especially those with delinquent taxes or at risk of tax sale
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets homeowners and property owners, not small businesses, so its direct impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Somerset County - Property Tax - Emergency Services Tax
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to impose an emergency services tax on all property subject to the county property tax to pay costs of emergency services; and prohibiting the county commissioners from initially imposing or subsequently increasing an emergency services tax until after a public hearing is held.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to impose an annual emergency services property tax to fund fire, rescue, and emergency medical services. It requires a public hearing before any initial imposition or increase of the tax and mandates public notice of the hearing.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Property owners in Somerset County, emergency service providers, and residents relying on emergency services
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects property owners and local government, with minimal direct impact on small businesses, but it could influence local economic conditions indirectly.

Title: University System of Maryland - Academic Facilities Bonding Authority
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; authorizing the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; and providing that the bonds issued under the authority of the Act are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30 million to finance projects for academic facilities, including new construction and renewal of existing facilities, without creating debt for the State.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and staff of the University System of Maryland, and the academic community in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, as it focuses on university facilities funding.

Title: Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program - Employee Certification and Awareness Materials
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the certification of employment by public service employers under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program, including requirements regarding determinations of whether employees are full-time; and requiring the Student Loan Ombudsman in the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to develop and disseminate information to increase awareness of and participation in the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for public service employers in Maryland to certify employment for employees participating in the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. It also mandates the development and dissemination of informational materials to increase awareness and participation in the program.
responsible_party: The Student Loan Ombudsman in the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation, in coordination with public service employers.
stakeholders: Public service employees in Maryland, including those working for state and local government, public institutions of higher education, and other qualifying public service organizations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: While primarily focused on public service employment and loan forgiveness, the bill's impact on small business failure rates is indirect and likely minimal.

Title: Real Property – Filing Fee for Residential Mortgage Foreclosure – Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the filing fee required to accompany an order to docket or a complaint to foreclose a mortgage or deed of trust on residential property from $300 to $450.
bill_summary: The bill increases the filing fee for residential mortgage foreclosure cases from $300 to $450, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or the Office of Administrative Hearings (implied as the entity overseeing foreclosure filings)
stakeholders: Homeowners facing foreclosure, mortgage lenders, mortgage originators, and legal professionals involved in foreclosure proceedings
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses, as it pertains specifically to residential mortgage foreclosure filings.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Interactive Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard on Opioid Restitution Fund spending to share prescription opioid-related settlement information with the public; requiring the dashboard to include links to the State, county, or municipal websites that provide access to additional information on the use of opioid-related settlement funds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard that displays information on the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund, including payments, spending, and initiatives, to increase transparency and public access.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public, policymakers, and communities affected by opioid use and overdose in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but it promotes transparency in opioid settlement spending, which could indirectly support community stability.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program to expand opportunities for technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible institutions; establishing eligibility criteria for project proposals to receive funding under the Program; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 for the Program; and altering the purpose and contents of the Maryland Innovation Initiative Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Innovation Initiative University Institution Partnership Extension Program to support technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible Maryland higher education institutions, with funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: The Maryland Innovation Initiative, administered by the Maryland Department of Commerce.
stakeholders: Eligible public and private nonprofit higher education institutions in Maryland, industry partners, and the regional economy.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to foster entrepreneurship and industry collaboration, which could help new technology-based businesses succeed, thereby potentially reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Columbia Association - Lease Requirements and Governing Documents Ho. Co. 14-25
Synopsis: Requiring a written lease for certain residential or commercial real property in Howard County to include information on the annual charge assessed by the Columbia Association and a description of certain rights and privileges under certain circumstances; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with a copy of certain covenants and governing documents under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords in Howard County to include specific information about the Columbia Association's annual charges and rights in written leases for residential and commercial properties. It also mandates landlords to provide tenants with copies of relevant covenants and governing documents.
responsible_party: Howard County Department of Housing and Community Development or local housing authorities.
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords of residential and commercial properties in Howard County subject to Columbia Association covenants.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily involves lease documentation requirements rather than direct financial or operational support.

Title: Out-of-Home Placement Providers - Individuals Enrolled in Higher Education and Vocational Training Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual enrolled in an accredited institution of higher education or a residential vocational training program to return to an out-of-home placement provider with whom the individual was previously placed under certain circumstances; requiring an individual to make a request to a local department of social services at least 30 days before the scheduled break; requiring the local department to make a recommendation to the Department of Human Services not later than 21 days before the scheduled break; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for out-of-home placement providers, including setting maximum numbers of children they can care for, with exemptions for children enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs. It allows individuals in higher education or vocational training to return to previous out-of-home placements under certain conditions, with specific procedures and timelines for requests and approvals.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in out-of-home placements, especially those enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs, and their families.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health - Workgroup to Study Pharmacy Benefits Managers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration and the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, to convene a workgroup to study and review reimbursement for pharmacists; and requiring the workgroup to submit an interim report by December 31, 2025, and a final report on their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a workgroup to study pharmacy benefits managers, reimbursement levels, drug pricing transparency, and related issues in Maryland's Medicaid and insurance programs, with the goal of improving pharmacy reimbursement practices and drug pricing transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacy benefits managers, drug manufacturers, health insurance carriers, managed care organizations, and Medicaid recipients in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to analyze and potentially improve reimbursement and pricing practices, which could help reduce small business failures in the pharmacy sector by promoting transparency and fair reimbursement.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services - Report on Youth Service Bureaus
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to submit an annual report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1 detailing efforts by the Department to promote predelinquent programs, including youth service bureaus, efforts by the Department to collaborate with and provide technical assistance to local governments regarding the establishment of youth service bureaus, and an assessment of the programs and activities of the bureaus and any other efforts to prevent youth offenses.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Juvenile Services to submit annual reports on youth service bureaus, including their efforts, collaboration with local governments, program assessments, and youth offense prevention activities.
responsible_party: Department of Juvenile Services
stakeholders: Youth service bureaus, local governments, and youth at risk of offending
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Procurement - Employee Stock Ownership Plan Preference - Pilot
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority, Morgan State University, St. Mary's College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College to establish a certain preference program for certain procurements; authorizing the establishment of a certain evaluation factor for certain proposals by an entity that utilizes certain employee stock ownership plans; requiring contractors to provide certain information to a unit regarding the use of an employee stock ownership plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program in Maryland that provides procurement preferences for entities that utilize employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs). It authorizes certain Maryland state agencies and educational institutions to establish evaluation factors favoring ESOP-utilizing bidders and contractors, and requires contractors to provide verification of their ESOP status. The program aims to promote employee ownership and participation in state procurement processes.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies including the Maryland Stadium Authority, University System of Maryland, Morgan State University, St. Mary’s College of Maryland, Baltimore City Community College, and the legislative policy committees.
stakeholders: Small businesses and contractors utilizing employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs), as well as employees of those businesses, and the Maryland state agencies involved in procurement.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program incentivizes businesses with employee stock ownership plans to participate in state procurement, which could support their stability and growth, potentially reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Use of Artificial Intelligence
Synopsis: Requiring that certain carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents ensure that artificial intelligence, algorithm, or other software tools are used in a certain manner when used for conducting utilization review.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents in Maryland to ensure that artificial intelligence and other software tools used in utilization review are used properly, with specific guidelines to prevent unfair discrimination and ensure accuracy.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance and the Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, private review agents, and enrollees in Maryland health plans
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on proper use of AI in utilization review aims to improve decision accuracy, which could reduce errors and disputes, potentially lowering small business failure related to insurance claims and coverage issues.

Title: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Adding the Comptroller, or the Comptroller's designee, as a member to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board to include the Comptroller or their designee as a member.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and the Maryland State Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland and their employees who are affected by retirement savings programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By including the Comptroller as a member, the bill aims to improve the management and oversight of small business retirement programs, which could help reduce small business failures related to employee benefits.

Title: Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs - Repeal of Interdepartmental Advisory Committee and Establishment of the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
Synopsis: Repealing the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs within the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs; establishing the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and make recommendations on socioeconomic procurement in the State; requiring the Subcabinet to conduct certain meetings and report annually to the Governor on the Subcabinet's activities, progress, and recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and establishes the Governor’s Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and improve socioeconomic procurement programs in Maryland.
responsible_party: The Governor’s Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation, which includes various state department secretaries and officials.
stakeholders: Small, minority, women, and disabled persons involved in or affected by socioeconomic procurement programs in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve socioeconomic procurement programs, which could help small businesses, minority-owned, women-owned, and veteran-owned businesses succeed in state contracting opportunities.

Title: Carroll County - Prospective Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the prospective employees or volunteers of Carroll County for whom the Department of Human Resources of Carroll County may request a criminal history records check.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain restrictions on Carroll County's ability to request criminal history records checks for prospective employees or volunteers, expanding the scope of positions for which checks can be requested.
responsible_party: Carroll County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: Prospective employees and volunteers of Carroll County, and the residents who are served by county programs and services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by streamlining background checks, it could potentially facilitate hiring processes.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $36,900,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $36.9 million in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities, including the ability to issue refunding bonds and installment purchase obligations for land easements.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners and the County government of Carroll County
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, and users of public facilities and infrastructure in Carroll County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it primarily focuses on public infrastructure and facilities financing.

Title: Charles County - Alcoholic Beverages - Baseball Stadium License - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the areas in which beer, wine, and liquor may be sold and consumed under a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license in Charles County to exclude any parking areas; and altering the types of containers in which beer, wine, and liquor may be served.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the regulations for the Class B–Stadium (baseball stadium) alcohol license in Charles County, including changes to where alcohol can be sold and consumed, the types of containers used, and the hours of sale.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Baseball stadium patrons, local residents, and businesses in Charles County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could help small businesses operating stadium concessions by clarifying licensing and sale regulations, potentially reducing legal and operational uncertainties.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the scope of practice of licensed direct-entry midwives; providing that the practice of direct-entry midwifery is independent and not does not require oversight by another health care practitioner; repealing the requirement that licensed direct-entry midwives report certain information to the Direct-Entry Midwifery Advisory Committee; altering the disciplinary actions that may be taken against a licensed direct-entry midwife or an applicant for a license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the scope of practice for licensed direct-entry midwives in Maryland, making their practice independent without needing oversight from other healthcare practitioners, and updates reporting and disciplinary procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing and the Direct–Entry Midwifery Advisory Committee
stakeholders: Individuals receiving midwifery care, including pregnant women and newborns in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes to licensing and practice regulations for midwives could reduce barriers to entry and operation, potentially lowering small business failure rates in the midwifery sector.

Title: Election Law - Provisional Ballots - Nonpartisan Board of Education Contests
Synopsis: Providing that a voter is qualified to vote a provisional ballot if the provisional ballot was cast because the voter claimed a different political party affiliation from the political party affiliation on record for the voter and the voter made a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest; and requiring a local board of canvassers to count only the votes cast in a nonpartisan board of education contest for those provisional ballots.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland election law to specify that a provisional ballot cast by a voter who claims a different political party affiliation than on record, but who makes a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest, should be counted only for the nonpartisan contest.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters participating in elections, especially those involved in nonpartisan board of education contests and voters with changing political affiliations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it pertains to election procedures.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Pregnant and Parenting Students - Plan Requirements (Pregnant and Parenting Student Support Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a plan regarding pregnant and parenting students to include referral to on-campus or off-campus services to assist regarding the availability of or eligibility for certain government assistance programs and any other programs, scholarships, or subsidies that may be available for pregnant and parenting students; and requiring each public senior higher education institution to post the plan on the institution's website on or before August 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires public senior higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt and post a plan to support pregnant and parenting students, including providing information on government assistance programs, resources for adoption, accommodations, and healthcare referrals.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Pregnant and parenting students enrolled in Maryland's public senior higher education institutions
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Gaming - Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board; and transferring certain powers and duties concerning gaming activities in Charles County from the board to the County Attorney for Charles County.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board and transfers its powers and duties concerning gaming activities in Charles County to the County Attorney, streamlining the regulation and oversight of gaming permits in the county.
responsible_party: Charles County Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Fundraising organizations, gaming permit applicants, residents of Charles County, and local government officials involved in gaming regulation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill simplifies the gaming permit process and consolidates regulatory authority, which could reduce administrative burdens and uncertainty for small fundraising organizations involved in gaming activities.

Title: Somerset County - Salaries of Local Officials - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the salaries of the Sheriff of Somerset County, the County Commissioners of Somerset County, the President of the County Commissioners of Somerset County, a member of the County Roads Board of Somerset County, and the President of the County Roads Board of Somerset County.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salaries of certain public officials in Somerset County, including the Sheriff, County Commissioners, and members of the County Roads Board, effective at the beginning of their next term after October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Somerset County government and its relevant departments responsible for public officials' salaries.
stakeholders: Public officials in Somerset County, including the Sheriff, County Commissioners, and County Roads Board members, and the residents of Somerset County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Adverse Decisions - Notices, Reporting, and Examinations
Synopsis: Requiring that certain adverse decision and grievance decision notices include certain information in a certain manner; requiring that the information regarding criteria and standards for utilization review that a private review agent is required to post on its website or the carrier's website be posted on the member's and provider's pages of the websites; requiring that certain information submitted to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner be aggregated by zip code; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates improvements in the notification process for adverse decisions and grievances related to health insurance, including detailed information requirements, posting criteria on websites, and enhanced communication channels for members and providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and private review agents
stakeholders: Health insurance members, healthcare providers, and insurance carriers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions aim to improve transparency and communication in health insurance decisions, which could help reduce small business failures related to insurance disputes.

Title: Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices to study the most efficient and cost-effective method to create a publicly available data dashboard that disaggregates information regarding public work contracts with the State and apprentices working under the public work contracts; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 7, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup to study and recommend the creation of a publicly accessible data dashboard that disaggregates information about public work contracts and apprentices working under those contracts in Maryland.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Labor, specifically the Commissioner of Labor and Industry, is responsible for developing and maintaining the data dashboard.
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, employees, and apprentices working under public work contracts in Maryland, as well as government agencies overseeing public works.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve transparency and accountability in public work contracts, which could help small businesses by providing clearer information and fairer practices, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Postconviction Review - Procedure to Reduce Duration of Sentence (Maryland Second Look Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain individual to file a motion to reduce the duration of a certain sentence if the individual was convicted between the ages of at least 18 and under 25, was not sentenced to life, is not a sex offender, has served at least 20 years of the term of confinement, and was not convicted of murder involving a victim who was a first responder who was killed in the line of duty; applying procedures for a proceeding under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals serving long-term sentences in Maryland to petition the court to reduce their sentences after serving at least 20 years, with specific provisions for certain age groups and offenses. It establishes procedures for hearings, evidence presentation, and factors for courts to consider in making decisions.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland, their victims, and the Maryland criminal justice system
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network; and extending the workgroup to June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network, expands its membership, extends its duration, and requires it to identify options for creating an open access science and technology network, with a report due by December 2026.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, Baltimore County (provides staff for the Workgroup)
stakeholders: Scientists, researchers, industry professionals, community members, and the general public interested in science and technology innovation in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to facilitate collaboration and information exchange in science and technology, which could support small businesses in these sectors, but it does not directly target small business failure reduction.

Title: Natural Resources - Pursuing Wounded Deer After Legal Hunting Hours and Using a Light - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is authorized by the Department of Natural Resources to hunt deer and who wounds a deer during legal hunting hours to pursue and kill the deer after legal hunting hours using the means authorized for the applicable hunting season or permit which may include use of a light or throw or cast the rays of a spotlight, a headlight, an artificial light, a battery, or any other device while pursuing the wounded deer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals who are permitted to hunt deer in Maryland to pursue and kill a wounded deer after legal hunting hours, using a light or other devices, under certain restrictions.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to hunting regulations.

Title: Access to Health Insurance for Child Care Professionals - Outreach
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to promote access to health insurance for child care professionals; and requiring the Exchange to conduct a survey, in consultation with the State Department of Education and relevant nonprofit organizations, to assess current levels of health care access across the child care community.
bill_summary: The bill promotes access to health insurance for child care professionals by requiring the Maryland Department of Education, in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, to conduct outreach, partner with relevant organizations, and assess healthcare access within the child care community. It also authorizes qualifying nonprofit organizations to participate as satellite organizations in the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Child care professionals and child care providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve health insurance access for child care providers, which could reduce financial and operational challenges, potentially decreasing small business failure rates in the child care sector.

Title: Public Nuisance - Common Carriers - Damage to Public Infrastructure
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain common carriers from damaging certain public infrastructure necessitating the closure of the infrastructure; establishing that a violation of the Act is a public nuisance; authorizing the State or a local government to bring a civil action against a common carrier for a violation under the Act; and providing that a common carrier that commits a violation may be liable to the State or local government for civil penalties of $1,000 per day for each day the public nuisance continues.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain common carriers from damaging public infrastructure such as bridges and highways, making such damage a public nuisance. It allows the government to take civil action against violators, including seeking injunctive relief, damages, and civil penalties.
responsible_party: The State of Maryland or local governments, specifically through their legal or public works departments, are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Public infrastructure owners, local governments, the State of Maryland, and residents who rely on public infrastructure.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily targets public infrastructure damage caused by transportation companies.

Title: Transportation Network Companies - Weekly Fare and Earnings Summary and Operator Data Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring a transportation network company to provide each operator with a weekly fare and earnings summary; requiring a transportation network company to report, on or before February 1 each year, certain information to the Public Service Commission; and providing that the report submitted to the Commission may be made available to the General Assembly on request, provided that the report remain confidential and exempt from public disclosure.
bill_summary: The bill requires transportation network companies in Maryland to provide weekly fare and earnings summaries to their operators, offer digital receipts after each ride, and report annual aggregated data to the Public Service Commission, including information on fares, operator earnings, and demographics.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Transportation network operators, passengers, and transportation network companies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for transparency and data reporting could help small transportation businesses optimize operations and reduce failure risk.

Title: Catastrophic Event Account - Transfer of Funds - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Authorizing the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund if the balance of the Fund has been depleted due to use or transfer or the estimated costs for providing adequate disaster relief for a natural disaster or catastrophic situation are in excess of the Fund's balance; and providing the Legislative Policy Committee has 10 days to review and make comments before the Governor may transfer certain funds from the Account through budget amendment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund under certain circumstances, modifies review periods for fund transfers, and clarifies the management and use of these funds to support disaster response and recovery efforts in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Public Safety and the Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: State and local government agencies involved in disaster response and recovery, and residents affected by natural disasters or federal shutdowns in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for rapid fund transfers and disaster response support could help mitigate economic impacts on small businesses during disasters, potentially reducing failure rates.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C (Theater) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County; authorizing the manager of the theater or any other official designated by the theater to sign the application for the license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue the license for use by certain theaters; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, subject to certain limitations; establishing an annual license fee of $150; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County, allowing theaters to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption during specific times around performances and events.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Theaters and their patrons in Frederick County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help theaters increase revenue and attract more patrons, potentially reducing the risk of business failure.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2025
Synopsis: Repealing the limitation on the period during which the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide reimbursement for certain health care services provided through telehealth on a certain basis and at a certain rate; altering the circumstances under which health care practitioners are authorized to prescribe certain controlled dangerous substances for the treatment of pain through telehealth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands telehealth access in Maryland by removing restrictions on the use of audio-only telephone conversations for reimbursement and coverage, extends telehealth reimbursement parity with in-person services until June 1, 2025, and requires the Maryland Health Care Commission to report on telehealth developments every four years. It also clarifies standards for healthcare practitioners prescribing controlled substances via telehealth.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients receiving telehealth services, healthcare providers, insurers, and health maintenance organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions on telehealth reimbursement and coverage are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as they primarily affect healthcare providers and insurers.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Community Benefits - Community Health Worker Workforce Program
