Synopsis: Altering the definition of "community benefit" to include a community health worker workforce program which is intended to provide services to patients of a nonprofit hospital and to improve health outcomes; authorizing a nonprofit hospital and a community-based organization to establish a community health worker workforce program; providing that a partnership that establishes a community health worker workforce program may be executed through a memorandum of understanding; establishing requirements for the memorandum of understanding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows nonprofit hospitals to include community health worker programs as part of their community benefits, establishing partnerships with community organizations to create these programs, which aim to improve health outcomes and address social determinants of health.
responsible_party: The Health Services Cost Review Commission and nonprofit hospitals in partnership with community-based organizations.
stakeholders: Community health workers, nonprofit hospitals, community-based organizations, and residents benefiting from improved health services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce small business failure by supporting community health initiatives and workforce development.

Title: Residential Real Property - Tenants' Right of First Refusal
Synopsis: Clarifying the circumstances under which liability for the failure to comply with certain requirements relating to a tenant's right of first refusal to purchase residential property is restricted to the owner of the property and does not attach to the property.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that liability for failing to comply with tenants' right of first refusal to purchase residential property is limited to the owner and does not attach to the property itself.
responsible_party: Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs
stakeholders: Tenants of residential rental properties and property owners in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on tenant rights and property liability, and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for submission of the interim report and final report of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission by 3 years; and extending the termination date for the Commission by 3 years.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadlines and the duration of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission, including extending the reporting deadlines for interim and final reports and prolonging the commission's existence until 2029.
responsible_party: The Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission
stakeholders: Individuals involved in or affected by prison education programs, including incarcerated persons and prison staff.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools for the purpose of studying and making recommendations on practices to identify, prevent, and eliminate chronic absenteeism by students from schools in the State; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools in Maryland. The task force will study, identify, and recommend strategies to prevent and eliminate chronic absenteeism among students, including developing guidance and toolkits for schools, and setting statewide goals.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Education (MSDE) is responsible for implementing the programs, including providing staff, updating regulations, and distributing guidance and toolkits.
stakeholders: Students, parents, teachers, school administrators, and local school systems in Maryland will be impacted by this bill.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on educational strategies and does not directly target small business failure rates, so its impact on small business failure is minimal.

Title: Family Investment Program - Child Support
Synopsis: Phasing in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to a family seeking assistance under the Family Investment Program and prohibiting the consideration of child support in computing the amount of assistance received.
bill_summary: The bill phases in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to families receiving assistance under the Family Investment Program (FIP) and prohibits considering child support when calculating assistance benefits. It also establishes a supplement for households with elderly individuals receiving small benefits and details the implementation timeline.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Families receiving assistance under the Family Investment Program, including children and minor parents, and households with elderly individuals receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates; it focuses on social assistance and nutrition programs.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System – Deferred Vested Former Members – Return to Service
Synopsis: Establishing that an individual who, after earning service credit sufficient for a vested allowance in the State Police Retirement System, the Correctional Officers' Retirement System, or the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, separates from service, and subsequently returns to service in a position in the same system under certain circumstances, is subject to the same requirements to which certain members of the same system are subject.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for individuals who, after earning service credit in various Maryland retirement systems and then leaving service, return to work in the same system under certain conditions. It clarifies their eligibility and requirements for reemployment without losing benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Systems and the Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Former members of Maryland's retirement systems who are returning to work in the same system after a break, including military service members and correctional officers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on retirement system reemployment rules.

Title: Accountants - Licensed Out-of-State Practice Privileges - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an individual licensed as a certified public accountant in another state to practice certified public accountancy in the State by requiring that the individual must have passed the Uniform CPA Examination when qualifying for the license in the other state.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for out-of-state licensed certified public accountants (CPAs) to practice in Maryland, allowing those with licenses from other states where they passed the Uniform CPA Exam to practice in Maryland without additional licensing requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants licensed in other states and practicing in Maryland, and the clients they serve in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining the process for out-of-state CPAs to practice in Maryland, the bill aims to facilitate the entry of qualified professionals, potentially reducing barriers for small accounting firms and individual practitioners, which may help decrease small business failures.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an initial teacher certificate to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications for initial teacher certification in Maryland, allowing candidates to qualify by passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program, among other options.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective teachers and students in Maryland schools
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Tidal Fish Licenses - Oyster Authorizations - Administrative Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to suspend for up to 5 years for a first violation, rather than revoke, a person's oyster authorization for knowingly committing certain violations; providing for the reinstatement for certain persons of an oyster authorization and an entitlement to engage or work in the oyster fishery; altering a certain offense related to the use of prohibited gear; and repealing the 90-day time period within which a certain administrative hearing must be held.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the penalties and procedures related to oyster fishing violations in Maryland, including suspending rather than revoking oyster authorizations for first offenses and establishing conditions for reinstatement of revoked authorizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers and related stakeholders in Maryland's oyster industry
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's changes to suspension and reinstatement procedures aim to reduce the likelihood of small oyster businesses failing due to license revocations, providing a more lenient and rehabilitative approach.

Title: Endangered and Threatened Species - Incidental Taking - Bats
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Natural Resources to issue an incidental taking permit for the Indiana bat, the northern long-eared bat, the tricolor bat, or the eastern small-footed bat if an applicant submits a certain conservation plan and the Secretary makes certain findings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue incidental taking permits for certain bat species, including the Indiana bat, Northern long-eared bat, Tricolored bat, and Eastern small-footed bat, under specific conservation plans that demonstrate minimal impact on the species' survival.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife conservation agencies, bat populations, environmental groups, and land developers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates; it focuses on wildlife conservation permits.

Title: Employment and Insurance Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing the regulation of business, economic development, insurance, and labor and employment to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes protections and programs for service members, veterans, and their families, including licensing, employment, insurance, and small business support, with a focus on recognizing active duty status and military service in various legal and administrative processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families and relevant licensing and regulatory agencies.
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, and veteran-owned small businesses in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides targeted support for veteran-owned small businesses through no-interest loans and expedited licensing, which could significantly reduce failure rates among these businesses.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Blind Individuals - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the property tax exemption amount for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000, and makes related adjustments to the exemption law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation or local county governments responsible for property tax administration.
stakeholders: Blind individuals and their surviving spouses who own and reside in qualifying dwelling houses in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses; it focuses on property tax exemptions for homeowners who are blind.

Title: Baltimore City - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 83
Synopsis: Increasing from two to four the number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; limiting to not more than one speed monitoring system in each direction that may be in operation at the same time on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; and making permanent the authorization to place speed monitoring systems on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of speed monitoring systems that can be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City from two to four, limits the number of systems in operation at the same time to one per direction, and makes the authorization to place these systems permanent.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation or relevant local government authority
stakeholders: Drivers and commuters on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City, Baltimore City residents, local law enforcement, and transportation authorities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Family Law - Permanent Protective Orders - Consent
Synopsis: Specifying that an individual may consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against the individual.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland family law to specify that an individual can consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against themselves, under certain conditions, including after serving part of a sentence for abuse or during the course of a protective order.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary (courts responsible for issuing protective orders)
stakeholders: Individuals involved in family abuse cases, victims of abuse, and the legal system handling protective orders.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Health Abortion Grant Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program to provide grants to improve access to abortion care clinical services for individuals in the State; establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to provide grants under the Program; and requiring that certain premium funds collected by health insurance carriers be used to provide certain coverage and to support improving access to abortion care clinical services under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Public Health Abortion Grant Program and Fund to provide grants to organizations that improve access to abortion care services for individuals in Maryland, especially those with limited resources. It also mandates that certain health insurance premium funds be used to support abortion care coverage and related programs.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration are responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who are uninsured, underinsured, or unable to use their insurance for abortion services, particularly those with limited resources.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to support organizations providing abortion services, which may include small healthcare providers, but its primary focus is on access to abortion care rather than small business failure reduction.

Title: Public Ethics - Conflicts of Interest and Blind Trust - Governor
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to place certain interests into a certain certified blind trust or divest of certain interests within 6 months after taking the oath of office; requiring the Governor to enter into a nonparticipation agreement with the State Ethics Commission for any interests not included in a blind trust; authorizing the Ethics Commission to impose a fine of up to $5,000 for each violation of the Act; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to carry out the Act including standards for types of interests that be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to place interests into a certified blind trust or divest of certain interests within a specified period, and to report interests held in business entities seeking state grants or contracts. It also establishes rules for conflicts of interest, nonparticipation agreements, and transparency measures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: The Governor, restricted individuals, Maryland state government, and entities seeking state grants or contracts.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for transparency and conflict of interest management aim to reduce potential conflicts that could lead to small business failures, but the direct impact is moderate.

Title: Nursing Homes - Cost Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to review the cost reports and other data submitted by each nursing home that participates in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; and requiring the Department to report the findings resulting from the review conducted under the Act to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2025, and each October 1 thereafter through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill requires nursing homes in Maryland to allocate at least 75% of their total revenue for direct care wages and benefits, submit annual cost reports detailing wages and other data, and allows the Department of Health to enforce compliance. It also mandates annual review and reporting of cost data related to direct care staff.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing homes and their residents, including direct care staff such as nurses, aides, dietary, and clerical workers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve financial transparency and ensure proper wage expenditures, which could help nursing homes maintain financial stability and reduce failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Cancellation and Nonrenewal of Coverage - Required Notice
Synopsis: Requiring that a carrier provide notice by certain electronic means, in addition to written notice, of cancellation or nonrenewal of a small group market health benefit plan and include information regarding additional health benefit coverage options in the notice; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to provide electronic notices, in addition to written notices, to small group market health benefit plan cancellations or nonrenewals. The notices must include information about additional coverage options, such as COBRA and plans through the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Small businesses and their employees enrolled in small group health plans in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By providing timely and comprehensive notices about cancellations and nonrenewals, the bill helps small businesses plan ahead and access alternative coverage options, potentially reducing the risk of business failure due to health insurance disruptions.

Title: Continuing Care Providers - Governing Bodies - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider; and authorizing the alternate subscriber member to attend all meetings of the governing body and vote only if the regular subscriber is unable to fulfill the subscriber's duties as a regular member of the governing body.
bill_summary: The bill requires the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider, with specific duties and conditions for their participation, to ensure subscriber representation and involvement.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Human Services or the governing bodies of continuing care providers are responsible for implementing the program.
stakeholders: Subscribers of continuing care providers, residents of facilities, and the governing bodies of these providers.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By involving subscribers in governance and ensuring their representation, the bill aims to improve the management and accountability of continuing care providers, which could reduce the risk of failure.

Title: Maryland Commission for Women - Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission for Women to establish the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control to study access to over-the-counter birth control; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control, which will study and recommend ways to improve access and coverage for over-the-counter birth control in Maryland.
responsible_party: The Maryland Commission for Women in the Department of Human Services, with staff support provided by the Commission.
stakeholders: Individuals seeking access to over-the-counter birth control, healthcare providers, pharmacies, insurers, community organizations, and public health agencies in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve access and coverage for over-the-counter birth control, which could reduce barriers for small businesses involved in healthcare and retail sectors, potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes of Malicious or Fraudulent Burning - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a certain crime of malicious or fraudulent burning that causes the death of or serious physical injury to a firefighter; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 10 years.
bill_summary: The bill enhances penalties for crimes of malicious or fraudulent burning that result in the death or serious injury of a firefighter, making such acts a felony with up to 10 years of imprisonment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Firefighters and the general public in Maryland, especially those involved in fire response and safety
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Election Law - Gubernatorial Primary Election - Date
Synopsis: Altering, from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June, the date for the primary election in the year of the gubernatorial election.
bill_summary: The bill changes the date of the statewide primary election in Maryland for gubernatorial election years from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and political candidates participating in Maryland's primary elections
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of taxes that maintains a website to include on the collector's website certain information and a certain link relating to the Homeowner Protection Program; altering the information the State Department of Assessments and Taxation is required to obtain and include in a certain annual report regarding tax sales; requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to take certain actions to maximize enrollment in the Homeowner Protection Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland, which aims to help vulnerable homeowners avoid tax sales and remain in their homes. It details funding sources, including state and county contributions, and mandates that tax collectors provide information about the program on their websites.
responsible_party: The Department of Assessments and Taxation, specifically the State Tax Sale Ombudsman and the Department itself.
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of tax sale, especially low-income, elderly, or disabled homeowners, and local governments involved in tax collection and sales.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to assist homeowners in paying taxes and avoiding foreclosure, which can contribute to reducing small business failures related to property loss and financial instability.

Title: Consumer Protection - Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation; requiring the Workgroup to monitor and make recommendations related to the regulation of artificial intelligence, consumer protection, current private sector use of artificial intelligence, enforcement authority for the Office of the Attorney General's Office of Consumer Protection, and impact in the determination of government benefits; and requiring the Workgroup to make its recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation to monitor and make recommendations on issues related to AI and consumer protection, including regulation, privacy, and impact on government benefits.
responsible_party: Department of the University of Maryland Center for Health and Homeland Security, which provides staff for the workgroup.
stakeholders: Consumers, AI developers, private sector companies, government agencies, and various industry and nonprofit organizations involved with AI, privacy, and consumer protection in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may influence the AI industry and related sectors, potentially impacting small businesses involved in AI development and deployment.

Title: Public Health - Pediatric Hospital Overstay Patients and Workgroup on Children in Unlicensed Settings and Pediatric Overstays
Synopsis: Specifying that the scope of the Maryland Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Registry and Referral System includes private and State inpatient and outpatient mental health and substance use services; requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Department of Human Services, under certain circumstances, to ensure pediatric hospital overstay patients are placed in the least restrictive setting when clinically indicated and when possible; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and workgroups to improve the placement and treatment of pediatric hospital overstay patients and children in unlicensed settings, including creating coordinators and assessment plans, and reviewing reimbursement rates for treatment facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Pediatric patients, children in unlicensed settings, healthcare providers, state agencies, and families of children in foster care.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes a review of reimbursement rates and a prospective payment model for treatment centers, which could help stabilize the financial viability of residential treatment and respite care facilities.

Title: Montgomery County - Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove MC 5-25
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal caused the displacement of residents from the Emory Grove community and make recommendations on potential remedies to those who were displaced by urban renewal; requiring the Task Force to submit an interim report by December 15, 2025, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Montgomery County Council, the Montgomery County Executive, the Montgomery County Delegation, and the General Assembly by December 15, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal from 1960 to 1985 caused displacement and to recommend remedies for those displaced.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Office of Human Rights
stakeholders: Residents displaced from the Emory Grove community due to urban renewal between 1960 and 1985
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on historical displacement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws - 2025 Edition - Legalization
Synopsis: Legalizing the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplement to the extent to which that code or supplement contains laws enacted by the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplements that contain laws enacted by the Maryland General Assembly, making it official and recognized in all courts and by public officials in Maryland.
responsible_party: Somerset County Government and Maryland State courts and public officials
stakeholders: Residents and local government officials of Somerset County, Maryland, and the general public who rely on local laws and regulations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or economic development; it primarily concerns the legal recognition of local laws.

Title: Business Regulation – Licensing – Definition of Storage Warehouse
Synopsis: Altering, with respect to business licensing requirements in the State, the definition of "storage warehouse" to exclude a self-service storage facility.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's business licensing law to clarify that self-service storage facilities are not considered storage warehouses requiring a license, thereby excluding them from certain licensing requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or the Maryland Business Licensing Office (implied as the licensing authority)
stakeholders: Storage facility operators, especially those operating self-service storage facilities, and businesses that use storage services in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying licensing requirements and excluding self-service storage facilities from needing a license, the bill reduces regulatory burdens on these small businesses, potentially decreasing their failure risk.

Title: Property Tax - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Broadband Service Providers
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with a provider of broadband service located in the county for property located in the county and owned by the provider; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland counties to enter into agreements with broadband service providers for payment in lieu of property taxes, and modifies how the valuation of broadband provider property is determined for tax purposes, including specific considerations for rural broadband providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Broadband service providers and residents in Maryland, especially in rural areas
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help broadband providers by providing a clearer and potentially more favorable property tax valuation process and the option for negotiated payments, which may reduce financial burdens and support business stability.

Title: Health Insurance - Insulin - Prohibition on Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for insulin or an insulin analog used to treat an insured's or enrollee's Type 1, Type 2, or gestational diabetes; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations in Maryland from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on insulin or similar medications used to treat diabetes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Individuals with diabetes who require insulin or similar medications
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily affects insurance policies and medication protocols.

Title: Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to provide advice on the planning of the Park; requiring the Advisory Committee to make recommendations to ensure that the Park focuses on mental and physical health and well-being, is equitable in providing access to the property, is truthful about the history of Crownsville Hospital, and preserves the natural beauty of the site; and requiring the Committee to report its achievements and recommendations to certain entities by February 1 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to advise on planning and development of the memorial park, including community involvement, cultural history, health, recreation, infrastructure, and educational opportunities.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government, specifically the County Executive and the County Council, with input from various state and local agencies.
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, especially those near Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park, and broader community members interested in cultural history, health, recreation, and education.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure or include programs aimed at reducing small business failure rates.

Title: Real Estate Commission - Continuing Education Requirements - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for continuing education required for the renewal of a license for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons, including the number of clock hours, course topics, course instructors, and course application fees.
bill_summary: The bill amends the continuing education requirements for real estate license renewal in Maryland, including the number of hours, course topics, and instructor qualifications, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers, associate brokers, and salespersons in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By updating continuing education requirements, the bill aims to improve professional standards and competence among real estate professionals, which could contribute to reducing small business failures in the real estate sector.

Title: Health Insurance - Preventive Services - High Deductible Health Plans and Enforcement Authority
Synopsis: Clarifying the application of certain health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to certain high deductible health plans; and requiring the Insurance Commissioner to enforce certain provisions of law related to preventive services consistent with the recommendations and guidelines set by certain federal agencies in effect on December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the application of health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to high deductible health plans in Maryland. It mandates enforcement of these provisions consistent with federal guidelines and recommendations, and allows the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to adopt regulations to expand preventive coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance policyholders in Maryland, especially those enrolled in high deductible health plans
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying coverage requirements and enforcement, the bill aims to reduce uncertainties and potential costs for small businesses offering health insurance, which may help lower their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a certain operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify at least 10 days prior to conducting a sale of an occupant's personal property stored in certain leased space at the self-service storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law regarding the sale of personal property in self-service storage facilities, specifically requiring operators to notify occupants of default and sale details through specified methods, including electronic mail, and to advertise sales in certain ways.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or the self-service storage facility operators (as the implementing agencies)
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility occupants and operators in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for clear notification and advertising may help storage operators avoid legal issues and disputes, potentially reducing small business failures related to storage operations.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Language Assistance Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Language Assistance Program; requiring a local board of elections to participate in the Program if the State Board determines that there is a significant need for language assistance to voters in the county in a language other than English; requiring the State Board to designate, not later than February 1 of the year of the election, certain languages other than English in which a local board that is required to participate in the Program must provide assistance to voters; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Language Assistance Program for elections in Maryland, requiring local boards of elections to provide language assistance and materials in designated languages based on the needs of voters with limited English proficiency.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters with limited English proficiency in Maryland, especially those speaking designated languages other than English.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but improving access to voting and civic participation may have indirect positive effects on local economies.

Title: Public Utilities - Electric Cooperatives - Rate Proceedings
Synopsis: Applying to electric cooperatives certain provisions of law related to rate proceedings held by the Public Service Commission to determine whether additional revenues are required to allow certain public service companies to earn the existing fair rate of return authorized in a previous base rate proceeding; and requiring the Commission to order an electric cooperative to conduct a certain public hearing.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify procedures for rate proceedings involving electric cooperatives, including requirements for public hearings and transparency when the Public Service Commission reviews rate adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric cooperatives and their customers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts electric cooperatives and their rate-setting processes, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-OB-CRD (Office Building - Commercial Revitalization District) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class B-OB-CRD (office building - commercial revitalization district) beer, wine, and liquor license in Baltimore County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to issue the license to an establishment that previously had or has a certain zoning classification and is at least a certain distance from a place of worship under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class B–OB–CRD (office building – commercial revitalization district) beer, wine, and liquor license in Baltimore County, allowing certain restaurants in specific office buildings to sell alcohol, with specific distance and zoning requirements, including exceptions for proximity to places of worship with consent.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants and businesses in Baltimore County, particularly those in office buildings and the Towson area, and places of worship near licensed establishments.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small businesses by providing a new license option in specific districts, potentially increasing their revenue and viability.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) MC 10-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use by the Maryland Transportation Authority of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County; requiring the District Court to remit to the Authority any civil penalties collected by the District Court resulting from a citation issued using a speed monitoring system operated by the Authority; and requiring the State Highway Administration to provide the Authority with access to certain systems and contacts.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Transportation Authority to place and operate speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County, and establishes procedures for collecting and remitting civil penalties from traffic citations issued using these systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Montgomery County, Maryland, especially those near Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector)
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts traffic enforcement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: State Procurement - Minority Business Enterprise Program - Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to public-private partnerships, offshore wind projects, video lottery terminals, and sports wagering licenses; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date for certain provisions related to the Maryland Minority Business Enterprise Program, modifies reporting deadlines, and updates regulations concerning minority business participation in public-private partnerships and offshore wind projects.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Minority-owned businesses and entities involved in public-private partnerships and offshore wind projects in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support minority-owned businesses through program extensions, updated goals, and compliance evaluations, which could help reduce failure rates among these businesses.

Title: Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System - Establishment
Synopsis: §Establishing the Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System to make recommendations to improve State reporting on adverse decisions, reduce the number of adverse decisions, and develop recommendations for legislation to address the rise in adverse decisions; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the Maryland health care system, aiming to analyze reporting requirements, recommend improvements, and develop strategies to reduce adverse decisions.
responsible_party: The Maryland Insurance Administration, the Maryland Medicaid Program, the Health Services Cost Review Commission, the Maryland Health Care Commission, the Chesapeake Regional Information System for our Patients, and the Office of the Attorney General's Health Education and Advocacy Unit.
stakeholders: Patients, health care providers, hospitals, health insurance companies, managed care plans, and advocacy organizations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on standardizing reporting and reducing adverse decisions could help health care providers and insurers operate more efficiently, potentially reducing small business failures related to health care costs and administrative burdens.

Title: Public Health - Phenibut Consumer Protection Act (JT Alvey Phenibut Consumer Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a phenibut product to disclose the factual basis on which any representations regarding the phenibut product are made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of phenibut products, including prohibitions related to the sale of phenibut to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of phenibut to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for the sale and marketing of phenibut products in Maryland, including disclosure requirements, restrictions on sale to minors, and advertising limitations, along with a reporting requirement on adverse health events.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Consumers of phenibut products, retailers, manufacturers, and minors in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's regulations could impact small businesses involved in selling phenibut by imposing compliance and advertising restrictions, but it does not directly aim to reduce small business failure.

Title: Public Health - Alzheimer's Disease and Related Dementias - Information on Prevalence and Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in partnership with certain entities, to incorporate information regarding treatments approved by the Food and Drug Administration for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias and to increase understanding and awareness of treatment of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias into relevant public health outreach programs; requiring the Department to establish and maintain a website with information on the prevalence and hospitalization rate for Alzheimer's and related dementias;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to incorporate information about FDA-approved treatments for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias into public health outreach programs. It also mandates the creation of a website that provides data on the prevalence and hospitalization rates of these conditions, disaggregated by various demographics.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in partnership with the Department of Aging, the Virginia I. Jones Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Disorders Dementias Council, and the Greater Maryland Chapter of the Alzheimer’s Association.
stakeholders: Individuals affected by Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias, including patients, caregivers, healthcare providers, and communities at greater risk such as Black and Latino populations.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve early detection and treatment, which could lead to better health outcomes and potentially reduce the economic burden on families and healthcare systems, indirectly supporting small businesses involved in healthcare and related services.

Title: Disability and Life Insurance - Medical Information (Genetic Testing Protection Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting insurance carriers that offer life insurance or disability insurance policies or contracts from unfairly discriminating against an individual by taking certain actions relating to coverage based on medical information; prohibiting certain carriers from accessing sensitive medical information without first obtaining written consent or mandating certain genetic testing or full genome sequencing as a prerequisite for life insurance or disability insurance eligibility or coverage;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits life, long-term care, and disability insurance carriers in Maryland from discriminating against applicants based on genetic testing results, including restrictions on accessing genetic information without consent and mandating genetic testing.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner or the Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Applicants for life, long-term care, and disability insurance in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily regulates insurance practices rather than business operations.

Title: African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund - Noncapital Grants and Donations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund to provide funding for African American Heritage Preservation Noncapital Grants for the purpose of preserving or sharing African American history or culture in the State; requiring certain noncapital grants to be made using certain money received by the African American Heritage Preservation (AAHP) Grant Fund; and authorizing the AAHP Grant Fund to receive grants and donations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund, which provides funding for noncapital grants to preserve African American history and culture in Maryland. It details the administration, funding sources, application process, and criteria for grants, including emergency grants, and mandates annual reporting.
responsible_party: The Maryland Trust, in partnership with the Commission on African American History and Culture, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: African American communities, historical preservation organizations, and cultural institutions in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on historical preservation and cultural projects, not directly on small business support or failure reduction.

Title: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force to identify certain funding sources and mechanisms, and to submit a report to the Governor, the Mayor of Baltimore City, and the General Assembly on its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2025; and extending the termination date for the Task Force from June 30, 2025, to June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority to oversee the renovation, revitalization, and management of the Baltimore Convention site and promote Baltimore as a tourist destination. It extends the task force studying this initiative and details the structure, powers, and responsibilities of the new authority.
responsible_party: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority
stakeholders: Businesses, residents, and visitors in Baltimore City and surrounding counties, including the hospitality, restaurant, and entertainment industries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support the redevelopment and operation of key tourism and convention assets, which could help small businesses in related sectors by increasing tourism and event activity.

Title: Financial Institutions - Conventional Home Mortgage Loans - Assumption and Required Disclosures
Synopsis: Requiring banking institutions, credit unions, mortgage lenders, mortgage lending businesses, and mortgage loan originators to include a certain provision in certain conventional home mortgage loans authorizing a certain borrower to purchase the property interest of a certain borrower in connection with a decree of absolute divorce if the lending entity determines that the assuming borrower qualifies for the loan; applying certain provisions of the Act retroactively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain financial institutions to include provisions in conventional home mortgage loans that allow borrowers to assume the mortgage in connection with a divorce decree, and mandates disclosure of these provisions to loan applicants. It also clarifies definitions related to mortgage loans and includes retroactive application of these requirements.
responsible_party: Financial Institutions, including banks and credit unions, and their mortgage lending departments.
stakeholders: Homeowners, particularly those going through divorce, and mortgage lenders and institutions involved in home financing.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts mortgage lending practices for individual homeowners and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Consumer Protection - Credit Reporting - Medical Debt (Fair Medical Debt Reporting Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer reporting agency from furnishing any consumer report containing certain adverse information relating to a consumer's medical debt, or any collection action against a consumer for medical debt, or maintain a file on a consumer related to medical debt or collections; prohibiting a person from using medical debt information from a consumer report for certain purposes; prohibiting a health care facility, a health care practitioner, or an ambulance service from disclosing medical debt to a consumer reporting agency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the inclusion of medical debt information in consumer reports, restricts the use of medical debt in creditworthiness decisions, and sets rules for hospitals and healthcare providers regarding debt collection and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Consumer Protection Agency
stakeholders: Consumers with medical debt, healthcare providers, hospitals, and debt collection agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions mainly impact healthcare providers and debt collectors, with indirect benefits for small healthcare-related businesses by reducing unfair debt reporting and collection practices.

Title: Real Estate Appraisers - Licensure and Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors from requiring an applicant to hold a bachelor's degree or higher to qualify for a certain certification or licensure as a real estate appraiser.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to prohibit the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers from requiring applicants for real estate appraiser licenses or certifications to hold a bachelor's degree or higher. It clarifies the qualifications needed for licensure and certification, aligning with federal standards, and removes degree requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers
stakeholders: Individuals seeking licensure or certification as real estate appraisers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By removing the degree requirement, the bill potentially lowers barriers for individuals to become licensed appraisers, which could increase the number of qualified appraisers and support small real estate businesses.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Tasting Permits
Synopsis: Altering in Frederick County the beer and wine consumption permit to be the beer and wine tasting permit and the beer, wine, and liquor consumption permit to be the beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit; and requiring the Board to regulate the quantity of beer and wine served to an individual and the number of bottles or other containers from which the quantity is served.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol tasting permits in Frederick County, changing permit names, adjusting the quantities of alcohol that can be tasted, and clarifying regulations for on-premises tasting of beer, wine, and liquor.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, consumers in Frederick County, and local businesses involved in alcohol sales and tasting events.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's adjustments to tasting permits aim to streamline licensing and regulation, potentially reducing barriers for small alcohol-related businesses and encouraging local economic activity.

Title: Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System; requiring the Workgroup to review a certain study completed by the Department of Information Technology in order to establish a plan to implement the recommendations of the study; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a workgroup to study the implementation of an expanded 3-1-1 nonemergency telephone system across Maryland, including reviewing current services, best practices, and developing a plan for statewide expansion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology, with assistance from the Department of Legislative Services.
stakeholders: Residents and public safety agencies across Maryland, especially those using or affected by nonemergency 3-1-1 services.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but improving emergency and nonemergency communication systems could indirectly benefit local businesses by enhancing public safety and service delivery.

Title: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System - Investment Division - Compensation and Staffing
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System shall pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; clarifying that the Board of Trustees shall pay certain incentive compensation to certain employees of the Investment Division if the employees retire from the Investment Division in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the compensation, incentives, and staffing procedures for the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including establishing a Compensation and Staffing Committee, setting objective criteria for employee qualifications and pay, and regulating incentive payments to the Chief Investment Officer and investment staff.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System and its Compensation and Staffing Committee.
stakeholders: Employees of the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency, including the Chief Investment Officer and other investment staff.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Membership - Clarifications
Synopsis: Clarifying the membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain employees of certain Maryland Department of Health facilities; and clarifying that certain participating employees who are appointed, promoted, or transferred are members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System as a condition of employment.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and updates the membership rules for the Correctional Officers' Retirement System in Maryland, including provisions for transferring service credits and sick leave for certain employees of the Maryland Department of Health and other correctional staff.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Correctional officers, Department of Health employees, and other correctional staff in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: This bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Reemployment Earnings Limitations - Maximum Average Final Compensation
Synopsis: Clarifying that the maximum average final compensation that certain retirees of the State Retirement and Pension System is to be based on the minimum annual salary on the standard State pay scale as of January 1 of the preceding calendar year in order to be exempt from a certain reemployment earnings limitation; and adding an average final compensation reemployment exemption for the temporary suspension of a retirement allowance for disability retirees.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation of the maximum average final compensation for retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifically to exempt certain reemployment earnings from limitations if the retiree's average final compensation was below a specified minimum salary as of January 1 of the previous year. It also provides an exemption for the temporary suspension of a disability retirement allowance.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System (Board of Trustees)
stakeholders: Retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, especially those reemployed after retirement, including disability retirees.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns retirement and reemployment earnings limitations.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System – Alterations and Clarifications
Synopsis: Altering certain due dates of certain reports from the State Retirement and Pension System; and clarifying the eligibility requirements of State Police Retirement System members to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including updating report due dates, clarifying eligibility for the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for State Police Retirement System members, and generally clarifying administration procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System and its Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and other state pension system participants
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Electricity and Gas - Emissions Reductions, Rate Regulation, Cost Recovery, Infrastructure, Planning, Renewable Energy Portfolio Standard, and Energy Assistance Programs (Next Generation Energy Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Housing and Community Development to issue loans, in addition to grants, for certain purposes relating to reducing direct greenhouse gas emissions from certain multifamily residential buildings; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration, in coordination with the Public Service Commission and the Department of Natural Resources, to pursue certain agreements with neighboring states and federal agencies related to the development of new nuclear energy generation stations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development to issue loans and grants for reducing greenhouse gas emissions in multifamily buildings, expands programs for nuclear energy development, updates regulations for energy infrastructure and procurement, and establishes new standards and processes for energy generation, storage, and procurement, including nuclear, dispatchable, and transmission energy storage projects.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland Energy Administration, Public Service Commission, Department of Natural Resources, and the Maryland Department of Labor.
stakeholders: Low- to moderate-income households, small businesses, minority and women-owned businesses, energy developers, utility customers, and residents of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions to promote local and minority business participation in energy projects, which could help reduce small business failures by providing opportunities and support.

Title: Public Utilities - Generating Stations - Generation and Siting (Renewable Energy Certainty Act)
Synopsis: Altering the factors the Public Service Commission must consider before taking final action on a certificate of public convenience and necessity; establishing a distributed generation certificate of public convenience and necessity to authorize the construction and operation of a certain distributed solar energy generating system; requiring the Power Plant Research Program, by July 1, 2026, to develop and submit to the Commission proposed siting and design requirements and licensing conditions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's regulations on the siting, construction, and approval process for renewable energy generating stations, including solar energy systems, and establishes new standards for distributed solar projects, community solar programs, and energy storage devices. It also aims to streamline permitting, promote community solar, and set standards for solar contractor licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Solar energy developers, local governments, residents, and low- to moderate-income communities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides clearer standards and streamlined processes for solar project approvals, which can reduce delays and uncertainties for small solar businesses and contractors, potentially lowering their failure risk.

Title: Energy Resource Adequacy and Planning Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Energy Planning Office; requiring the Office to develop a Comprehensive Wholesale Energy Markets and Bulk Power System Risk Report and examine certain scenarios to support the development of the Risk Report; requiring the Risk Report to assess wholesale energy market financial resource adequacy and reliability risks and to identify any necessary cost-effective solutions that ensure electric system reliability while meeting the State's energy policy goals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Strategic Energy Planning Office to develop comprehensive energy forecasts, risk reports, and resource plans to support Maryland's energy and climate goals. It also creates a framework for energy modeling, stakeholder engagement, and regular reporting to guide long-term energy policy and infrastructure development.
responsible_party: The Maryland Public Service Commission, the Maryland Energy Administration, and the Strategic Energy Planning Office.
stakeholders: Electricity consumers, energy producers, utility companies, and residents of Maryland, especially those in underserved or overburdened communities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on energy planning and cost-effective solutions aims to stabilize energy markets and reduce the risk of energy-related failures for small businesses.

Title: Health Insurance, Family Planning Services, and Confidentiality of Medical Records - Consumer Protections - Updates
Synopsis: Updating references to federal law related to family planning services, grandfathered plans, explanation of benefits, summaries of benefits and coverage, medical loss ratios, catastrophic plans, annual limits for cost sharing, prescription drugs, and rescissions; altering the definitions of "legally protected health care" and "sensitive health services" to include gender-affirming care for purposes of law governing the disclosure of information regarding sensitive health services; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws related to health insurance, family planning services, and confidentiality of medical records. It clarifies definitions, aligns state law with federal regulations, and enhances protections for sensitive health services including reproductive and gender-affirming care. It also establishes a Family Planning Program to support services for providers affected by federal funding changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Individuals seeking family planning, reproductive, and gender-affirming health services in Maryland, including providers affected by federal funding changes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support family planning providers affected by federal funding changes, potentially reducing the failure rate of small health service providers by providing state funding and regulatory support.

Title: Mechanical Repair Contracts - Technical Service Bulletins
Synopsis: Prohibiting a mechanical repair contract from containing a provision precluding coverage for service to a motor vehicle solely for issues identified in a technical services bulletin and prohibiting the denial of a service claim solely for such an issue by a guarantor or provider.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for mechanical repair contracts for motor vehicles, including prohibiting deceptive statements, ensuring truthful testimonials, and preventing coverage denial for issues identified in technical service bulletins.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, vehicle dealers, obligors, agents, and providers of mechanical repair contracts for motor vehicles in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's regulations aim to clarify contract terms and prevent unfair denial of claims, which could help small vehicle repair businesses by reducing disputes and potential failures.

Title: Judicial and Public Safety for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of judicial proceedings, corrections, criminal, family, public safety, and real property laws to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services and veterans, extends certain legal protections and benefits to service members and veterans, and makes various amendments to Maryland law to recognize the rights and statuses of individuals in the military and veterans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families, and organizations supporting military personnel and veterans in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions that support service members and veterans, which can indirectly help reduce small business failure by providing legal protections and benefits to military personnel and their families.

Title: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Open Meetings - Live Streaming Requirement MC/PG 101-25
Synopsis: Establishing that certain project site visits and educational field tours do not constitute open meetings subject to the requirement that the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, respectively, stream live video or audio of their open meetings.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that certain project site visits and educational field tours by the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission do not count as open meetings that require live streaming or recording, unless organizational business is conducted.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Residents and stakeholders of Montgomery County and the Washington Suburban Sanitary area who are interested in open meetings and transparency.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it may improve transparency and accountability of public agencies involved in community development.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Appeals - Membership MC/PG 106-25
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the board of appeals in Prince George's County to be at least three members; and altering the number of members of the board required to concur in any resolution to a simple majority.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership and decision-making process of the Board of Appeals in Prince George's County, including the number of members required to concur in resolutions and other organizational details.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council and the Board of Appeals
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in Prince George's County, especially those involved in land use and zoning appeals.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on land use appeals and organizational changes is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Workgroups
Synopsis: Requiring the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to establish a workgroup on the improvement of health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use; requiring the workgroup to make recommendations on changes to State laws, policies and practices needed to mitigate the harm related to criminalization of substance use and related to the discharge of patients from substance use treatment programs; and requiring the workgroup to submit a certain report annually.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a workgroup within the Maryland Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to improve health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use, and mandates the commission to review and make recommendations on treatment access, criminal justice involvement, and related policies.
responsible_party: The Maryland Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access, with support from the Maryland Department of Health.
stakeholders: Individuals with substance use disorders, their families, healthcare providers, criminal justice system participants, and community organizations involved in behavioral health and substance use treatment.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve access to treatment and social services, which could reduce the economic burden on small businesses by decreasing related health and social issues.

Title: Life and Health Insurance Policies and Annuity and Health Maintenance Organization Contracts - Discretionary Clauses - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the use of discretionary clauses in life insurance policies, health insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use of discretionary clauses in health insurance policies, life insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts in Maryland, effective January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing health, life, and annuity insurance policies, and members of health maintenance organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily affects policy language and consumer protections rather than business operations.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees - Repeal
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to certify certain employer contribution rates each fiscal year; requiring the employer contribution rates to include recognition of certain administrative and operational expenses; repealing a requirement that certain administrative and operational expenses of the State Retirement and Pension System and the State Retirement Agency be funded by charging each participating employer an administrative fee for each system participant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that administrative and operational expenses of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System be funded through administrative fees charged to participating employers. Instead, these expenses will be funded through the system's accumulation fund, with the funding method transitioning over several fiscal years.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Employers participating in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including local employers and the State government, as well as system members and retirees.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By eliminating the administrative fee charged to employers, the bill reduces the financial burden on participating employers, which could help small businesses maintain financial stability and reduce the risk of failure.

Title: Residential Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Notice of Landlord Entry
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain written notice in a certain manner at least 24 hours in advance of when the landlord intends to enter a leased premises, except in the event of a certain emergency; and authorizing the court to issue a certain injunction or assess certain damages under certain circumstances.
