decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves public health programs and insurance policies.

Title: Prescription Drug Repository Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the Prescription Drug Repository Program, including by allowing certain entities located in another state to participate in the Program as drop-off sites and repositories, including over-the-counter drugs under the Program, and altering the individuals who are eligible to receive drugs or medical supplies under the Program; and altering the persons for whom and the activities with respect to which certain immunity is provided under the Program.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Prescription Drug Repository Program to allow certain entities in other states to participate as drop-off sites and repositories, expands the types of drugs and supplies that can be donated and dispensed, and establishes standards and regulations for the operation of the program.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Indigent, uninsured, underinsured individuals, and residents of Maryland who will benefit from access to donated prescription drugs and medical supplies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for donation, disposal, and distribution of drugs aim to streamline processes and reduce waste, which could help small pharmacies and health care entities by providing additional channels for drug redistribution and disposal.

Title: Vaccinations by Pharmacists and Health Insurance Coverage for Immunizations
Synopsis: Altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist may administer, subject to certain requirements, to an individual of at least a certain age; altering the vaccinations included in the minimum package of child wellness services for which certain health insurers and nonprofit health service plans are required to provide coverage to include those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as of December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes pharmacists to administer certain vaccines to individuals aged 3 and older, expands the list of vaccines covered under child wellness services by health insurers, and sets requirements for vaccination protocols and reporting. It aims to improve access to immunizations and ensure coverage for preventive health services for children.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Children, parents, healthcare providers, and health insurers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By expanding insurance coverage for child wellness services and immunizations, the bill may reduce financial barriers for families, potentially decreasing small business failure related to employee health benefits and associated costs.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Youth-Centric Technology and Social Media Resource Guide
Synopsis: Requiring the National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to develop and publish a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide by the 2027-2028 school year; requiring the guide to be distributed, beginning with the 2027-2028 school year, to each public school and the parent teacher organization for each public school and posted on the websites of the Department and each county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the University of Maryland's National Center for School Mental Health, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education, to develop, publish, and update a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide for public school students, starting with the 2027-2028 school year. The guide aims to provide age-appropriate information and best practices for safe and informed use of technology and social media.
responsible_party: The National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education.
stakeholders: Public school students in Maryland, their parents and guardians, and school staff.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it involves developing resources related to youth-centric technology, which could indirectly impact technology providers and developers.

Title: Natural Resources - Vessels - Carbon Monoxide Warning Labels (Matthew's Law)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from operating a gasoline-powered vessel manufactured after July 31, 2007, that has accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas on the waters of the State unless the vessel has carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in conspicuous locations in the vicinity of both the transom and the helm of the vessel; and prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from imposing a penalty on a person that violates the Act.
bill_summary: The bill requires that gasoline-powered vessels with certain features operating in Maryland waters after July 31, 2007, must have conspicuous carbon monoxide warning labels affixed near the transom and helm. It also prohibits the Department of Natural Resources from imposing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Operators of gasoline-powered vessels with accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas in Maryland waters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by setting safety labeling requirements, it may influence vessel manufacturers and operators.

Title: Garrett County - Bids and Contracts - Advertisement Exceptions
Synopsis: Providing that, in Garrett County, a certain requirement to advertise for bids does not apply to a certain contract for goods or services procured on an as-needed basis over time or for certain vehicles.
bill_summary: The bill amends procurement laws in Garrett County to allow the County Commissioners and employees to enter into contracts for goods or services on an as-needed basis or for certain vehicles without advertising for bids, bypassing the usual bidding process for specific types of contracts.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government (County Commissioners and county employees)
stakeholders: Garrett County residents and local businesses involved in county contracts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially reduce small business failures by streamlining procurement processes and providing more opportunities for local businesses to secure county contracts without the need for extensive bidding.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Special Event Venue License and Multiple Event Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing the special event venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners of Caroline County to issue the license to the owner of a venue with a certain zoning classification; authorizing holders of certain multiple event licenses in Caroline County to store alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises between individual events in a certain manner; requiring the license holder to keep complete records of all alcoholic beverages purchased and sold on the premises; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a special event venue alcohol license in Caroline County, allowing owners of designated venues to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption during events, with specific licensing, storage, and record-keeping provisions.
responsible_party: The Board of License Commissioners for Caroline County
stakeholders: Owners of special event venues in Caroline County and event attendees
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a streamlined licensing process and storage allowances for venue owners, which could help reduce small business failures by simplifying alcohol licensing and management.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax - Day Care Centers and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation in Anne Arundel County; authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or the governing body of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain child care centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides property tax exemptions and credits for personal property and real estate used in connection with large family child care homes, child care centers, and day care centers in Anne Arundel County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Child care providers, families using child care services, and small business owners operating child care centers in Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill offers tax relief measures that could reduce operational costs for small child care businesses, potentially decreasing their failure rate.

Title: Department of General Services - Assessment of State-Owned Facilities - Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to conduct an assessment of facilities owned by the State and operated by the 16 State agencies the Department supports to evaluate whether the facility or a portion of the facility would be suitable to lease to a child care center;  requiring the Department to report to the General Assembly the results of the assessment and a description of whether each facility is suitable to lease to a child care center by December 1, 2026; and requiring the report to be published on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to assess all state-owned facilities operated by 16 state agencies to determine if they are suitable and available for lease to child care centers. The department must report its findings to the General Assembly and publish the report on its website by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Child care providers and children in Maryland who need access to child care centers
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could facilitate the establishment of new child care centers by repurposing existing state-owned facilities, potentially reducing barriers for small businesses in the child care sector.

Title: Security Guards and Security Guard Employers - Registration, Certification, and Regulation
Synopsis: Providing that a cannabis agent who is employed to provide security services for a cannabis licensee or cannabis registrant as a security guard or by a security guard agency is not required to obtain a State or national criminal history records check if the cannabis agent is authorized to provide security guard services; altering the definition of "security guard employer" for purposes of certain provisions of law to exclude video lottery facilities, sports wagering facility licensees, and health care facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning cannabis agents and security guards, including exemptions from criminal background checks for cannabis agents providing security services, and updates definitions and licensing requirements for security guard employers and agencies. It also clarifies the scope of security guard employer regulations, excluding certain facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Administration, Maryland Department of Business and Occupations and Professions, Maryland State Government security and gaming agencies.
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, security guards, security guard agencies, security guard employers, and individuals working in or regulated by these sectors in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions streamline licensing and background check requirements, potentially reducing barriers for security service providers and cannabis businesses, which may help lower small business failure rates.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Panels - Credentialing for Behavioral Health Care Professionals
Synopsis: Altering the providers of certain community-based health services that a carrier is prohibited from rejecting for participation on the carrier's provider panel; altering the period of time in which certain carriers are required to accept or deny certain social workers, counselors, and psychology associates for participation on the carrier's provider panel to within 60 days after the date a carrier receives a completed application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the credentialing process for behavioral health care professionals seeking to participate on health insurance provider panels in Maryland. It ensures that certain licensed behavioral health providers cannot be rejected solely based on their scope of practice and sets specific timelines for insurance carriers to accept or reject applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and health insurance carriers
stakeholders: Behavioral health care professionals, health insurance carriers, and patients seeking behavioral health services in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By streamlining credentialing processes and setting clear timelines, the bill aims to reduce administrative barriers for behavioral health providers, potentially decreasing small business failure related to credentialing delays.

Title: Health Insurance - Required Coverage - Hearing Aids
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide coverage for medically appropriate and necessary hearing aids for adults to require coverage if the hearing aid is ordered, fitted, and dispensed by a licensed hearing aid dispenser.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance providers in Maryland to cover medically necessary hearing aids for adults, with specific provisions for coverage limits and provider qualifications, effective January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Health insurance providers, including insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations in Maryland.
stakeholders: Adults in Maryland who require hearing aids and are covered by health insurance plans.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily affects health insurance coverage requirements.

Title: Lead Testing and Inspections - Falsifying Information - Penalty
Synopsis: Establishing a civil penalty not exceeding $50,000 for a person who falsifies information that is submitted in a report of the results of lead-contaminated dust testing or visual inspection of an affected property.
bill_summary: The bill establishes penalties for falsifying information in reports related to lead testing and inspections, including civil penalties up to $50,000 for falsification and additional penalties for false verification by supervisors.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, tenants, and lead testing/inspection professionals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's penalties may incentivize accurate reporting and compliance, potentially reducing failures due to legal issues, but it primarily targets misconduct rather than business failure.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses - Electronic Credentials (Maryland Mobile ID Enhancement Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement to facilitate the issuance, use, and verification of electronic credentials through a national association of motor vehicle agencies; and authorizing an individual who will operate a rented vehicle to use a certain electronic credential showing a representation of a valid driver's license, instead of a driver's license, to rent the vehicle.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue and verify electronic driver credentials, which can be used in place of physical driver's licenses, especially for renting vehicles. It also establishes agreements with other agencies for the use of these electronic credentials.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers, vehicle rental companies, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small vehicle rental businesses by streamlining the rental process with electronic credentials, potentially reducing delays and administrative costs.

Title: Vehicle Equipment - Portable Variable Messaging Signs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a tow truck to display a portable variable messaging sign mounted on the tow truck while at the scene of a crash or a disabled vehicle; and requiring the portable variable messaging sign to conform to the standards established in the manual on uniform traffic control devices adopted by the State Highway Administration and display only messages approved by the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes tow trucks to display portable variable messaging signs at the scene of accidents or disabled vehicles, provided the signs meet specific standards and are approved by the Maryland State Highway Administration.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Tow truck operators, drivers involved in accidents, and the general public on Maryland roads.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small towing businesses by allowing them to use portable messaging signs, potentially increasing their safety and visibility, which may reduce operational failures.

Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the award of noneconomic damages to a claimant in an action for child sexual abuse; altering certain provisions relating to the liability of the State under the Maryland Tort Claims Act and of a local government under the Local Government Tort Claims Act for certain claims of child sexual abuse; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly by January 31, 2027, and each year thereafter, on the amount of each award and a summary of the sexual abuse claims related to the award.
bill_summary: This bill extends the statute of limitations for filing civil claims of child sexual abuse, increases damages limits, and modifies liability and immunity provisions for the State, local governments, and school boards related to child sexual abuse claims.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, Maryland State and local government agencies, school boards, and legal practitioners
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts government agencies and does not directly target small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Hospitals and Freestanding Birthing Centers - Perinatal Care Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals that meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards for each hospital that provides obstetrical services; and requiring each hospital that provides obstetrical services and freestanding birthing centers, as a condition of licensure, to comply with certain minimum perinatal care standards.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to establish and enforce minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals and freestanding birthing centers that meet or exceed Maryland Perinatal System Standards, as a condition of licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Hospitals, freestanding birthing centers, pregnant women, and newborns in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By setting clear minimum standards for perinatal care, the bill aims to improve quality and safety, which can help prevent failures and closures of small healthcare providers.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class D Licenses - Delivery
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law relating to the delivery of alcoholic beverages in Howard County to a holder or an employee of a holder of a Class D license.
bill_summary: The bill allows holders or employees of Class D alcohol licenses in Howard County to deliver alcoholic beverages within the county, with specific requirements for verifying the recipient’s age and ensuring responsible delivery practices.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Board and license holders with Class D licenses
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, employees, and consumers in Howard County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By enabling alcohol delivery, the bill could help small alcohol retail businesses expand their sales channels and reduce the risk of failure due to limited sales methods.

Title: Support and Protections for Individuals Affected by Federal Actions (Protect Our Federal Workers Act)
Synopsis: Renaming the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to be the Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund; authorizing funds appropriated to the Catastrophic Event Account to be expended to assist in funding costs connected to a relocation, closure, or mass layoff of a unit of the federal government; establishing the Expedited Hiring Program in the Department of Budget and Management; authorizing an appointing authority to recruit for certain vacant positions in State government; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a fund to assist Maryland residents affected by federal government shutdowns, including providing loans to federal employees and former employees experiencing financial hardship, and expands the state's powers to respond to federal actions that threaten residents' welfare.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Federal government employees and former employees in Maryland, residents affected by federal shutdowns, and small businesses impacted by federal actions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are primarily focused on individual financial assistance and state response mechanisms, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Courts - Parental Accommodations
Synopsis: Requiring circuit courthouses in the State, constructed or renovated on or after October 1, 2025, to maintain on its premises a private lactation room to be used by certain individuals; providing that breast-feeding mothers and certain individuals caring for children under 3 years old may be excused from jury service; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to collect certain information on jury service excusals and report annually to the Maryland General Assembly beginning by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland circuit courthouses constructed or renovated after October 1, 2025, to have private lactation rooms for nursing mothers and individuals caring for young children. It also allows breastfeeding mothers and certain caregivers to be excused from jury service and mandates the Maryland Judiciary to collect and report data on jury service excusals.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Breastfeeding mothers, individuals caring for children under age 4, and the general public who use the courthouses or serve on juries.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Juveniles - Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland to report annually by November 1 to the General Assembly on the Truancy Reduction Pilot Program; and requiring the report to include the number of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs established in State, the number of participants in each pilot program; information on the outcomes of the participants in each program, and recommendations to improve the function of the current program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Judiciary to report on the impact and effectiveness of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs, including data on student GPA, graduation rate, and truancy rate, and to make recommendations about their effectiveness in Baltimore City. It also mandates annual reporting on the number of programs, participants, outcomes, and suggestions for improvement, with the report due by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Students involved in truancy reduction programs, schools, and families in Maryland, especially in Baltimore City.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Local Government - Hiring and Promotion Preferences for Veterans and Spouses of Service Members and Veterans (Families Serve Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to eligible veterans, spouses of an eligible service member, spouses of certain eligible veterans and eligible service members, and surviving spouses of deceased eligible veterans; and authorizing counties and municipalities to adopt a local law that allows for the application of a certain credit on a selection test for eligible spouses, eligible veterans, and certain spouses and surviving spouses.
bill_summary: The Families Serve Act authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to adopt laws that give hiring and promotion preferences to veterans, their spouses, and surviving spouses, including applying test score credits for these groups.
responsible_party: Counties and municipalities in Maryland, as they are authorized to adopt local laws implementing the preferences.
stakeholders: Veterans, spouses of veterans, surviving spouses of deceased veterans, and local government employment applicants in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for employment preferences are unlikely to have a significant direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law specifying certain limitations on awards or investments provided to certain small businesses under the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program by removing certain limitations on awards or investments to small businesses, allowing for greater flexibility and support for small businesses engaged in research and development, especially those involved in public health crisis response.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Commerce, specifically the Maryland Small Business Development Center and the Maryland Technology Development Corporation (TEDCO).
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland, particularly those involved in research and development, technology transfer, and public health crisis response.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce small business failure rates by increasing support and funding flexibility for innovative small businesses, especially in critical sectors.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; providing that the Executive Director serves as a nonvoting member of the Board, but may vote to break a tie; providing criteria for the awarding of grant and loan funding to include the creation or retention of at least 25 jobs, creation or retention of at least 10 jobs each with wages that exceed 120% of the State minimum wage, or creates significant population growth in the area in which the project is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and the Senator George C. Edwards Fund, including changes to membership, funding, and project criteria, to promote economic development and job creation in Western Maryland.
responsible_party: The Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and the Council for the Senator George C. Edwards Fund.
stakeholders: Businesses, local governments, and residents in Western Maryland seeking economic development and job opportunities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support economic development projects that could help small businesses grow and retain jobs, potentially reducing small business failures.

Title: Motor Vehicles – Rental Fleet Vehicles – Registration
Synopsis: Establishing an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue distinctive registration plates for rental vehicles registered under the alternative process; and requiring, in addition to an annual registration fee, the owner of a registered rental vehicle to pay a one-time initial registration fee not to exceed $8.50 when the new registration plates are issued.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles in Maryland, allowing owners of five or more rental vehicles to register their fleet under this process and receive distinctive registration plates.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Rental fleet vehicle owners and rental vehicle consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By simplifying registration and potentially reducing administrative costs, the program may help rental fleet businesses operate more efficiently, which could reduce failure rates.

Title: Transportation-Related Tolls - Installment Payment Plans
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to establish programs to offer installment payment plans for the payment of certain tolls, in excess of $300.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Authority and the Department of Transportation to establish income-based installment payment plans for paying tolls, civil penalties, and fines related to transportation violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals who owe tolls, civil penalties, and fines related to transportation violations in Maryland, especially those with financial difficulties.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets individual payers of tolls and fines, not small businesses, so its impact on small business failure rates is minimal.

Title: Land Use and Real Property - Accessory Dwelling Units - Requirements and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing the policy of the State to promote and encourage the creation of accessory dwelling units on land with a single-family detached dwelling unit as the primary dwelling unit in order to meet the housing needs of the citizens of the State; requiring, on or before October 1, 2026, the legislative body of certain counties or municipal corporations to adopt a local law authorizing the development of accessory dwelling units on land with certain single-family detached dwelling units subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties and municipal corporations to adopt laws allowing the development of accessory dwelling units (ADUs) on land zoned for single-family detached homes, with specific requirements for approval, fees, parking, and utility connections. It also prohibits restrictions on ADUs in property transfer instruments and allows homeowners associations to treat ADUs as separate lots for voting and assessments.
responsible_party: Local county and municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Homeowners and residents in Maryland, particularly those in single-family residential zones, and homeowners associations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions are focused on housing development and do not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Local Finance - Special Taxing Districts - Anne Arundel County Erosion Prevention Projects and Erosion Control Projects
Synopsis: Requiring interest earnings on money deposited for a certain taxing and assessment district to be credited to that district; specifying that a certain provision of law governing the petition process for the construction of an erosion prevention project or erosion control project in a certain district in Anne Arundel County does not apply to certain planning, permitting, or cost estimate activities; authorizing certain entities to use tax funds for upkeep or reconstruction of an existing shore erosion control project; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws related to erosion prevention and control projects in Maryland, specifically clarifying the handling of interest earnings on funds, the use of tax funds for maintenance, and certain procedural aspects for districts in Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: The governing body of each county, acting as the district council, is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Property owners and residents within districts that are involved in erosion prevention and control projects, especially in Anne Arundel County.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for funding and project management aim to streamline erosion control efforts, which could reduce costs and delays for small businesses involved in related projects, thereby potentially lowering failure rates.

Title: Prince George's County - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program - Cutting or Clearing Trees MC/PG 113-25
Synopsis: Providing that, in Prince George's County, to enforce a certain violation involving the clearing or cutting of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area, the Prince George's County Department of Permitting, Inspections, and Enforcement must record a lien on property that is the subject of the violation in a certain manner; establishing certain limits, prohibitions, requirements, and authorizations on actions certain local jurisdictions may take if a lien is not recorded as required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations in Prince George's County regarding the cutting or clearing of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area. It limits liability for current property owners who purchase land in good faith and have violations committed by previous owners, and requires the county to record liens and reimburse owners for enforcement costs. The bill also mandates the county to vacate certain enforcement actions for violations occurring before November 7, 2018.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Department of Permitting, Inspections, and Enforcement and the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Property owners, developers, environmental agencies, and residents in Prince George's County, especially those involved with land in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for vacating enforcement actions and reimbursing property owners aim to reduce financial and legal burdens on property owners, potentially decreasing small business failures related to land development and property management in the critical area.

Title: State Government - Equal Access to Public Services for Individuals With Limited English Proficiency and Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities to convene the Maryland Language Advisory Group, by January 1, 2026, to make findings and recommendations on oversight, monitoring, investigation, and enforcement of certain provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for certain individuals; altering provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency to include individuals with disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to develop and implement language access plans to ensure individuals with limited English proficiency and disabilities have equal access to public services. It establishes oversight, monitoring, and enforcement mechanisms, including the creation of an advisory group, and allocates funding for these efforts.
responsible_party: The Governor’s Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with limited English proficiency and individuals with disabilities in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on public service access and does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Temporary Telehealth Licenses - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary telehealth license to be issued by the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists authorizing the holder to provide clinical professional counseling services only to a student attending an institution of higher education in the State if the student and out-of-state licensed professional counselor have a previously established relationship that has existed for at least 6 months; limiting the term of the temporary license to 6 months; and prohibiting the renewal of a temporary licensed issued under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes out-of-state licensed professional counselors to provide telehealth counseling services to students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education under specific conditions, establishing a temporary telehealth license process and regulations.
responsible_party: The State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education and out-of-state licensed professional counselors
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on telehealth licensing for counselors and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Maryland State Department of Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten - Analysis and Report (Mixed Delivery Model Viability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to convene a workgroup to conduct an analysis of the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system established under the Blueprint for Maryland's Future; and requiring the workgroup to submit a final report, by December 31, 2027, to the Accountability and Implementation Board and the General Assembly on any changes made by the Department in response to the recommendations in its interim report, and any additional recommendations for changes to the prekindergarten system; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to form a workgroup to analyze the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system, including policies, implementation, and opportunities for improvement, with reports due in 2026 and 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten providers, children, families, and child care organizations involved in the publicly funded prekindergarten system.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve the efficiency and equity of prekindergarten programs, which could help private providers and small child care businesses succeed by streamlining processes and increasing resources.

Title: Public Health - Report on Establishing a Directory of Home Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to submit a report on the feasibility of establishing and maintaining an online directory of home health care providers to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to report on the feasibility of creating an online directory of home health care providers in the state, including features to help individuals find providers based on specific criteria and support workforce development and emergency communication.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals seeking home health care services, home health care providers, residential service agencies, and related stakeholders in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support home health care providers and agencies by improving communication, recruitment, and workforce development, which could help reduce small business failure rates in this sector.

Title: Disability Services - Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a mobility aid; and requiring the Department of Disabilities to implement and administer the Program, request, apply for, and facilitate certain donations to the Program, study the impacts of the Program, and report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the Program on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a wheelchair or mobility aid, aiming to improve their independence and mobility.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals who require adapted vehicles for mobility, especially those with limited access to public transportation
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program may indirectly support small businesses involved in vehicle modifications and donations, but its primary focus is on individuals, so the impact on small business failure rates is likely minimal.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class MT (Movie Theater) License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class MT (movie theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Howard County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County to issue the license to the owner of a movie theater who holds a crowd control training certification; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain patrons at retail for on-premises consumption; and authorizing the Board to set certain limitations on and requirements for the license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class MT (movie theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Howard County, allowing movie theaters with a certain certification to sell alcohol to patrons during movie showings for on-premises consumption.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Howard County
stakeholders: Movie theater owners and patrons in Howard County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help movie theaters by providing a new revenue stream through alcohol sales, potentially increasing their financial stability.

Title: Baltimore City - AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Renaming the AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to be the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program; altering the duties of the Program to provide for the safe distribution of syringes and  hypodermic needles and account for the number of hypodermic needles and syringes exchanged and distributed by the Baltimore City Health Department; altering the membership and duties of the Program's oversight committee; altering the immunity provided to Program staff and participants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program in Baltimore City. It updates the duties, oversight, and confidentiality provisions of the program, including expanding its scope to include education, referrals to treatment, and data collection to evaluate its effectiveness in reducing HIV transmission among injecting drug users.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Health Department
stakeholders: Injecting drug users in Baltimore City, public health officials, community organizations, and healthcare providers involved in HIV prevention and treatment.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program is designed to reduce the spread of HIV among drug users, which can indirectly support small businesses by improving community health and stability. However, the bill does not specify a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Personnel - Paid Family and Medical Leave
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management and the governing body of a public institution of higher education adopt regulations governing paid family and medical leave benefits for Executive Branch employees; establishing certain parameters for the paid family and medical leave; authorizing, beginning July 1, 2026, Executive Branch employees to submit a request for paid family and medical leave in accordance with established procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes paid family and medical leave benefits for employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch, including regulations for requesting and granting leave, and sets parameters for leave duration and eligibility.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Budget and Management, along with the governing body of public institutions of higher education.
stakeholders: Employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch and public higher education institutions, and their families.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts state employees and does not directly target small businesses, so its potential to reduce small business failure is minimal.

Title: Medical Records - Notice of Destruction - Method
Synopsis: Requiring that notice of the destruction of medical records be provided by first-class mail or by e-mail, rather than by both methods; and providing that if notice is provided by e-mail and no response or delivery receipt is obtained from the e-mail address to which notice was provided, the health care provider shall provide notice via first-class mail at least 10 days before the date on which the record is to be destroyed.
bill_summary: The bill updates the process for notifying patients about the destruction of their medical records, requiring notification by either first-class mail or email, but not both, unless certain circumstances apply.
responsible_party: Health care providers and medical record custodians in Maryland.
stakeholders: Patients whose medical records are maintained by healthcare providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily concerns notification procedures for medical record destruction.

Title: Financial Institutions - Consumer Credit - Application of Licensing Requirements (Maryland Secondary Market Stability Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law governing the licensing of providers of certain financial services in the State do not apply to a certain trust that acquires or is assigned a certain mortgage loan under certain circumstances; establishing the Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and make recommendations on licensing requirements for persons that provide financial services in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies licensing exemptions for certain financial service providers, establishes a Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study licensing requirements, and makes related amendments to Maryland's financial institutions law.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Financial service providers, consumers, and residents of Maryland involved in mortgage and installment loan transactions.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's clarifications and study may streamline licensing processes, potentially reducing barriers for small financial businesses, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to change the names of certain grantees, alter the authorized uses of certain grants, and extend the termination date of certain grants.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes various grants and funding for infrastructure, community projects, healthcare facilities, educational institutions, and cultural centers across Maryland, with specific focus on projects that include construction, renovation, and capital improvements. It extends the duration of some grants and modifies prior authorizations of state debt.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Department of Transportation, Maryland Department of Health, University System of Maryland, and other local agencies and authorities.
stakeholders: Local communities, healthcare providers, educational institutions, cultural organizations, and residents across Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides funding for community development, infrastructure, and facilities which can support local economies and small businesses, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Wicomico County Board of Education - Election of Members, Student Member, and Compensation
Synopsis: Altering, beginning with the general election in 2026, the districts from which certain members of the Wicomico County Board of Education are elected; adding at least one student member from the 11th or 12th grade in good standing and regularly enrolled in the public school system to the county board for purposes of advising the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students in the County public schools; and providing that the members of the county board are entitled to certain compensation and reimbursement.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the election districts for the Wicomico County Board of Education, adds at least one student member to the board, and sets compensation and reimbursement rules for board members.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of Education and Wicomico County Council
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Wicomico County who are affected by the school board's decisions and representation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering Facilities - Request for Relocation
Synopsis: Authorizing certain sports wagering facility licensees to submit a written request to the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to relocate the sports wagering facility if the facility was originally issued a Class B sports wagering facility license on or before September 30, 2023, and the new location is in the same county, complies with certain location requirements, and is approved by the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain sports wagering facility licensees in Maryland to submit requests to relocate their facilities within the same county, subject to specific conditions and approvals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering facility operators and patrons in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small business sports wagering operators by allowing them to relocate their facilities more easily, potentially reducing operational disruptions and failure risk.

Title: Barbers and Cosmetologists - License Qualifications - Domestic Violence Awareness Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists, beginning October 1, 2025, to require as a condition for licensure and initial renewal of a license an applicant or a licensee to complete certain training in domestic violence awareness; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to approve certain domestic violence awareness training that is offered in person and virtually, includes guidance on certain topics, and has a duration of at least 1 hour; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists to mandate domestic violence awareness training as a qualification for licensing and license renewal for barbers and cosmetologists, including specific training content and a one-hour free training program developed by the Department of Labor.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, State Board of Barbers, State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Barbers, cosmetologists, and their clients in Maryland, especially victims of domestic violence
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program aims to improve awareness and support for domestic violence victims, which can contribute to a safer environment for small businesses in the personal care industry, potentially reducing failure related to legal or social issues.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain nonpublic institutions of higher education to submit a certain letter of intent regarding intended new graduate level programs to the Maryland Higher Education Commission in a certain manner and every 6 months; repealing a provision of law that required the Commission to circulate certain letters of intent; repealing a certain provision of law that limited which institutions of higher education could propose or implement certain academic programs for certain graduate level programs under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the process for approving new graduate programs at higher education institutions in Maryland, including requiring institutions to submit letters of intent every 6 months for proposed programs, and updates the criteria and procedures for program approval, especially for emerging workforce need programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, and industries in Maryland seeking new graduate programs
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on higher education program approval and workforce planning, not directly on small business failure reduction.

Title: Real Property - Holding Over - Expedited Hearing and Service of Summons for Active Duty Service Members
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to hold a hearing on a tenant holding over within 45 days after a landlord makes a complaint if the landlord or the landlord's spouse is on active duty with the United States military; and authorizing a private process server to serve a certain summons if the constable or sheriff of the county fails to serve the summons within 10 days after the summons is issued by the court.
bill_summary: The bill expedites court hearings and service procedures for tenants holding over in cases where the landlord or landlord's spouse is on active military duty, and clarifies notice requirements for terminating tenancies.
responsible_party: District Court of Maryland and law enforcement (constables or sheriffs)
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, and active military service members in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts residential tenants and landlords, with a focus on active military members, and does not directly target small business failure.

Title: Real Property - Wrongful Detainer - Time of Hearing and Service of Process
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to wrongful detainer actions, including requirements for summonses, hearing, and judgments.
bill_summary: The bill criminalizes possessing or claiming rights to residential real property without lawful ownership or possession with intent to defraud, establishing penalties for violations. It also modifies procedures for wrongful detainer actions, including summons, hearings, and appeals, to expedite the process of removing unlawful occupants.
responsible_party: Maryland District Courts and Sheriffs' Offices
stakeholders: Property owners of residential real estate and individuals unlawfully occupying such properties
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets criminal conduct related to property fraud and streamlines legal procedures for property owners, which could reduce losses and legal costs associated with wrongful occupancy, indirectly supporting small property owners and landlords.

Title: Department of General Services - Identification Cards - Veteran Status Notation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of General Services to include a notation on a certain identification card indicating that the holder is a veteran under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to obtain the consent of a certain holder of an identification card before transmitting certain information to a certain executive agency; and prohibiting the Department from transmitting certain information obtained on an application for an identification card except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of General Services to include a veteran status notation on identification cards issued to state employees and other authorized individuals, and establishes procedures for obtaining consent to share veteran status information with executive agencies.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Veterans who are state employees or authorized individuals, and state agencies that may access veteran status information.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it could indirectly impact veteran employment and benefits, which may influence small business success.

Title: Funeral Establishments, Crematories, and Reduction Facilities - Disposition of Unclaimed Remains - Veterans
Synopsis: Requiring a licensed funeral establishment, crematory operator, or reduction facility to take certain actions if a certain veterans service organization does not take possession of certain unclaimed cremains, hydrolyzed remains, or soil remains that qualify for a plot in a veterans cemetery within a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill requires funeral establishments, crematories, and reduction facilities to notify veterans service organizations about unclaimed remains of veterans or their dependents after 90 days, and to transfer such remains to these organizations if they are identified as veterans' remains. If the veterans' service organization does not take possession within 10 days, the remains are to be transferred to the Department of Veterans and Military Families for proper disposition.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans and their families, funeral establishments, crematories, reduction facilities, and veterans service organizations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions could streamline the process for handling unclaimed remains, potentially reducing legal and logistical issues for funeral and cremation businesses, thereby possibly decreasing small business failure rates.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing health occupations boards to include a notation indicating veteran status on a license, certificate, registration, or public profile.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes health occupations boards in Maryland to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on licenses, certificates, or registrations, and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Health Occupations Boards in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans seeking health occupation licenses and certifications in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily involves administrative procedures related to veteran status notation.

Title: Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to be the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr. Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr., Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program, in honor of the long-serving Maryland Senate President, and continues to fund the program through the Chesapeake Bay Trust.
responsible_party: Chesapeake Bay Trust and Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental conservation volunteers, citizens involved in energy and natural resource projects across Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on environmental and conservation programs and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Law - Animal Abuse or Neglect - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of the prohibition against abusing or neglecting an animal that results in the death of a domestic animal or livestock or the need to euthanize the domestic animal or livestock; providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to $5,000 or both; and authorizing a court to impost certain conditions of sentencing and probation.
bill_summary: The bill enhances penalties for animal abuse or neglect that results in the death or euthanasia of an animal, including prohibiting offenders from owning or residing with animals for a period of time and allowing courts to impose conditions of sentencing and probation.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies responsible for enforcing animal cruelty laws.
stakeholders: Animals, animal owners, and the general public concerned with animal welfare.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; its focus is on animal cruelty penalties.

Title: Department of the Environment - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment to establish a certain process in collaboration with one or more boards under the Department's direction and control that requires a board to include a notation indicating veteran status on a professional license or certificate.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on professional licenses or certificates issued by the department, and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and relevant licensing boards under its control.
stakeholders: Veterans applying for or holding professional licenses or certificates in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could potentially help veteran entrepreneurs and professionals by making it easier for them to access benefits and recognition, which may support their business stability.

Title: Election Law - Absentee Ballots - Notice to Request Application
Synopsis: Requiring the local board of elections to send a written notice regarding a request for a State-approved absentee ballot application with a specimen ballot and any other mailings to voters and eligible voters to further awareness of the option of mail-in voting, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to include written notices on how to request an absentee ballot with certain mailings to voters at least 60 days before each statewide primary election, unless the voter has permanent absentee ballot status or other exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local election boards
stakeholders: Eligible voters in Maryland, especially those interested in absentee voting
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it focuses on election procedures.

Title: Boating Accidents - Reporting Requirement - Property Damage
Synopsis: Specifying that property damage that results from an accident that involves any vessel subject to the State Boat Act while on the waters of the State includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers for purposes of a certain reporting requirement.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify that property damage resulting from boating accidents includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers, and sets reporting requirements for such accidents involving vessels.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators, boat owners, and the general public using Maryland waters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal as it primarily clarifies reporting requirements for boating accidents.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - School Boards - Compliance Certification
Synopsis: Requiring each school board to certify to the State Ethics Commission, on or before October 1 each year, that the school board is in compliance with certain requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law.
bill_summary: The bill requires each school board in Maryland to annually certify to the State Ethics Commission that it is in compliance with the Maryland Public Ethics Law, including members, officials, and employees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission and school boards
stakeholders: School boards, school officials, employees, and students in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Licenses - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a certain process to include a notation of veteran status on an occupational license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes units within the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on occupational licenses and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans' benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Veterans applying for occupational licenses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help veterans more easily access licensing and benefits, potentially reducing barriers to employment and small business success for veteran entrepreneurs.

Title: Boating Accidents - Duty to Stop at the Scene, Render Assistance, and Provide Information - Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty stop the vessel as close as possible to the scene of the collision, accident, or casualty until the operator has rendered certain assistance and provided certain information; establishing certain criminal penalties for the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty who does not take certain actions in violation of the Act of imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $500 or both; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires vessel operators involved in collisions or accidents resulting in injury or death to stop near the scene, render assistance, and provide their information. It establishes penalties for failing to do so and mandates reporting of accidents to the Department of Natural Resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators, boaters, and individuals involved in boating accidents in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on boating accident procedures and penalties, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Member Appointments - Advice and Consent of the Senate
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor appoint members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers with the advice and consent of the Senate.
bill_summary: The bill amends the process for appointing members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers, requiring the Governor to appoint members with the advice and consent of the Senate.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Department of Business Occupations and Professions, specifically the State Board of Stationary Engineers.
stakeholders: Stationary engineers, boiler industry representatives, boiler owners, consumers, and the Chief Boiler Inspector in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by involving industry representatives and boiler owners, it may indirectly support industry stability.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Task Force and Special Fund
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2028 distributions by the Comptroller from funds gained from abandoned property in the State to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; altering the staff and duties of the Access to Counsel in Evictions Task Force; and extending through fiscal year 2028 an annual $14,000,000 appropriation by the Governor from the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies funding and programs related to providing legal counsel in eviction proceedings in Maryland. It establishes a special fund for access to counsel, allocates funds from abandoned property proceeds, and sets up a task force to evaluate and improve access to legal representation for tenants facing eviction.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC) and the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, tenant advocacy groups, legal service providers, landlords, and community organizations in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on tenant legal services and eviction proceedings, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Agriculture - Departmental Authority Over Identification, Inspection, and Sale of Cantaloupes - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Maryland Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes, effectively removing regulatory oversight in this area.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Cantaloupe growers, sellers, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could reduce regulatory burdens on cantaloupe businesses, potentially lowering failure rates for small businesses involved in cantaloupe sales.

Title: Health – General Article – References to Mental Health
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental hygiene with references to mental health in certain provisions of law governing public health; establishing that, by July 1, 2027, the Department of Health shall conduct a thorough review of Department regulations and adopt regulations to ensure consistency with the Act; and requiring the Department to update all public-facing electronic materials to be consistent with the Act as soon as practicable.
bill_summary: The bill updates legal references from 'mental hygiene' to 'mental health' in Maryland law, establishes a fund for community-based mental health services, and requires the Department of Health to review and update regulations and materials to reflect this change.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health needs, mental health service providers, and the general public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the establishment of community-based services and related funding could indirectly support local mental health service providers and associated small businesses.

Title: Confined Aquatic Disposal Cells - Construction - Moratorium
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from processing or making any recommendation on a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029; and prohibiting the Board of Public Works from approving a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill imposes a moratorium on the construction and approval of confined aquatic disposal cells within 5 miles of residential overburdened communities in Maryland from June 1, 2025, to May 31, 2029.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Residents of residential overburdened communities near proposed disposal sites, environmental agencies, and small businesses involved in dredging and disposal activities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The moratorium may temporarily limit opportunities for small businesses involved in dredging and disposal projects near these communities, potentially reducing failure risks during the moratorium period.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust - Board of Trustees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include the Secretary of Disabilities or the Secretary's designee.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees to include the Secretary of Disabilities as an ex officio member.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees and the Maryland Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, organizations serving veterans, and the disability community
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on the composition of the Veterans Trust Board and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of  incarcerated individuals when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole, including providing for a meeting between the incarcerated individual and the Commission; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by older incarcerated individuals; requiring the Commission to report yearly to the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board on the outcomes of certain parole considerations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the Maryland parole process by requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of incarcerated individuals, especially those who are elderly or medically incapacitated, when determining parole eligibility. It introduces procedures for medical parole requests, including meetings and risk assessments, and establishes specific criteria for geriatric parole for individuals over 60 or 65 years old with long sentences. The bill also allocates savings from reduced incarceration to support parole and reentry programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Elderly and medically incapacitated incarcerated individuals, the Maryland criminal justice system, and the community safety stakeholders.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but the allocation of savings from reduced incarceration may indirectly support community and economic development initiatives.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program - Eligibility - Family Members of Veterans
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include a spouse or dependent of an eligible veteran.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include spouses and dependents of eligible veterans, and establishes a fund to support training and therapy services involving service dogs, support dogs, and therapy horses for veterans and their families.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs (or the Department) is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland and their family members, including spouses and dependents.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The program provides funding to nonprofit training entities that train service animals and therapy horses, which could help these organizations succeed and reduce their failure rate.

Title: Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to be the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans; and providing that the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans is the successor of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans, and clarifies that the successor board assumes all powers, obligations, and responsibilities of the original board.
responsible_party: The Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans
stakeholders: State employees and teachers participating in the Maryland State Employees and Teachers Supplemental Retirement Plans
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or include programs aimed at reducing small business failures.

Title: Property Tax - Deadline to Set County and Municipal Corporation Tax Rates - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering, from July 1 to June 20, the deadline by which the governing body of a county or municipal corporation is required to set its property tax rate for the next taxable year.
bill_summary: The bill changes the deadline for counties and municipal corporations in Maryland to set their property tax rates for the next taxable year, moving it from July 1 to June 1.
responsible_party: County and municipal governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: County and municipal residents and property owners in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects local government tax setting deadlines and does not directly impact small business failure rates.
