Title: Drunk and Drug-Impaired Driving and Failure to Remain at the Scene - Revocation of Driver's License
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to revoke the driver's license of a person who has been convicted of impaired driving that contributes to an accident, or fails to remain at the scene of an accident, that results in the death or life-threatening injury to another person; and authorizing a person whose driver's license is revoked under the Act or for homicide by motor vehicle while impaired to apply for license reinstatement after a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the revocation of a driver's license for individuals convicted of or granted probation for impaired driving that causes death or serious injury, or for failing to remain at the scene of an accident resulting in death or life-threatening injury. It also establishes procedures for license reinstatement after revocation and requires participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program for certain offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (MVA)
stakeholders: Drivers convicted of impaired driving or hit-and-run offenses, and the general driving public in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on driver license revocations and reinstatements related to serious driving offenses, and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Revisions
Synopsis: Extending the time period from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2026, during which a holder of a certain cannabis dispensary license may continue to deliver medical cannabis; limiting application submissions for on-site consumption licenses to social equity applicants under certain circumstances; authorizing a political subdivision to establish hours of operation for on-site consumption establishments; providing that a certain food sales exemption from the sales and use tax does not apply to the sale of certain cannabinoid beverages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's cannabis laws by extending medical cannabis delivery, establishing regulations for on-site consumption establishments, authorizing cannabis events and vendor permits, and setting licensing and zoning rules for cannabis businesses.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis consumers, cannabis businesses, social equity applicants, local governments, and event organizers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill includes provisions to support social equity applicants and small cannabis businesses, which could help reduce their failure rates.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Payment From Uninsured Employers' Fund - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Worker's Compensation Commission to offset or credit against an award certain benefits paid by the Uninsured Employer's Fund; requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to make the Fund a party to a claim filed against an uninsured employer; authorizing a covered employee or the dependents of a covered employee to apply to the Director of the Fund for payment from the Fund;  requiring the Fund to pay certain additional awards under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the procedures and responsibilities related to the Uninsured Employers' Fund in Maryland's workers' compensation system, including how benefits are paid, how claims are processed, and the rights of employees and the Fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers’ Compensation Commission and the Uninsured Employers’ Fund
stakeholders: Employees who are injured and their dependents, uninsured employers, and the Maryland Workers’ Compensation Commission
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to clarify and streamline the process for claims and payments involving uninsured employers, which could reduce delays and financial uncertainties for small businesses.

Title: Limited Line Credit Insurance - Qualification of Applicants
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to programs of instruction for applicants for certain limited lines credit insurance licenses; and requiring the insurer that provides the program of instruction to retain records relating to the program of instruction while in use and for a period of at least 5 years after its last use.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland insurance law to modify requirements for instruction programs for applicants seeking limited lines credit insurance licenses, including record-keeping and program design standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Applicants for limited lines credit insurance licenses and the insurance companies providing instruction programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on improving instruction and record-keeping for license applicants may help ensure better qualified applicants, potentially reducing small business failures related to licensing issues.

Title: State Government - Public Employee Relations Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the condition that must be met for a certain exclusive representative to meet with a new employee by video or similar technology; altering certain requirements for the deputy directors appointed by the Public Employee Relations Board; and altering certain procedures regarding the timing of exclusive representation elections.
bill_summary: The bill makes several changes to Maryland's Public Employee Relations Act, including allowing new employees to meet with their representatives via video if public health concerns require remote meetings, clarifying the conditions under which employee membership dues deductions can be revoked, and altering procedures for labor relations and elections involving public employees.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board
stakeholders: Public employees and their employee organizations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects public employee organizations and their interactions with employees, with no direct provisions targeting small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Department of the Environment - Fees, Penalties, Funding, and Regulation
Synopsis: Altering the authorized uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund to include certain activities relating to mitigating and reducing air pollution in the State; authorizing the Department of the Environment to charge a fee for processing and issuing on-site sewage disposal permits and individual well construction permits under certain circumstances; requiring a holder of a license to transfer oil into the State to pay a certain fee when oil owned by the licensee is first transferred into the State; establishing the Private Dam Repair Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to environmental funding, fees, and regulations in Maryland, including altering the uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund, establishing a Private Dam Repair Fund, and setting fees for permits, registration, and dam safety. It also introduces new programs for dam safety, private dam repair loans, and updates penalties and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, private dam owners, permit holders, local governments, and residents affected by air pollution, water pollution, and dam safety issues.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to streamline and clarify fee structures and funding mechanisms, which could help small businesses by reducing regulatory uncertainty and providing financial assistance for dam repairs and environmental compliance.

Title: Controlled Hazardous Substance Facility Permit - Research Facilities - Chemical Warfare Material Requirements
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding chemical warfare material requirements under a controlled hazardous substance facility permit do not apply to the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a certain research facility if the incineration is done for research, development, or demonstration purposes; and establishing additional requirements applicable to research, development, and demonstration permits issued for the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a research facility.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations and permit requirements for the incineration of chemical warfare materials at research facilities in Maryland, including safety, monitoring, and emergency preparedness standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Research facilities handling chemical warfare materials, local communities near such facilities, and environmental and public health agencies.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's detailed permit and safety requirements could impact the operational costs and compliance burden for research facilities, potentially influencing their success, but it primarily aims to ensure safety rather than directly reduce small business failure.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Election Plan Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to submit an election plan to the State Board of Elections for approval at least 7 months before each statewide primary election; establishing requirements related to an election plan; and altering the requirements related to polling place plans, ballot drop box plans, and early voting center plans.
bill_summary: The bill requires local boards of elections in Maryland to submit detailed election plans, including polling place, ballot drop box, and early voting center plans, to the State Board of Elections for approval at least 7 months before each statewide primary election. It also establishes requirements for the planning, notification, and public participation processes related to election site changes and early voting centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, including historically disenfranchised communities, and local election officials.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but by improving election planning and accessibility, it may indirectly support local businesses involved in election logistics and services.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Employees of an Office of a Sheriff
Synopsis: Providing that an employee of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City is immune from liability under the Maryland Tort Claims Act in the same manner as a sheriff or deputy sheriff.
bill_summary: The bill extends the immunity from liability under the Maryland Tort Claims Act to employees of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City, similar to the immunity already granted to sheriffs and deputy sheriffs.
responsible_party: The Maryland State Government, specifically the Maryland Tort Claims Act and the Office of the Sheriff.
stakeholders: Employees of sheriff offices, sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, and the general public served by sheriff offices.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Hours of Operation Violations - Civil Penalties
Synopsis: Establishing for a first offense by a holder of an alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City of operating the licensed premises outside specified hours of operation without obtaining a certain exemption a fine of not less than $1,000 or suspension of the license or both, and for a second or subsequent offense a fine of not less than $2,000 and not more than $20,000 or suspension of the license or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil penalties for licensed alcohol establishments in Baltimore City that operate outside their permitted hours without an exemption, including fines and license suspensions for violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders in Baltimore City, including restaurants, bars, pharmacies, and hotels
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's penalties could incentivize compliance, potentially reducing violations that might lead to license suspension or loss, thereby supporting small business stability.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act - Reports of Attorney General - Frequency
Synopsis: Altering from each month to every 6 months the frequency with which the Attorney General is required to report to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge; and requiring the Attorney General to pursue all available options, including filing actions against the applicable parties, to recover all possible economic damages arising from the Port closure and the Bridge collapse.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Attorney General to pursue all options to recover economic damages from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge and the closure of the Port of Baltimore, and to report on the progress every six months until recovery is complete.
responsible_party: Maryland Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: State of Maryland, residents, businesses affected by the Port closure and bridge collapse
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to recover damages that could support economic stability, potentially reducing small business failures related to the incidents.

Title: Financial Institutions and Activities - Virtual Currency Kiosks - Registration and Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing registration and operating requirements for a virtual currency kiosk operator to operate a virtual currency kiosk in the State; authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to investigate and enforce the Act in a certain manner; and authorizing the Commissioner to assess against a virtual currency kiosk operator a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 for each knowing and willful violation  of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes registration, operational, and regulatory requirements for virtual currency kiosks and their operators in Maryland, including registration procedures, transaction limits, disclosure requirements, and enforcement powers for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Virtual currency kiosk operators and users in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a clear regulatory framework which can help small businesses operating virtual currency kiosks to comply with laws, potentially reducing failures due to legal issues.

Title: Election Law – Chief Election Judges – Party Affiliation
Synopsis: Requiring the election director of a local board of elections to designate chief election judges from certain political parties to each polling place except under certain circumstances; and requiring an election director who is unable to designate chief judges for a polling place at least 45 days before the start of early voting to make a certain designation in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill requires local election boards to designate chief election judges from certain political parties at each polling place, with specific rules for circumstances where party designation is not possible.
responsible_party: Local boards of elections in Maryland
stakeholders: Voters and political parties participating in Maryland elections
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Department of Veterans and Military Families - Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program in the Department of Veterans and Military Families to expand certain services to include service members and their families; and requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to submit an annual report by December 1 each year to the Governor and the General Assembly that includes a general assessment of communication methods utilized in support of the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to establish and maintain an online registry to provide veterans, military families, and interested individuals with information about available services, benefits, and news. It also expands the department's outreach and communication efforts to better inform and assist veterans and service members.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, active duty service members, military families, and interested individuals in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on veterans and military families, with no direct provisions targeting small business failure reduction.

Title: Education - Youth Suicide Prevention School Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to increase pupil awareness of the relationship between gambling and youth suicide.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to include increased awareness of the link between gambling and youth suicide, and emphasizes recognizing behavioral health issues, trauma, and violence among students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, educators, and community mental health providers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates; it focuses on youth suicide prevention and gambling awareness.

Title: Natural Resources - Canada Geese - Bag Limits
Synopsis: Requiring, during the migratory Canada goose (Atlantic population) hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of  the State, including geese found in the Atlantic Flyway Resident Population Hunt Zone and the Atlantic Population Hunt Zone, to conform to the bag limit for Atlantic population Canada geese adopted annually by the Department of the Interior's U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
bill_summary: The bill requires that during the migratory Canada goose hunting season in certain areas of Maryland, the bag limit for all Canada geese must match the annual bag limit set by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, aligning state regulations with federal standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland, particularly those involved in migratory bird hunting.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily concerns wildlife regulation and hunting limits.

Title: Baltimore County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Highway Administration to place and use not more than four speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County subject to notice requirements; requiring that fines collected in Baltimore County as a result of violations enforced by speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 be used to recover costs and assist in covering the cost of roadway and safety improvements on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Highway Administration to install and operate speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County, with fines collected used to fund roadway and safety improvements. It also establishes procedures for issuing civil citations for speeding violations recorded by these systems, including training, calibration, and oversight requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Baltimore County, especially those near Interstate 695 and Interstate 83, as well as small businesses involved in transportation and safety improvements.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for using fines to fund roadway and safety improvements could improve transportation infrastructure, potentially reducing small business failures related to transportation issues.

Title: Baltimore City - Raffles - Organizations Affiliated With a Professional Major League Baseball Team
Synopsis: Authorizing certain organizations that are affiliated with a professional major league baseball team that plays its home games in Baltimore City to conduct certain raffles; requiring the organization to obtain a permit to conduct raffles from an agency designated by the Baltimore City government; providing that a permit to hold certain raffles expires at the end of the calendar year in which the permit was issued; requiring that raffle tickets are sold using age-verification measures to ensure the buyer is at least 18; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams that play in Baltimore City to conduct raffles at games, with specific regulations including permit requirements, age verification, and geographic restrictions on electronic sales.
responsible_party: Designated City Agency in Baltimore City
stakeholders: Organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams in Baltimore City and their supporters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a regulated framework for raffles, which can support small organizations and charities, potentially reducing their failure rates by enabling fundraising activities.

Title: Revenge Porn - Definition of Visual Representation and Civil Action
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to bring and maintain a civil action for defamation against another who distributes a computer-generated visual representation that is indistinguishable from an actual visual representation of the person and is of a sexual or intimate nature; and prohibiting a person from knowingly distributing a certain computer-generated visual representation of another under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill defines and criminalizes the distribution of computer-generated visual representations of individuals that depict them with exposed intimate parts or engaged in sexual activity without consent, and provides civil remedies for victims. It also establishes procedures for handling such visual representations in court records.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Individuals whose visual representations are distributed without consent, victims of revenge porn, and the general public.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on criminal and civil actions related to revenge porn, not on small business support or failure reduction.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality - Nursing Home Inspections - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health, on request of a county, to delegate to the county the authority to conduct surveys and complaint investigations of nursing homes; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to execute a certain memorandum of understanding with a requesting county within 90 days; and requiring that the Maryland Department of Health and counties equally share the costs of conducting surveys delegated by the Secretary of Health.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Health to delegate authority to conduct nursing home inspections and investigations to counties upon request, establishes procedures for surveys and complaint investigations, and requires reporting on inspection activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Nursing homes, residents, and local health agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for shared costs and delegation of inspection authority aim to streamline operations and reduce administrative burdens, potentially lowering the risk of nursing home failures.

Title: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission - Review of Report and Recommendations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a certain report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General; and requiring the Commission to make any recommendations that the Commission determines are appropriate based on its review of the report.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General and to make appropriate recommendations based on that review.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, the Office of the Attorney General, and the public interested in police accountability and transparency.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Public Safety Officer - Performance of Duties - Death Benefits
Synopsis: Altering circumstances under which certain individuals are presumed to have died as a direct and proximate result of an injury sustained in the performance of duties for purposes of eligibility for death benefits.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the death and disability benefits for public safety officers in Maryland, including presuming certain deaths from heart attack or stroke as duty-related, adjusting benefit amounts for inflation, and allowing 9-1-1 specialists to be eligible for death benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety officers, including law enforcement, firefighters, emergency medical technicians, 9-1-1 specialists, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts public safety officers and their families, with no direct provisions affecting small business failure rates.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Overhead Transmission Lines
Synopsis: Exempting certain areas in the Big Savage Mountain Wildland, Bear Pen Wildland, and Dan's Mountain Wildland from being designated as a wildland area, subject to a certificate of public convenience and necessity being obtained for a certain transmission line; and requiring the Public Service Commission to require an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and necessity for the construction of a certain overhead transmission line to provide wildland impact mitigation guarantees.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain wildland areas in Maryland from being designated as wildlands if a certificate of public convenience and necessity is obtained for overhead transmission lines, and requires mitigation guarantees and land management plans to minimize environmental impact.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Environmental conservation agencies, local communities near wildland areas, and utility companies constructing transmission lines
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on environmental and land use impacts related to transmission lines, not directly on small business failure rates.

Title: Environment - Coal Combustion By-Products - Fees, Coordinating Committee, and Regulations
Synopsis: Altering the factors that the Department of the Environment is required to consider in establishing a certain fee; requiring the Department to use certain excess fees collected from certain generators of coal combustion by-products for certain purposes; establishing the Statewide Coal Combustion By-Products Coordinating Committee to share information, monitoring results, and certain remedial actions with respect to certain coal combustion by-product sites; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a minimum fee for coal combustion by-product generators, creates a statewide committee to monitor and share information on coal by-products, and mandates the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations aligning with federal guidelines to regulate coal combustion by-products in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Coal combustion by-product generators, environmental agencies, public health organizations, and communities near coal by-product sites.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on regulation, monitoring, and beneficial reuse of coal by-products aims to reduce environmental and health risks, which could help small businesses involved in these activities by providing clearer guidelines and support.

Title: Registered Apprenticeship Investments for a Stronger Economy (RAISE) Act
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Maryland Apprenticeship and Training Council; repealing the Youth Apprenticeship Advisory Committee; establishing the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development to scale registered apprenticeships across industries and occupations to meet the needs of the State's economy; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program within the Maryland Department of Labor; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a comprehensive framework to promote registered apprenticeships in Maryland, including waivers for licensing exams for qualified individuals, creation of new programs and advisory boards, and funding mechanisms such as incentive pay and grants to support apprenticeship development and participation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning, Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development, and the Maryland Apprenticeship and Training Program.
stakeholders: Employers, apprentices, workforce development organizations, and industries seeking skilled workers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides financial incentives, technical assistance, and streamlined licensing processes to support small businesses in training apprentices, which can help reduce business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Records – Expungement and Maryland Judiciary Case Search (Expungement Reform Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to waiting periods for the filing of certain petitions for expungement to authorize the filing of a petition a certain amount of time after the completion of the sentence; adding to the list of misdemeanor convictions that a person may expunge under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from in any way referring to the existence of a charge of possession of cannabis if the conviction was later pardoned by the Governor; etc.
bill_summary: The Expungement Reform Act of 2025 modifies Maryland laws regarding the expungement of criminal records, including reducing waiting periods, expanding the list of misdemeanors eligible for expungement, and prohibiting the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from referencing certain records, especially those related to cannabis possession and cases with specific outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary, specifically the Maryland Judiciary Case Search and the courts responsible for expungement proceedings.
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records seeking expungement, particularly those with misdemeanor convictions and cases involving cannabis possession.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts individuals seeking expungement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Trafficking Regulated Firearms - Felony Classification
Synopsis: Requiring that the prosecution for an offense of trafficking a regulated firearm be instituted within 3 years after the offense was committed; reclassifying the prohibition against transporting a regulated firearm into the State for the purpose of unlawfully selling or trafficking the firearm to be a felony; and establishing a penalty on conviction of imprisonment of up to 10 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill alters the statute of limitations for prosecuting trafficking of regulated firearms and reclassifies the unlawful transportation of regulated firearms into Maryland as a felony, increasing penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, firearm traffickers, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Security Guard Agencies - Special Police Officers - Application for Appointment
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain security guard agency to apply for the appointment of special police officers in order to protect property owned or leased by the security guard agency's clients.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes security guard agencies in Maryland to apply for the appointment of special police officers to protect property owned or leased by their clients, expanding the circumstances under which such officers can be appointed.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission and the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Security guard agencies, property owners, clients of security agencies, and the general public in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By allowing security guard agencies to appoint special police officers, the bill could help these agencies better protect their property and operations, potentially reducing business failures related to security issues.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenant Modifications - County or Municipality Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Altering notice requirements relating to the recordation of a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant by authorizing a county or municipality to provide notice by publication in one or more newspapers of general circulation in the county or municipality where the property is located once per week for 4 successive weeks and on the official website of a county or municipality where the property is located.
bill_summary: The bill modifies notice requirements for counties and municipalities in Maryland when they record modifications to unlawfully restrictive covenants on properties, allowing for more streamlined correction of discriminatory restrictions.
responsible_party: County or municipal government agencies responsible for recording property restrictions and modifications.
stakeholders: Property owners, residents, and communities within Maryland affected by restrictive covenants.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on property restrictions and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Home Builders - New Home Sales - Notice of Appliance Warranty Registration
Synopsis: Requiring a person registered to build a new home to provide at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home information about the warranties for appliances registered by the person, including the date of the warranty registration and the time remaining under the warranty.
bill_summary: The bill requires home builders registered to build new homes in Maryland to provide specific warranty information about appliances, including HVAC systems, at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Business Regulation, specifically the Home Builders section.
stakeholders: Home buyers of new homes in Maryland and home builders registered to construct new homes.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's impact on small business failure rates is minimal, as it primarily mandates information disclosure rather than financial or operational support.

Title: Prince George's County - Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law - Video Evidence and Reward Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing a member of the public to submit video evidence of an alleged violation of the Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law to a certain enforcement unit; requiring the program to allow a member of the public to receive a portion of fines collected in relation to the violation; and authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to refer unpaid fines to the Central Collection Unit of the Department of Budget and Management for collection.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing the public to submit video evidence of illegal dumping and litter violations, with rewards for evidence leading to convictions. It also details how fines collected from violations are to be used, including funding the program and litter control efforts.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government and enforcement units
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, environmental groups, local businesses, and individuals involved in litter control and enforcement
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on litter enforcement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Business Occupations and Professions - Professional Engineers - Examination
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice engineering to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering given by the State Board for Professional Engineers before passing the required examination in the principles and practice of engineering.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for a professional engineering license in Maryland to pass the Fundamentals of Engineering exam before taking the Principles and Practice of Engineering exam, and clarifies credit for work experience based on education.
responsible_party: State Board for Professional Engineers
stakeholders: Aspiring and current professional engineers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts engineering licensure requirements and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Public Safety - Police Accountability - Time Limit for Filing Administrative Charges
Synopsis: Altering the deadline for the completion of the process of review by a certain investigating unit through disposition by an administrative charging committee under certain circumstances; requiring a law enforcement agency to file any administrative charges arising out of an investigation of alleged police officer misconduct that is not required to be reviewed by an administrative charging committee within 1 year and 1 day after the date that the appropriate official employed by the law enforcement agency became aware of the incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the deadlines for law enforcement agencies and administrative charging committees to complete reviews and file administrative charges related to police misconduct investigations, especially when criminal activity is involved.
responsible_party: Law enforcement agencies and administrative charging committees in Maryland
stakeholders: Police officers, law enforcement agencies, and members of the public involved in police misconduct investigations
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to study the pooling of public employee health insurance purchasing between the State, counties, municipal corporations, and county boards of education in the State to maximize value and efficiency while maintaining a broad package of benefits and reasonable premiums for public employees; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to analyze the potential benefits of pooling public employee health insurance purchasing across the State, counties, and educational entities, with the goal of increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public employees, State agencies, counties, municipal corporations, and educational institutions in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill focuses on public employee health insurance pooling and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Authority to Impose on Vacant and Abandoned Property Owned by Nonprofit Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of certain property that is owned by a nonprofit organization that has been vacant and has not been significantly improved for at least 5 consecutive years and to set a special property tax rate for that property.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to establish a special property tax rate for vacant and abandoned properties owned by nonprofit organizations that have not been used or significantly improved for 3 to 5 years, and to impose a higher tax rate on such properties to encourage reuse and redevelopment.
responsible_party: The Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations owning vacant or abandoned properties in Baltimore City, and the community benefiting from property redevelopment
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets nonprofit organizations and vacant property management, with indirect effects on small businesses through property revitalization; it does not directly aim to reduce small business failure.

Title: State Government - Maryland Reparations Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and make recommendations relating to appropriate benefits to be made to individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in the State or were impacted by certain inequitable government policies; and requiring the Commission to submit a preliminary report by January 1, 2027, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and recommend benefits for individuals impacted by historical inequality, including descendants of enslaved people and those affected by discriminatory government policies.
responsible_party: Maryland Reparations Commission, with assistance from State agencies and public institutions.
stakeholders: Individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in Maryland or impacted by inequitable government policies, including Black communities and descendants of enslaved people.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it includes recommendations for reparations and benefits that could indirectly support economic stability for impacted communities.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2029 an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill mandates increased funding for the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program in Maryland, including annual appropriations from fiscal year 2020 through 2029, with a focus starting in fiscal year 2023 on awarding grants for mobile crisis teams.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing behavioral health crises and local jurisdictions implementing crisis response systems
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on behavioral health crisis response and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Baltimore City and Takoma Park - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization of Pilot Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Baltimore City, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring that 50% of the fines collected under the Act be distributed to the local management board and be used only for certain youth programming; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in certain school zones in Baltimore City and Takoma Park as part of a pilot program, with revenue from fines used for youth programs and safety initiatives.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation and the City of Takoma Park, in coordination with the Maryland State Highway Administration.
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and youth in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, especially those in school zones.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts traffic enforcement and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure - U Nonimmigrant Status Petitions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the individuals eligible to request a certain official to certify victim helpfulness relating to certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the time periods within which a certain certifying entity shall certify or decline a certain form under certain circumstances; requiring a certifying entity to develop protocols to assist certain petitioners to take certain actions.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the certification process for U Nonimmigrant Status petitions in Maryland, including who can request certification, the timelines for certifying entities, and the development of protocols to assist petitioners with limited English proficiency.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement agencies, State's Attorneys, and other authorities responsible for criminal detection, investigation, or prosecution.
stakeholders: Victims of qualifying crimes seeking U Nonimmigrant Status, their families, and legal representatives.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates or related programs.

Title: Courtroom Security - Minimum Adequate Security
Synopsis: Requiring each law enforcement agency, department, or entity providing security at a courthouse facility to submit a report by September 30, 2025, to the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland; requiring the report include the current number of court security officers available, the minimum number needed to meet adequate security standards, the current number of vacancies and a viable plan to meet minimum adequate security standards as identified in the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes minimum security staffing standards for courtrooms in Maryland, requiring a certain number of security officers to be present during proceedings, with phased increases starting July 1, 2026, and July 1, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary, specifically the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland and law enforcement agencies providing courthouse security.
stakeholders: Courthouse staff, court security officers, individuals involved in court proceedings, and the general public using courthouse facilities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily impacts courthouse security staffing and does not directly relate to small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to borrow not more than $71,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to issue up to $71 million in bonds to finance the construction, improvement, and development of various public facilities, including schools, roads, parks, and public safety buildings.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Commissioners (County government)
stakeholders: Residents and users of public facilities in St. Mary's County, including students, commuters, public safety personnel, and community members.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure; it focuses on public infrastructure funding.

Title: Campaign Finance - Political Organizations - Disclosures on Solicitations (Stop Scam PACs Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain political organizations to include certain disclaimers and disclosures on certain solicitations; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to investigate a potential violation of the Act; and authorizing the State Board after the issuance of a public report of its finding to prohibit a person who violated the Act from making further solicitations for a certain period or impose a civil penalty not to exceed $10,000.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Stop Scam PACs Act, requires certain political organizations to include specific disclaimers and disclosures on solicitations, especially when using candidate names or images, or when soliciting for charitable or political purposes. It also authorizes the State Administrator of Elections to investigate potential violations and impose civil penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Political organizations, candidates, political parties, and Maryland voters
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure rates, but it could indirectly impact political organizations involved in campaign activities.

Title: Courts - Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Administrative Office of the Courts to provide expertise in artificial intelligence to the circuit courts and the District Court in the form of expert testimony on the authenticity of electronic evidence the court determines may have been created or altered using artificial intelligence; authorizing the Governor for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Maryland courts to provide expert testimony on electronic evidence created or altered using AI. It involves higher education institutions and aims to develop resources for courts, especially in civil cases without legal representation.
responsible_party: The Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Courts, legal professionals, civil litigants, higher education institutions, and individuals involved in cases with electronic evidence.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Maryland Community Action Agencies - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill to the Department of Housing and Community Development in fiscal years 2027 through 2030 as a grant to community action agencies statewide for measures to combat poverty.
bill_summary: The bill mandates increased funding for Maryland community action agencies, including annual appropriations from 2027 to 2032, to support programs combating poverty and assisting low-income populations.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income residents and community action agencies in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily targets poverty alleviation and community support, not directly impacting small business failure rates.

Title: Labor and Employment - Uninsured Employers' Fund Board - Membership and Reserves
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board; and requiring, rather than authorizing, the Board to establish reserves to meet potential losses of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the membership structure of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, requiring the Board to establish reserves to cover potential losses of the fund, and clarifies the composition and appointment process of the Board members.
responsible_party: The Maryland Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, which is part of the Maryland Department of Labor and Employment.
stakeholders: Employers, employees, insurance companies, and the general public in Maryland who are affected by workers' compensation insurance and uninsured employers' issues.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By establishing reserves and clarifying the Board's responsibilities, the bill aims to strengthen the financial stability of the Uninsured Employers' Fund, which could help reduce the failure rate of small businesses that rely on workers' compensation coverage.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Service Member Community Members (SFC Matthew Fast Act )
Synopsis: Authorizing each health care facility to screen each patient for information on whether the patient is a service member community member, include on the patient's medical record whether the patient is a service member community member, and  meet certain standards established by The Joint Commission for the purpose of improving health care equity for warrior community members; and defining "service member community member" to mean a service member, a veteran, a certain spouse, a certain child, or a certain stepchild.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care facilities in Maryland to screen patients for their status as service members, veterans, or their family members, and to include this information in medical records. It aims to improve health care equity for the warrior service member community by identifying and addressing their specific needs.
responsible_party: The Department of Veterans and Military Families and health care facilities in Maryland.
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families, and health care providers in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Elections, Financial Statements, and Enforcement
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for elections of the governing body of a condominium or homeowners association; requiring that the governing body of a condominium accommodate unit owner organizing activities relating to the governance of the condominium; prohibiting unit owners and lot owners from being charged for examining certain records of the condominium or homeowners association in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for elections, record access, and enforcement for condominiums and homeowners associations in Maryland. It mandates independent parties conduct elections, allows unit and lot owners to access certain records without charge, and expands enforcement authority of the Office of the Attorney General.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Unit owners and lot owners of condominiums and homeowners associations in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions primarily focus on transparency and fair elections, which can improve governance but do not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Calvert County Sheriff - Deputy Sheriffs and Correctional Deputies - Collective Bargaining
Synopsis: Providing that full-time deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies at the rank of major and below in the Calvert County Sheriff's Office have the right to organize and negotiate with the County Administrator of Calvert County and the Calvert County Sheriff with regard to certain wages and employee benefits in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill grants certain deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Calvert County the right to organize and negotiate with county authorities regarding wages and employee health care premium share through collective bargaining.
responsible_party: Calvert County Sheriff’s Office, County Commissioners, and the Sheriff of Calvert County
stakeholders: Deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Calvert County, county government, and the residents of Calvert County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for collective bargaining and negotiated agreements could improve employment stability for deputies, potentially reducing turnover and failure related to staffing issues.

Title: Health Benefit Plans - Calculation of Cost-Sharing Contribution - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring administrators, carriers, and pharmacy benefits managers to include certain cost sharing amounts paid by or on behalf of an enrollee or a beneficiary when calculating the enrollee's or beneficiary's contribution to a cost sharing requirement for certain health care services; providing that the calculation requirement does not apply to enrollees in certain high-deductible health plans; requiring third parties that pay certain financial assistance to provide certain notification to an enrollee; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to include discounts, financial assistance, and other out-of-pocket expenses when calculating cost-sharing contributions for prescription drugs. It also mandates notification to enrollees about financial assistance and prohibits coverage terms from being conditioned on the availability of such assistance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insured individuals and enrollees in health benefit plans in Maryland, especially those using prescription drugs with financial assistance programs.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to reduce financial barriers for patients, which could lead to better medication adherence and health outcomes, potentially decreasing small business failure related to health costs and insurance issues.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that the Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual correction bill that amends various sections of Maryland law to fix technical errors, obsolete references, and organizational issues across multiple articles, including those related to business, health, environment, education, and public safety.
responsible_party: The Department of Legislative Services is responsible for implementing the corrections and updates to the Maryland Annotated Code.
stakeholders: The population impacted includes Maryland residents, businesses, educational institutions, health care providers, environmental agencies, and government entities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's corrections and clarifications aim to streamline legal processes and update references, which can indirectly support small business stability by reducing legal ambiguities and ensuring current regulations are clear.

Title: Labor and Employment - Unpaid Parental Leave - Definition of Employer
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "employer" to exclude employers who are covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act for the current year from being required to provide to employees a certain unpaid parental leave benefit in the State.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the definition of 'employer' for unpaid parental leave requirements in Maryland, excluding employers who are covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act from being required to provide unpaid parental leave.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant state employment agency
stakeholders: Employers with 15 to 49 employees in Maryland and their employees, particularly those eligible for parental leave
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying employer obligations and potentially reducing compliance burdens for certain employers, the bill may help small businesses avoid legal issues and financial penalties, thereby reducing failure risk.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; prohibiting a 4-year or 2-year private institution of higher education or a regional higher education center operated by a private nonprofit institution of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program; and authorizing the Governor in certain fiscal years to include $150,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program to support food security initiatives at Maryland higher education institutions, including designating certain campuses as hunger–free and providing funding for programs like food pantries and emergency assistance.
responsible_party: The Maryland Higher Education Commission (MHEC) is responsible for implementing the programs.
stakeholders: Students attending Maryland higher education institutions, especially those facing food insecurity.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on food security for students and does not directly impact small business failure rates.

Title: Howard Community College - Board of Trustees, Meetings, and Contracts - Alterations Ho. Co. 1-25
Synopsis: Adding two members to the Board of Community College Trustees for Howard County; requiring each meeting of the Board to allow for public comment; requiring the Board to make a video or audio recording of its meetings which are to be made available on the Board's website; requiring Board members to undergo certain training specific to Board governance; and requiring the Board to submit a report to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and every 6 months thereafter until a contract is finalized, on the status of the faculty union contract.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the governance and oversight of Howard Community College by increasing the number of trustees, establishing meeting and training requirements, implementing annual employee satisfaction surveys, and setting transparency and contract renewal procedures for the college president.
responsible_party: Howard Community College Board of Trustees and the Howard County Senate Delegation
stakeholders: Employees, students, and residents of Howard County, Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure, but its focus on transparency, governance, and employee satisfaction could indirectly support a stable college environment that benefits the local economy.

Title: Municipalities - Enforcement of Ordinances and Resolutions
Synopsis: Increasing from $1,000 to $5,000 the maximum amount of a criminal fine or municipal infraction that may be imposed by a municipality to enforce certain ordinances and resolutions enacted by the municipality.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum fines that municipalities in Maryland can impose for violations of local ordinances and resolutions, raising the cap from $1,000 to $5,000 for both criminal misdemeanors and civil infractions.
responsible_party: Municipal governments and local legislative bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Municipalities, residents, and businesses within Maryland municipalities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus is on municipal fines and infractions, which are unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Claims Application Form - Authorization for Release of Information
Synopsis: Altering the entities to which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application filed with the Workers' Compensation Commission to include the Uninsured Employers' Fund and the Subsequent Injury Fund; altering the information which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application to include additional claims filed by the claimant and information in the custody of the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's workers' compensation law to specify the entities to which claimants must authorize the release of medical and financial information when filing claims, including clarifying the scope and duration of such authorizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers’ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Workers who file workers' compensation claims and their employers, insurers, and legal representatives.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By clarifying and streamlining the process for releasing information in workers' compensation claims, the bill may reduce administrative burdens and delays, potentially lowering the risk of small business failures related to workers' compensation issues.

Title: Department of Human Services - Study on Private Treatment Foster Care Homes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to conduct a study to determine the types of State support that would be appropriate and beneficial to assist private providers of treatment foster care homes in the provision of services; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to review and reallocate part of its budget to provide child care stipends to private treatment foster care homes, similar to public ones. It also mandates a study to determine the types of state support beneficial for private providers of treatment foster care.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Private treatment foster care homes, children in foster care, and their families in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support private treatment foster care providers by providing funding and support, which could help reduce the failure rate of small private foster care businesses.

Title: Electronic Smoking Devices - Seizure and Wholesaler Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Executive Director of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to seize electronic smoking devices that are sold or offered for sale in violation of certain provisions of law without a warrant; establishing procedures for the return of certain property seized by the Executive Director; establishing certain record-keeping requirements for electronic smoking devices wholesaler distributors and wholesaler importers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to seize illegal electronic smoking devices and tobacco products without a warrant, establishes record-keeping and licensing requirements for electronic smoking device businesses, and sets procedures for the return, destruction, and regulation of seized products.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Electronic smoking device manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers, vape shop vendors, and consumers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill introduces licensing and record-keeping requirements that could help legitimate businesses comply with laws, potentially reducing small business failures related to legal violations.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify an occupant in default at least 10 days before conducting a sale of the occupant's property stored in the self-storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address; and requiring the operator of a self-storage facility to send a second notice if no response has been received 5 days prior to the sale.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law regarding the sale of personal property in self-service storage facilities, specifically requiring operators to notify occupants of default and sale details through specified methods, including electronic mail, and to advertise sales in multiple ways.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or the self-service storage facility operators (as the implementing agencies)
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility occupants and operators in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for clear notification and advertising may help reduce disputes and legal issues, potentially decreasing small business failures related to storage facility operations.

Title: Business Regulation - Cellular Phone Carriers - Authorized Users
Synopsis: Requiring a cellular phone carrier to allow a customer of record who is responsible for payment of an account to have the option to designate other individuals as authorized users on the customer's account and to allow an authorized user to take certain actions in connection with the account.
bill_summary: The bill requires cellular phone carriers in Maryland to include an option in their service contracts that allows multiple individuals to be designated as authorized users, who can then modify or cancel the contract if all record customers agree in writing. It also mandates that customers can designate authorized users who can purchase services or devices and take actions under the contract.
responsible_party: Maryland cellular phone carriers and their customer service departments
stakeholders: Cellular phone customers in Maryland, especially those who want to authorize others to manage their accounts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on small business failure rates, as it primarily regulates cellular service contracts and authorized user options.

Title: Mold - Landlord Requirements and Regulations (Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of General Services to develop a certain pamphlet and website; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain information at certain times and in a certain manner; requiring a landlord to perform a mold assessment and mold remediation within 15 days after receipt of a written notice regarding the detection of mold; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act requires state agencies to develop educational materials and establish standards for mold assessment and remediation, and mandates landlords to inform tenants about mold and address mold issues within specific timeframes.
responsible_party: The Department of the Environment, in coordination with the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of General Services.
stakeholders: Tenants in rental properties and landlords in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on standardized mold assessment and remediation practices, along with educational resources, aims to reduce mold-related issues that can cause property damage and tenant disputes, potentially decreasing small business failures related to property management.

Title: Cyber Maryland Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Transferring the Cyber Maryland Program from the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to the Maryland Department of Labor; altering the duties of the Program; requiring the Program to issue competitive grants and contracts beginning in fiscal year 2026, to enhance cybersecurity workforce development, including cybersecurity for operational technology; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027 and each fiscal year thereafter to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation sufficient to run the program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Cyber Maryland Program by transferring it to the Maryland Department of Labor, expanding its duties to include awarding grants and contracts to enhance cybersecurity workforce development, and establishing a Cyber Maryland Fund to support various cybersecurity initiatives and programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Cybersecurity workforce, employers, educational institutions, veterans, and small businesses in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to support small businesses through cybersecurity clinics, training, and assessments, which can help reduce cybersecurity-related failures and vulnerabilities.

Title: Department of the Environment - Community Water and Sewerage Systems - Cybersecurity Planning and Assessments
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to coordinate, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, cybersecurity efforts within community water systems and community sewerage systems; establishing the roles and responsibilities of various State agencies with respect to regulating, assessing, and promoting cybersecurity efforts within the water and wastewater sector; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to coordinate cybersecurity efforts for community water and sewerage systems, establish standards, require incident reporting, and promote cybersecurity awareness and training within the water sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment, Department of Information Technology, Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Community water and sewerage system providers, local governments, and residents served by these systems in Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity standards and incident reporting for water systems can help prevent failures caused by cyberattacks, thereby reducing small business failures in the water sector.

Title: Governor's Office for Children - Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland - Grant Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 through 2030 to the Governor's Office for Children to provide grants to fund operating expenses for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that starting in fiscal year 2027 and continuing through 2030, the Maryland state government must allocate $250,000 annually to the Governor's Office for Children to fund grants supporting the operations of the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office for Children
stakeholders: Children and families served by the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small businesses or their failure rates.

Title: Office of Social Equity - Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund - Modifications
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Office of Social Equity to report on the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund and to solicit public input on the uses of the Fund and publish a review of the input; requiring the Office to oversee the appropriation of funds from the Fund and to train Fund recipients; altering certain limitations on the use of the Fund; limiting certain administrative costs to administer the Fund to a certain amount; requiring counties to administer funds from the Fund in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund, managed by the Office of Social Equity, to support community-based initiatives benefiting communities disproportionately impacted by cannabis law enforcement. It creates a Community Reinvestment and Repair Advisory Board to oversee fund distribution, mandates counties to develop plans for fund use, and allocates revenue from cannabis taxes to fund programs such as behavioral health, education, housing, transportation, and job training.
responsible_party: Office of Social Equity within the Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by cannabis law enforcement, community-based organizations, and residents of Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily focuses on social equity and community reinvestment programs, with limited direct impact on small business failure rates.

Title: Environment - Packaging and Paper Products - Producer Responsibility Plans
Synopsis: Requiring certain producers of covered materials, individually or as part of a producer responsibility organization, to submit a certain covered materials producer responsibility plan to the Department of the Environment for review and approval on or before July 1, 2028, and every 5 years thereafter, in accordance with certain requirements, or to develop an alternative collection program; requiring a producer responsibility organization to pay certain costs to the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a producer responsibility program for packaging materials and paper products in Maryland. It requires producers to submit responsibility plans, develop recycling and waste reduction goals, and fund recycling infrastructure. The bill also creates oversight, reporting, and enforcement mechanisms, and aims to increase recycling rates, reduce packaging waste, and promote sustainable packaging design.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers of packaging and paper products, local governments, recycling service providers, and residents of Maryland.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides a structured framework for recycling and waste reduction, which could help small businesses by creating clear guidelines and potential financial support for recycling infrastructure and programs.

Title: Public Schools - High School Sports Officials - Payment and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for local school systems that issue invitations for bids for high school sports officiating services for boys' and girls' high school sports; authorizing the Department of Education to develop guidelines to assist a local school system in the implementation of the provisions of the Act, including additional criteria for determining which high school sports qualify as similar boys' and girls' high school sports.
