bill_summary: The bill establishes procurement and pay parity requirements for high school sports officiating services in Maryland, including the development of a list of similar sports for boys and girls, and mandates equal pay for officials in similar roles for similar sports.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education, in consultation with the Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association
stakeholders: High school sports officials, school athletic programs, students participating in high school sports, and school districts
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's focus on procurement and pay parity aims to create a more standardized and fair process for sports officiating services, which could reduce disputes and inconsistencies that might lead to business failures among officiating organizations.

Title: Health Insurance - Medicare Supplement Policies - Insurance Producer Commission
Synopsis: Requiring a carrier to pay the same commission rates to an insurance producer for the sale of certain Medicare supplement policies without regard to whether the policies are sold during an open enrollment period, as underwritten policies, or under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland insurance carriers to pay the same commission rates to insurance producers for selling Medicare supplement policies, regardless of whether the policies are sold during a guaranteed issue period, open enrollment, as underwritten policies, or under specific law provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland insurance carriers and insurance producers
stakeholders: Medicare beneficiaries, insurance producers, and insurance carriers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: By standardizing commission rates, the bill aims to reduce financial uncertainty for insurance producers, which could help small insurance businesses remain viable.

Title: Municipalities - Legislative Audit - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting a municipality with annual revenues below $100,000 from a certain audit requirement; clarifying that a certain audit exemption does not affect certain financial reporting requirements; and authorizing the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee to request or require certain municipalities to conduct a review or audit of their financial records if the financial report indicates a financial or accounting irregularity or concern.
bill_summary: The bill exempts municipalities in Maryland with annual revenues below $100,000 from mandatory annual financial audits, allowing them to be audited once every four years unless the Legislative Auditor determines more frequent audits are necessary. It clarifies that this exemption does not affect the municipality's obligation to file financial reports and allows the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee to request or require reviews or audits if irregularities are found.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services and the Legislative Auditor
stakeholders: Municipalities in Maryland with low annual revenues, local government officials, and residents of those municipalities
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill primarily affects small municipalities' audit requirements and does not directly address small business failure rates.

Title: Howard County - Patuxent River Wildland - Use of Mechanical or Motorized Equipment Ho. Co. 5-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to use mechanical or motorized equipment to retain, maintain, remove, or replace existing trails and remove, replace, or dispose of nonnative species within the Patuxent River Wildland to ensure clear and safe access to the wildland.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to use mechanical or motorized equipment within the Patuxent River Wildland for maintenance, preservation, and ecological research, including maintaining paths and removing nonnative species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public and ecological communities interested in the preservation and enjoyment of the Patuxent River Wildland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly address small business failure reduction, but it allows for maintenance activities that could support local ecological tourism and related small businesses.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from three to five the membership of the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County; altering the eligibility requirements for Board membership; requiring the Board to adopt and publish a certain ethics policy; prohibiting the Board from using certain information as a factor in determining whether to issue or renew a license; requiring the Board to submit a report on the racial breakdown of the disciplinary actions taken by the Board to the General Assembly each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes several changes to the Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners, including increasing its membership to five, updating appointment procedures, requiring the adoption of an ethics policy, and adding transparency measures such as including race and ethnicity options on license applications and reporting disciplinary actions annually.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses that hold or seek liquor licenses in Anne Arundel County, applicants for licenses, and residents of Anne Arundel County
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill aims to improve transparency and ethics in licensing, which could create a more stable environment for small businesses, but it does not directly target small business failure rates.

Title: Local Government - Accommodations Intermediaries - Hotel Rental Tax - Collection by Comptroller and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring certain accommodations intermediaries to collect and remit the hotel rental tax to the Comptroller rather than to each county; providing for the administration of the hotel rental tax by the Comptroller; providing that certain provisions of State law prevail over certain local laws or agreements related to the hotel rental tax; repealing the authority of certain counties to provide for certain exemptions from the hotel rental tax; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires accommodations intermediaries to collect and remit hotel rental taxes directly to the Maryland Comptroller instead of to individual counties, and makes various adjustments to hotel tax laws and procedures across multiple counties and municipalities.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Hotels, accommodations intermediaries, short-term rental platforms, and travelers in Maryland counties and municipalities.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill streamlines tax collection processes for accommodations intermediaries, potentially reducing compliance costs and administrative burdens, which may help small businesses avoid failure due to tax-related issues.

Title: Natural Resources - Maryland Heritage Areas Authority - Funding and Grants
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority to award grants and loans to certain entities for the management of certified heritage areas under certain circumstances; establishing a maximum funding amount of $300,000 for certain grants, not to exceed 80% of the estimated project cost; decreasing from 10% to 7%, or $600,000, whichever amount is greater, the percentage of Program Open Space funds transferred to the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority Financing Fund that may be used for certain operating expenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority to award grants and loans for managing, developing, and interpreting certified heritage areas, and adjusts funding and operational rules for the Authority, including the use of Program Open Space funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Heritage Areas Authority
stakeholders: Entities managing or involved in certified heritage areas, local communities, and the general public interested in heritage and cultural preservation.
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill's provisions for grants and loans, along with technical assistance, are likely to support heritage area management and revitalization, which can help small businesses within these areas.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - License Extension
Synopsis: Extending until the end of July 1, 2026, the expiration of an alcoholic beverages license issued for the 5700 block of Falls Road in Baltimore City for transfer and renewal purposes.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration date of a specific alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City to allow for transfer and renewal until July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Authority or relevant local licensing department
stakeholders: Businesses holding the specific license in Baltimore City and the local government
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill provides additional time for license transfer and renewal, which can help prevent business failure due to licensing issues.

Title: Baltimore County and Baltimore City - Vehicle Laws - Lighting on Privately Owned Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing not more than five of the highest ranking officers from certain nonprofit volunteer emergency medical services organizations located in Baltimore County and Baltimore City to have their privately owned vehicles equipped with red or red and white lights or signal devices which may be displayed only while on route to or at the scene of an emergency.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain volunteer emergency medical services organizations in Baltimore County and Baltimore City to allow their top officers to equip their privately owned vehicles with red or red and white lights for use only while responding to or at the scene of an emergency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (implied as the implementing agency for vehicle lighting regulations)
stakeholders: Volunteer emergency medical service officers and organizations in Baltimore County and Baltimore City
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill does not directly impact small business failure rates, as it pertains to volunteer emergency services and vehicle lighting regulations.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 5 Breweries - On-Premises Consumption
Synopsis: Increasing the percentage of beer not produced by the holder of a Class 5 brewery license that the license holder is permitted to sell for on-premises consumption if the holder also holds an applicable on-site consumption permit or a Class D license.
bill_summary: The bill increases the percentage of beer not produced by a Class 5 brewery license holder that can be sold for on-premises consumption, allowing more flexibility for breweries to sell beer brewed at other locations under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Commission (or local licensing boards)
stakeholders: Class 5 breweries and their customers in Maryland
decrease_small_business_failure_summary: The bill could help small breweries by allowing them to sell a higher percentage of beer brewed elsewhere, potentially increasing sales and reducing the risk of failure.
